loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia and her family live a simple life in the town of Sara in Iloilo, Philippines. She is married and has two adult children. Eufemia is a 54-year-old woman who dreams to uplift their livelihood. She also wants to save money for the future.

They earn a living by raising pigs. They also raise chickens and ducks as well. She is also engaged in buying and selling dried fish for additional income to be able to enhance their livelihood.

Eufemia is asking a loan for additional capital to buy piglets and feed. Aside from this, she will buy dried fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Ofumane

texts.pt: O Sr Ofumane é militar vive maritalmente e pai de 3 filhos a esposa tambem  é funcionaria do Estado,Embora os dois trabalham o salario não tem sido suficiente para cobrir com as despesas de casa,levou muito tempo para construir sua moradia devido a fraca capacidade financeira do casal. Atravez de um vizinho o sr Ofumane conheceu a Hluvuku e aproximou se para solicitar um emprestimo para para compra de blocos,cimento,areia e pedra para fazer acabamentos da sua casa.O seu maior sonho é casar se oficialmente. Seu maior desafio é adiquirir um financiamento para compra de uma camioneta .
texts.en:
Ofumane is in the military. He lives with his wife and is the father of three children. His wife also works for the state. Though they both work, their salary is not enough to cover the household bills. Ofumane spent a long time on the construction of his home due to the couple's slim finances.

Ofumane found out about Hluvuku through a neighbour. He applied to them for a loan to buy concrete blocks, cement, sand and stones to carry out home improvements.

Ofumane's greatest dream is to get married officially. His biggest challenge is to acquire a loan to buy a van.

loans.use: to buy concrete blocks, cement, sand and stones to carry out home improvements

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a married woman who engages in various businesses to earn a living. She owns a sari-sari store that sells drinking liquor, soft drinks, candies, chips, biscuits, bread, sugar, coffee, powdered milk and juice, canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs, cooking oil, toiletries and laundry soap. She also sells purified water and engages in a rice retailing business. Aside from this, she runs a piggery.

Elsa is 49 years old and a mother of four children. She dreams of a peaceful and simple living, and wishes good health to her family. In the future, she also dreams of succeeding in her business to enhance their livelihood.

She is asking a loan to buy grocery items. She will also use the loan for additional capital for her rice retailing business and to buy piglets.

loans.use: to buy liquor, soft drinks, candies, chips, biscuits, bread, sugar, coffee, powdered milk and juice, canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs, cooking oil, rice and piglets.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is a 47-year-old woman who earn a living by doing a sari-sari store business and retailing rice. She has been doing this business for almost 20 years, and became proficient in this field. She is determined to continue doing this business, hoping for some improvements in the future.

She is asking a loan to help her buy additional stock such as soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, spices, sugar, powdered milk, powdered juice, coffee, toiletries, chips, biscuits, bread and candies. She will also buy sacks of rice for retail.

Marlyn is from Ajuy, Iloilo, and she is married, with four children. Her oldest school-aged child is 20 years old, while her youngest child is 5 years old.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, spices, sugar, powdered milk, powdered juice, coffee, toiletries, chips, biscuits, bread and candies and sacks of rice.

loans.name: Silva

texts.en:
Silva and her family live in the town of Ajuy in Iloilo, Philippines. She is a 47-year-old woman and a mother of five children: one adult and four school-aged children, ages 21, 18, 15 and 8 years old.

Her husband is a laborer while Silva is engaged in a sari-sari store business. They work hard together to earn a living and to provide the needs of their family.

In the future, Silva wishes to upgrade their livelihood to have a better means of living and to give a good education to her children.

She is asking a loan to buy assorted grocery items such as powdered milk, powdered chocolate drink, soap, toiletries, laundry soap, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, chips, biscuits, candies, noodles and canned goods.

loans.use: to buy powdered milk, powdered chocolate drink, soap, toiletries, laundry soap, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, chips, biscuits, candies, noodles and canned goods.

loans.name: Filloreta

texts.en:
Filloreta wants to thank lenders for the previous help in obtaining a loan to start her new hair salon. Unfortunately, she was not successful in her business because she ended up falling ill and had to spend a lot of money for medical treatments.

Now she is requesting a loan for the second time, so that she can purchase a milking cow. She plans to sell the milk and the dairy products in her neighborhood.

She is very optimistic that she will be able to generate a good income and is hoping that she will be able to have a baby in the near future. She thanks all the lenders for both of the loans.

loans.use: To purchase a milking cow to sell the milk and the dairy products

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
A buy-and-sell business earns profit from buying products at a low price and selling the same at a higher price. The entrepreneur’s skills on finding network manufacturers and suppliers who offer low prices for their products is one major key on the success of this business, as well as the capacity to expand the market. The products may range from cheap rags to expensive condominiums or a house and a lot, depending on the entrepreneur’s capital.

Lorna, 53, is buying and selling of silver accessories. She has contact dealers from whom she can get the products at lower prices. She will then sell the accessories directly to her friends, neighbors and relatives. To her advantage, her chosen products do not decay or rot, but these are expensive items. It requires more capital to continue.

Now that she plans to buy more silver items to sell, she would like to borrow a supplementary capital amounting to PhP 50,000. She already has target buyers for these, so hopefully her request will be granted soon. It’s her desire to have a display area or stall inside a safe commercial center where buyers can easily locate her.

Lorna is living with Pedro, a supervisor, in Talisay City, Cebu. She dreams of a comfortable life someday so she can extend blessings to deprived people. She is committed to CCT Credit Cooperative’s vision to alleviate poverty and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more silver accessories to sell.

loans.name: Bibigul

texts.ru: Бибигул прекрасная женщина, труд которой нужно по достоинству оценить. Она работает в доме престарелых в городе Курган-Тюбе. Ей 50 лет и у нее трое детей и одна невестка. Работа в доме престарелых требует большой физической силы и  усердия. Однако в последнее время Бибигул жалуется на свое плохое здоровье. Ей необходимо полностью обследоваться. Но, к сожалению, достаточных средств для этого у нее нет. Она обращается к Вам за помощью, так как без полного выздоровления она сама не сможет помогать старым людям. Пожалуйста, поддержите ее в благородном намерение.
texts.en: Bibigul is a wonderful woman whose hard work must be appreciated. She works in a nursing home in the city of Qurgan-Tube. She is 50 years old and she has three children and a daughter-in-law. Work in a nursing home demands great physical strength and diligence. However, recently Bibigul has been complaining of poor health. She needs a thorough examination, but unfortunately she does not have sufficient funds for this. She is turning to you for help, since she will not be able to help the old people without completely recovering. Please support her with good intentions.

loans.use: to pay for medical treatment.

loans.name: Elinor

texts.en:
Elinor is a 60-year-old married woman with seven grown children. She resides in the town of Tolosa, Leyte.

She sells rtw (ready-to-wear) clothing like t-shirts, blouses, shorts, pants and ladies jeans.
Aside from engaging in the rtw business, she also sells tuba (coconut) wine. She sells tuba (coconut) wine to the locals in her area. During her spare time, Elinor also prepares and sells home meals.

She would like to improve, and able to expand, by having adequate funds to support her existing livelihoods.

Elinor has requested a loan to buy more stock of rtw, tuba (coconut wine) and ingredients like meat and vegetables. With these, slowly she could have enough capital to finance her current sources of living and start to settle her obligations.

She is hoping that someday she can improve the living condition of the family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rtw (ready-to-wear), tuba (coconut wine), and ingredients like meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
From Talisay City, Cebu, here is Elsa, who is busy with her water distribution service and sale of frozen goods. She is married to Antonio, a security officer, and they have children, the youngest of whom is already in college.

It’s impressive how she manages her household and her enterprises. For her, it’s just a matter of time management and proper balancing of budget. She says it’s not right to spend without limit; rather an individual should learn how to keep some amount for times of emergencies.

Elsa knows that profits are irregular due to stiff competition. This is the reason she dreams of enhancing her business. She plans to buy more containers of water in different sizes, those that can fit into water dispensers and those with built-in faucets. In this way, she can increase the number of prospective buyers. She will also buy additional stock of frozen foods to sell. She knocks at your kind hearts for a loan assistance of PHP 40,000 to meet this purpose.

Eventually, she plans to put up a water refilling station and venture into another enterprise such as the sale of soft drinks and beverages.

Elsa is a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through religion.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more containers of water in different sizes.

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
Edita is living in the town of Tolosa, Leyte. She is a married woman with three grown children.

She has been raising hogs for two years now. This is her main source of income. Aside from hog raising, she also cooks and sells meals as an additional source of income. Her husband is a laborer.

She is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients for food vending and purchase feed for the animals.

These are very essential tools for improvement as they could boost both her sources of income.

In the long run, Edita could sell healthy hogs and slowly settle her finances.

She is determined that someday, with hard work and determination to be financially stable, she will become successful.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for food vending and purchase feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is 62 years old and married with five children. She lives in a rural community outside Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands. She runs a bakery business in her community selling sweet cakes and muffins to earn living and has been doing this for one year.

Beverly requested a loan to buy ingredients, baking utensils and an oven to help assist her run the business. She hopes to provide better living for her family with the profit she makes and also help cover her family's daily expenses.

She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cooking oil, trays, dish and an oven for her bakery business.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 42 years old and married with one child. She lives in a rural community outside of Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands. She raises and sells pigs in her community and to restaurants to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years.

Hellen needs a loan to buy piglets and pig feed to help her maintain the number of pigs she must have to run the business. She plans to use her profits to improve her piggery business and also help cover her family's weekly expenses.

She has been a SPBD member since 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed for her piggery business.

loans.name: Ndidi Group

texts.en:
Ndidi is a 37-year-old woman. She lives with her husband and two children. Although she is a nurse by profession and presently serving in the rural health center, she still spends her weekends at the local palm oil mill, where she engages in palm kernel processing. Extra income from the palm kernel sales helps her to balance her small salary. She is very excited to have been among those to benefit from Nke-Anyi Ndu-Oma loan product.

A portion of this loan will help her purchase more bags of kernels this season and also make more income to support her husband in caring for their family.

She thanks all the Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to process and store palm oil products.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma owns a carenderia (a small restaurant) in Ormoc City, Leyte. This business was started three years ago. Aside from this food business, she is also a meat vendor.

She is asking a loan to buy more meat that she can sell, and also seasoning and condiments for her menu.

This business allow Norma to take care of her family well, to help her husband who is a driver , and for her 18-year-old son.

In the future, she hope to further expand her business and to introduce more menu items in her carenderia for better sustainability.

loans.use: to buy more meat, seasoning and condiments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more mats to sell.

loans.name: Dúo Villa Lobos 3 Group

texts.es:
DUO VILLA LOBOS 3
La señora Martha Josefa es madre de 6  hijos es propietaria de un comedor ubicada en el sector de villa lobos II la venta  que ella administra tiene 4 años de tenerla cuando ella empezó poco a poco creció aun mas porque ella empezó a vender choco bananos pero con la ayuda de Dios ella le ha dado una buena administración y ha logrado crecerla aun más. Testifica ella que le beneficia porque vende bien y le puede dar un mejor servicio a los clientes para que lleguen a comer y ya es muy conocida, ella tiene sueños y metas muy grandes para tener mejor a sus hijos y su negocio 
Ella le da gracias a fape y KIVA por los prestamos q ellos le han brindado esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de comidas par vender.
texts.en:
Villa Lobos 3 duo

Martha Josefa is the mother of 6 children and the owner of an eatery located in the Villa Lobos II sector. The eatery she runs she has had for 4 years. When she began, little by little it grew even more because she began to sell chocolate bananas but with the help of God she has run it well and has managed to grow it even more. She explains that she benefits from it because she makes good sales and she can give better service to the customers so that they come to eat and she is already well-known. She has very large dreams and goals to have the best for her children and her business.

She thanks FAPE and Kiva for the loans that they have offered her. She is asking for this loan to purchase supplies to make food to sell.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to make food to sell.

loans.name: Lenita

texts.en:
This is the humble boarding house that Lenita rents out to students and minimum wage earners in Matina, Davao City. Its rental fee is much cheaper compared to other boarding houses and apartments, but it’s still cozy. The woven bamboo walls allow fresh air to come in compared to concrete walls.

Lenita has another income generating venture which is the selling of livestock feed. Though she has limited stocks, it still augments her family’s daily needs. Her husband, Salvador, works as a welder. Among their four children, one is already working, one is staying at home helping in the household chores, and two are studying in college. The whole family’s concerted efforts are geared towards their dream of enjoying a more comfortable life someday.

Lenita aspires to improve her boarding house by replacing some worn out roofing and enclosing some open spaces to adapt in this rainy season. She will buy galvanized iron sheets, ply boards, and other construction materials. She is requesting a PHP 29,000 loan for this purpose. Part of it will be allotted for additional sacks of livestock feed that she can sell.

Lenita is committed to CCT Credit Cooperative’s vision to alleviate poverty and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy galvanized iron sheets, ply boards, and other construction materials

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from San Miguel, Bohol. Her eldest is 13 and the youngest is 2.

She has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than three years now. This is the source of her income.

Jovelyn is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise, and feed for the pigs. Through this loan, she will be able to improve her hog-raising business, thus augmenting her income and profits for her young children.

Her income will be for her children's healthy diet and school fees.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela is a married woman and a mother of five children. She is 53 years old and lives in San Miguel, Bohol. She has been in the sari-sari (variety) store business for many years now. This is the source of her income. Aside from this, she also engages in the buying and selling of bananas.

Manuela is asking for a loan to purchase additional merchandise like feed, rice, prepaid mobile loads, bananas, canned goods and noodles. With this, she will be able to increase her stock, thus attracting more buyers to her store.

In the future, Manuela hopes to make her business more successful by buying more stock in bulk.

loans.use: to buy feed, rice, prepaid mobile loads, bananas, canned goods and noodles.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
For many years, Felicidad has shown her dedication as a member of CCT Credit Cooperative in Talisay City, Cebu. She gains valuable insights on proper management of her variety store and retailing of charcoal. Her store sells various commodities such as toiletries, canned goods, snack items, condiments, and beverages. Simultaneously she buys sacks of charcoal, repacks it per kilo, then sells it by customer order or as part of her store inventory. She really works hard in order to supplement her family’s financial resources. Her husband, Leonardo, is also working but his income doesn’t suffice for their family’s growing expenses.

The stiff competition in the variety store business affects Felicidad’s daily proceeds, yet she persists, focusing on the possible ways to improve her business. She organized her merchandise and tried to enhance the façade of her store through eye-catching paint. This time she aims to buy additional dry goods, grocery items, softdrinks, and sacks of charcoal to widen her inventory. She seeks for PHP 15,000 financial assistance. She hopes that your help will bring positive steps towards her dream of having a prolific store of dry goods in a populous area.

She prays for good health, peace and unity, with God as the center of her family. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional dry goods, grocery items, softdrinks, and sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Maria Normalita

texts.en:
Lack of stable jobs in the Philippines forces many Filipinos to leave the country to try their luck abroad. They leave behind their families in search of decent wages and greener pastures. Maria Normalita, 35, from Talisay City, Cebu endures the situation of being away from her husband, Michael, who is working in another country. Their 2 children are left in her care and guidance. It’s difficult for a family to be separated from each other; but they keep on, holding the inspiration to uplift their lives, ensure the education and future of their children, and gain the capacity to help other people someday.

Maria Normalita keeps herself busy instead of feeling lonely. She focuses her attention on her variety store business with adjacent small canteen. Just recently she opened a canteen inside a public school and she hired 2 helpers to man it. As it is still recovering from start-up costs, she longs for supplementary capital worth PHP 30,000 to buy additional kitchen wares and dining wares to meet the increasing demand of students. She will also add more supplies to her variety store. She gradually works towards her goal of having a grocery store and restaurant someday. She prays that her income will be sufficient enough for her family’s expenses so that her husband can stay with them in the near future.

Maria Normalita draws inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share stories about their lives and businesses and reflect on the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional kitchen wares, dining wares and add more supplies to her variety store.

loans.name: Ana Yamileth

texts.es:
Ana, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casada y su esposo es agricultor y tienen seis hijos, de los cuales solo dos asisten a la escuela y los otros cuatro ya están acompañados.

Ana, trabaja desde muy pequeña y aprendió a sembrar maíz y frijol, gracias a su padre quien fue agricultor toda su vida.- A parte de esta actividad trabaja elaborando tortillas de maíz y en la agricultura tiene la ayuda de su esposo y sus 2 hijos; pero quieren iniciar a criar ganado de repasto para no depender solo de la agricultura.

El crédito será invertido para comprar ganado de repasto, de esta forma se ayudará a que pueda innovar en una nueva actividad y que sus ingresos no se vean perjudicados por pérdidas agrícolas.

El sueño de Ana, es que sus hijos continúen estudiando y puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana went to school until the 9th grade and is married. Her husband is a farmer and they have 6 children. Of the children, only 2 attend school; the other 4 are already in relationships.

Ana has worked since she was very young. She learned to grow corn and beans, thanks to her father, who was a farmer all his life. In addition, she works making corn tortillas. In the farming, she has the assistance of her husband and 2 children, but they want to raise cattle for fattening so as not to depend on farming alone.

The loan will be invested to buy cattle for fattening to help her innovate in a new activity and so her income won't be hurt by agricultural losses.

Ana's dream is for her children to continue studying, and that they can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Radik

texts.en:
In Tsaghkunk village of Gegharkunik region lives Radik with his wife and two children. Radik has a specialty of tractor driving and for some time he worked at his specialty in his village, but now his only occupation is farming and agriculture.

He has cows, calves, heifers and sheep. Radik sells his farm’s milk and also a great assortment of meat (beef, pork and mutton) to city butchers who regularly during the week buy meat from his farm.

With the coming of autumn, Radik is already greatly worried about providing a lot of fodder for his farm animals. He managed to buy hay and he asked this Kiva loan in order to buy more. The loan of 700,000 Armenian drams will be used for the purchase of fodder for all his farm animals.

loans.use: purchase fodder for all his farm animals.

loans.name: Julio

texts.pt: O Sr Julio é um jovem  policia residente nas periferias da cidade de Maputo vive maritalmente com sua esposa e é pai de 2 filhos menores que frequentam  a escola. A  esposa é negociante. o salario  dele não é suficiente para cobrir com as despesas da familias e viu a necessidade  de procurar serviços financeiros para alavancar o negocio da sua esposa e foi então que conheceu a Hluvuku atraves de um seu vizinho que é cliente. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar frango congelado,palones e carne de porco.O seu maior sonho é continuar a benefeciar se dos emprestimos da Hluvuku e expandir o negocio da sua esposa de modo a garantir uma vida estavel para sua familia.O seu maior desafio é reembolsar o emprestimo sem entrar em moras.
texts.en:
Julio is a young policeman who lives on the outskirts of the city of Maputo with his wife. He is the father of two young children who go to school. His wife is a businesswoman. Julio's salary is not enough to cover the family expenses so he saw it necessary to secure financial assistance to give his wife's business a boost. He found out about Hluvuku through a neighbour who is also a client.

With this loan Julio will buy frozen chicken, baloney and pork. His greatest dream is to continue to benefit from the loans he has taken out with Hluvuku and expand his wife's business to ensure a stable life for his family. His biggest challenge is to repay his loan without falling behind with the repayments.

loans.use: to buy frozen chicken, baloney and pork to resell

loans.name: Dúo Vendedoras Exitosas Group

texts.es:
DUO VENDEDORAS EXITOSAS.
Doña Irma Yolanda es originaria de Tecpan, Guatemala ella tiene 42 años de edad bajo su responsabilidad están sus tres hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de refacción y a la crianza de animales.
El crédito que ella recibió lo invirtió en compra de artículos para cocinar sus refacciones, y también compro dos marranitos para crianza.
Gracias al apoyo de sus hijos ella sigue adelante con su negocio ya que ellos ayudan en preparar la refacción porque ella es madre soltera y vive sola con sus hijos.
Ella sueña con ampliar mas su negocio tener equipo de cocina suficiente para poder cocinar su refacción asi obtendrá mejores ganancias y mandar a sus hijos a estudiar, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de insumos para la elaboracion de refacciones para vender.
texts.en:
Vendedoras Exitosas duo.

Irma Yolanda is from Tecpan, Guatemala. She is 42 years old and in her responsibility are her three minor children. She works selling snacks and raising animals.

The loan that she got, she invested in the purchase of items to cook her snacks and she also purchased two piglets to raise.

Thanks to the support of her children, she continues on with her business since they help with the preparation of the snacks because she is a single mother and lives alone with her children.

She dreams of expanding her business more, having cooking equipment sufficient to be able to cook her snacks and to get better income and send her children to school. She is asking for this loan to purchase supplies to make snacks to sell.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to make snacks to sell.

loans.name: Divas Group

texts.es:
Mirian es una mujer de 30 años, casada, tiene 3 hijos, y su negocio es la venta de desayuno.
Ella es emprendedora, dinámica y muy buena madre. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona central, caracterizada por reunir la mayor parte de organizaciones públicas y privadas.
Mirian es trigueña de cabello castaño claro y baja estatura (la primera de la derecha, viste; blusa negra y jean). Su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español, su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de madera que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. En esta oportunidad lidera la banca de emprendimiento. Su negocio es la venta de desayuno como; api con pastel, el api es una bebida a base de maíz morado se puede beber caliente o frío, el pastel es una masa de harina frita en aceite se sirve rociada con azúcar impalpable, “reparto el desayuno a clientes en su puesto de trabajo porque algunos no pueden dejar su negocio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes continuos, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para la compra de muebles de comedor como sillas y mesas. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio, ella desea comprar muebles de comedor para dar mejor comodidad a sus clientes. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Mirian solicita un préstamo para la compra  de muebles de comedor para dar comodidad a los clientes.
texts.en:
Mirian is a 30-year-old married woman who has 3 children and her business is selling breakfasts.

She is enterprising, dynamic and a good mother. Her business is located in the central zone, characterized by joining the majority of public and private organizations.

Mirian has olive skin, light brown hair, and is short (she is the first on the right wearing a black blouse and jeans). Her native language is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her husband who works and with her children who go to school. They live in their own house, built of wood, which has all the basic services. At this time, she leads an entrepreneurial bank. Her business is selling breakfasts such as api with pastry. Api is drink with a base of purple corn which can be consumed warm or cold. The pastry is flour dough fried in oil which is served sprinkled with powdered sugar. "I serve breakfast to customers at their workplace because some can't leave their business..." she says. The advantage of her business is that it has regular customers. The disadvantage is the lack of money to purchase dining furniture such as chairs and tables. Her dream is to improve her business. She wants to purchase dining furniture to give her customers more comfort. This is her third loan cycle with the institution in the one year she has done this work.

For these reasons, Mirian asks for a loan to purchase dining furniture for the comfort of her customers.

loans.use: to purchase dining furniture for the comfort of her customers.

loans.name: Nghĩa

texts.en:
Mrs Nghĩa is 57 years old and she is married. She has been working in agriculture raising poultry for 3 years. Nghĩa lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region and the income from this business is not high enough to do what she really needs to comfort her life.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet. This is Nghĩa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She hopes that this loan could make her little dream come true. In the future, Nghĩa hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: To purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou, 44 years old, shows her small vulcanizing area in front of her house located in Calumpang, General Santos City which is a good supplementary source of her family’s livelihood. She’s been operating this business for several years now and she pays one worker to do the manual work. She’s the one who transacts with clients and vehicle owners, and performs the tasks of purchasing and cashiering. Aside from this, she also raises hogs in her backyard and retails charcoal per kilo. Her husband, Noel, on the other hand, drives a “habal-habal”. It is a single motorcycle with extended backseat (usually made of wood) which is being used to transport passengers in remote and mountainous areas. Amazingly it can accommodate 3 to 5 passengers or back riders. Their income provides for their daily expenditures and the education of their two youngest children.

Marilou needs to buy new equipment for her vulcanizing shop, but her reserved money was utilized for the seaman’s application of her son. She didn’t fickle in providing for his son’s application because her whole family believes that it’s one way to alleviate them from poverty. Hence she is seeking your heartfelt support to lend her an additional capital worth PHP 60,000. She will use this to buy new vulcanizing equipment, feed for her hogs, sacks of charcoal, and “habal-habal” spare parts. She will also set aside some amount for her son’s allowance during the seaman’s training.

Marilou dreams to see all her children graduate from college and have a brighter future. She shares her experiences with her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative who regularly meet every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy new equipment for her vulcanizing shop

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is a 33-year-old, married woman and a mother of three children ages 5, 8 and 9. She and her family live in Bien Unido, Bohol. For more than ten years, she has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband. This is the source of their income.

Dina is asking for a loan to pay for the repair of the fishing boat, buy new fish nets and fishing weights. With this loan, her husband will be able do fishing and improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. Dina wants to improve their fishing business so that it will generate more income for the school fees and school allowance of her children.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of the fishing boat, buy new fish nets and fishing weights.

loans.name: Armenuhi

texts.en:
This woman’s name is Armenuhi and she lives with her big family in Sevan city of the Gegharkunik region. Armenuhi is a mother of two sons and a daughter. Her husband works as a baker. She has vocational medical education and a specialty in nursing, but she never worked in that sphere.

For several years, Armenuhi worked as a saleswoman, but now she is a skilled farmer who runs farming very cleverly. Besides being the source of income for her family, the farm also provides fresh, tasty farm products for her children.

In her farm she has cows, calves, bulls, pigs and chickens. She sells her farm milk, meat, macun (a national dairy product), cheese and eggs to her neighbors and regular customers.

With this loan of 500,000 AMD, she will buy hay for all her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy hay for all her farm cattle.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan is 25 years old and she is married. She has been working in agriculture raising poultry for 3 years. Lan lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region and the income from this business is not high enough to do what she really needs to comfort her life.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet. This is Lan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She hopes that this loan could make her little dream come true. In the future, Lan hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Hương

texts.en:
Mrs Hương is 43 years old and she is married. She has been working in agriculture raising poultry for 5 years. Hương lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region and the income from this business is not high enough to do what she really needs to comfort her life.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet. This is Hương's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She hopes that this loan could make her little dream come true. In the future, Hương hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Tấn

texts.en:
Mr Tấn is 40 years old and he is married. He lives in Thanh Hoa city, and urban town in Thanh Hoa province. He has had a service business laying bricks for five years. His family is a low-income household in village, moreover the income from this job is unstable.

He has no collateral so he can't get a loan from other banks or credit institutions.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns him is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet.

This is Tấn first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. He hopes that this loan could make his little dream come true.

In the future, Tấn hopes for his business to do well, to make enough money to provide for his kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for his business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Verronica lives a simple life with her family in the town of Ajuy in Iloilo, Philppines. She is a 60-year-old woman and blessed with seven children who are already grown up. She and her husband work hard to earn a living. Her husband does farming while Veronica is engaged in a retailing rice business. She has been doing this for five years.

She is asking a loan to buy sacks of rice for retail.

In the future she wishes to upgrade her business for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice

loans.name: Ludyvica

texts.en:
Ludyvica is a 57-year-old woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married and has nine children. Out of these nine children, she still has three school-aged children, ages 21, 17 and 15 years old.

She needs an amount of PHP15,000 for additional capital to her sari-sari store business, which she has been running for almost a year. She will buy grocery items such as soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, toiletries, laundry soap, sugar, chips, biscuits, candies, powdered juice and powdered milk from the amount she is requesting.

She is aims for business sustainability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy  soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, toiletries, laundry soap, sugar, chips, biscuits, candies, powdered juice and powdered milk

loans.name: Melrose

texts.en:
Melrose is a 28 years old and a mother of four children ages 3, 10, 7 and 11. She and her husband work hard helping each other through their fishing business. This has been their family business for 12 years. Sometimes, Melrose even spend time selling snacks to augment their income.

She is asking a loan of PHP5,000 to pay for a house renovation so her children can live in comfort.

Melrose feels more motivated to work hard knowing that the loan will impact on their home to make it more livable for the whole family.

Her income will be for school fees for her children and the daily allowance for food at school.

loans.use: to pay for house repair

loans.name: Cristina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Cristina, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada, su esposo es comerciante y tienen 4 hijos de los cuales solo tres estudian.

Cristina, es una mujer con deseos de superación, desde que se acompañó se dedicó a realizar las labores del hogar y a cuidar de sus hijos; hace dos años y medio, con el objetivo de ayudar con los gastos del hogar, inicio con un negocio propio de venta de sorbetes y helados en su casa; cada 8 días surte su negocio con estos productos y de esta forma ha ayudado a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.

El crédito será invertido para comprar más helados para vender, así las ventas podrán ser mayores y sus ingresos podrán mejorar.

Cristina, continua teniendo el sueño de mejorar su vivienda y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Cristina went to school up to the ninth grade. She is partnered and her partner is a businessman and they have 4 children, of whom only 3 go to school.

Cristina is a woman with desire to improve her self. Since she became partnered, she has worked doing the household tasks and caring for her children. Two and a half years ago, with the goal of helping with the household expenses, she began with her own business, selling sorbets and ice creams in her house. Every week, she stocks her business with these products and in this way she has helped her partner with the household expenses.

The loan will be invested in purchasing more ice creams to sell, so the sales will be able to be more and her income will be better.

Cristina continues to have the dream of improving her house and offering a better quality of life to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more ice creams to sell.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es: Rosalina es una madre de familia muy trabajadora y comprometida para sacar adelante a su familia, ella cuenta que con el apoyo del crédito pudo comprar sus concentrados para sus pollos y a Dios gracias logro venderlos  a un buen precio en el mercado regional. Rosalina está necesitada de un nuevo crédito  pero en esta ocasión lo invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción como; cemento, arena, piedrín, para finalizar la construcción de su casa, pues su familia necesita contar con un hogar más amplio y cómodo. Su gran esperanza es finalizar lo más pronto posible la construcción de su casa.
texts.en: Rosalina is a very hard-working mother committed to getting her family ahead. She says that with the support of the loan she was able to purchase concentrated feed for her chickens and, thanks to God, she managed to sell them at a good price at the regional market. Rosalina needs another loan but this time it will be invested in the purchase of construction materials such as cement, sand, and gravel, to finish construction on her house, since her family needs to have a larger and more comfortable house. Her great hope is to finish the construction of her house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, and gravel to finish the construction of her house.

loans.name: Cheirinho

texts.pt: O senhor Cheirinho é militar,viuvo e pai de 3 filhos todos frequentam a escola,vive na sua propria .Como o salario não é suficiente para satisfazer as necessidades da sua familia sempre recorreu aos  emprestimos da hluvuku,é a quarta vez que solicita o emprestimo e pretende comprar  cimento,blocos varrões e areia para concluir sua casa.O seu maior sonho é tornar se um  empreendedor com sucesso.
texts.en:
Cheirinho is a soldier, a widower and the father of three children, all of whom go to school. He lives in his own home. As his salary is not enough to satisfy the needs of his family, he always goes to Hluvuku to take out loans. 

This is the fourth time that Cheirinho has applied for a loan. He plans to buy cement, concrete blocks, rods and sand to finish building his home. His greatest dream is to become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy cement, concrete blocks, rods and sand to finish building his home

loans.name: Lợi

texts.en:
Mr Lợi is 36 years old and he is married. Lợi lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. He has been working in agriculture, raising poultry for three years.His family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. And the income from this business is not high enough to do what he really needs to comfort his life.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns him is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet.

This is Lợi's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. He hopes that this loan could make his little dream come true.

In the future, Lợi hopes for his business to do well, for his family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for his kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Mrs Lan is 56 years old and she is married. She has been working in agriculture, raising poultry, for 8 years. Lan lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, and the market need is low in this region. The income from her poultry business is not high enough to do what she really needs to provide comfort in her life.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a new toilet. This is Lan's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan will make her little dream come true.

In the future, Lan hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 47 years old, and is married with 11 children. Four of her children are still dependents: ages 7, 9, 12, and 17. She is from Trinidad, Bohol.

Corazon farms rice for a living to support her family. She also raises hogs for additional income. She has been farming for 24 years now. She is asking for a loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizer and pollard (a type of feed) for her hogs.

Corazon knows that with fertilizer, she can be assured of a better yield on her farm. Her income will be for the family's daily consumption, school fees, and household bills. She hopes that someday she can see her children become successful with their lives.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pollard (a kind of feed).

loans.name: Rezel

texts.en:
Rezel is a 23-year-old married woman and a mother of two young children, ages 2 and 4. She is from Bien Unido, Bohol.

Rezel has been engaged in a fishing business since getting married because her husband is a fisherman. She is asking for a loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy a new engine for the boat and fishing nets for crabs. Through this, Rezel and her husband will be able to go back to fishing to earn an income.

In the future, Rezel dreams of expanding their fishing business so that it will generate more revenue. She also wants to save money to pay for the school fees of her two children in the few years to come.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her boat and fishing nets for crabs.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz and her family live a simple life in a town of Ajuy in Iloilo, Philippines. She is a married woman and has six adult children. Her husband is a laborer while she is running a sari-sari store business. She has been doing this business for a year to help her husband provide their daily expenses. Luz and her husband work hard together to earn a living.

Luz is asking for a loan for additional capital to buy grocery items such as toiletries, laundry soap, spices, cooking oil, eggs, canned goods, noodles, chips, biscuits, bread, coffee, powdered juice, and powdered chocolate drink.

In the future, Luz wishes to enhance her earnings to have better means of living.

loans.use: to buy toiletries, laundry soap, spices, cooking oil, eggs, canned goods, noodles, chips, biscuits, bread, coffee, powdered juice, and powdered chocolate drink.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia has been a dealer for Avon (a direct selling business) for 10 years. She sells Avon products like deodorant, lotion, body spray, ladies' apparel, and other household wares. She is a widowed woman with one grown child.

Arsenia decided to get this loan to purchase more stock of products and to be able to cater the orders of her customers and to be deliver on time.

Arsenia has requested a loan to buy more stocks of Avon products such as body spray, whitening soap, and ladies' accessories. These will enhance the supplies of inventory that could prevent her from running out of capital when large orders arrive.

Arsenia hopes that she can successfully manage her source of income for sustainable living and in preparation of old age.

loans.use: to buy more stock of Avon products, such as body spray, whitening soap, and ladies' accessories.

loans.name: Agbowougbo

texts.fr: Veuve femme de 48 ans, Agbowougbo est mère de quatre enfants et vit à Baguida. Agbowougbo est une marchandes de friperies, de fruits et divers qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Agbowougbo réalise une bonne rentabilité avec son activité génératrice de revenu. Agbowougbo sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des tas de pantalons, des paniers de bananes et des bols de farines de manioc en vue de bien vendre puis de gagner des bénéfices afin de venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
A widowed 48-year old woman, Agbowougo is the mother of four children and lives in Baguida. She sells sued clothes, fruits and other items wo gets her supplies three times a month at the market.

Agbowougo makes a decent profit with her revenue-making activity. She is requesting this loan to buy piles of pants, baskets of bananas and bowls of cassava flour in order to make good sales and then earn profits so as to assist with her children's school education.

loans.use: Acheter 02 tas des pantalons , 02 paniers de bananes et 20 bols de farine de manioc.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Agée de 29 ans, Ama est une femme mariée et mère de deux enfants vivant ensemble à Baguida. Pour soutenir sa famille, Ama vend des mèches et des produits alimentaires à la devanture de son domicile et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Ama réalise sa rentabilité dans son activité et pour bien satisfaire aux besoins de ses clients, Ama nécessite ce crédit pour commander des unités de mèches et des défrisants en vue d’agrandir son stock et mieux vendre puis aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire et à couvrir les besoins quotidiens de la famille.
texts.en:
Aged 29 years, Ama is a married woman and the mother of two children who all live in Baguida. To support her family, Ama sells hair extensions and food products in front of her home and gets her supplies twice a month at the market.

Ama is profitable in her activity and to be able to satisfy her clients' needs, she requires this loan to order units of hair extensions and straighteners so as to increase her stock and improve sales. Then, she will help her children in their school education and cover the family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy fourteen units of hair extensions and hair straighteners.

loans.name: Filepa

texts.en:
Felipa is a 50-year-old woman from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She engages in fishing with her husband, who is a fisherman. She also owns rice fields and operates a sari-sari store. She catches and sells shrimp, fish and crabs to earn a living.

She is asking for a loan to support her fishing business. The loan will be used to buy one bundle of screen, a fishing boat, an engine and 1,000 meters of fishing nets. This will pave the way for productive fishing for her and her husband.

In the future, she hopes to save so she can live comfortably in her old age.

loans.use: to buy one bundle of screen, a fishing boat, an engine and a 1,000 meters of fishing nets.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is 50 years old, a married woman from San Miguel, Bohol. Genara earns a living through her rice farming business and a piggery. Genara has been in this business for more than 10 years now. The businesses that she has require patience and perseverance before she can have her income. Genara is motivated to work hard knowing that she can apply for a loan.

Genara is asking for a loan to buy feed and fertilizer. Her income will be utilized for her three children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy feed and fertilizer

loans.name: Gonzala

texts.en:
Gonzala is a mother of five children, three of whom are still dependents, ages 14-19. She dreams that someday she will see them successful in their studies.

She works hard with her husband in their fishing business. Gonzala works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of her children.

Gonzala is asking for a loan to buy a new engine for their boat. With this, she can maximize the productivity of her business. Any income generated will be for food and tuition fees.

loans.use: to buy a new engine

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a farmer from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. In addition to farming, he recently expanded to fish vending and selling of dried fish. He works hard for his two children, who are still attending school.

He has requested a loan to purchase fresh fish, dried fish to sell, and fertilizer for his farm.

Jose hopes to have a successful business so he can give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, fresh fish and dried fish

loans.name: Nemesiana

texts.en:
Nemesiana is a farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. In this town, most people rely on farming to earn a living. She grows bananas and she farms rice to support her family. She works hard for her two children. Aside from farming she also takes bread from a bakery and delivers it to other small stores.

Nemesiana is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. This loan will take care of her crops' yield.

Nemesiana hopes to live a life in comfort in the years to come. She is 62 years old.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr: Bintou est une femme Malienne âgée de 37ans. C’est elle qui a la corde du mouton à main sur la photo.  Elle  est mariée,  mère de 6 enfants , dont les  5 sont tous à l’école. Leur âge varie de 3 à 19ans. Elle vit au Mali avec son mari et ses enfants. Bintou est emboucheuse de moutons il y a 9 ans de cela.   Elle s’approvisionne au marché hebdomadaire  de N’Togonasso. Elle les  traite,  nourrit  et  revend dans le même marché. Dans son activité de l’embouche elle a acheté 2 bœufs avec ces intérêts qui l’appartiennent. Elle a fait recours a la caisse pour acheter plus   de moutons. Bintou veut faire face à l’amélioration des études de ces enfants avec son mari dans les jours à venir.
texts.en:
Bintou is a Malian woman who is 37 years old. She is the one holding the sheep's rope in her hand on the photograph. She is married, the mother of six children, of which five all attend school. Their ages vary from 3 to 19 years. She lives in Mali with her husband and her children.

Bintou has been rearing sheep for nine years. She gets her supplies at the N'Togonasso weekly market. She treats, feeds and resells them in the same market. In her rearing activity she has bought 2 cows with the profits belonging to her. She has had recourse to the bank to buy additional sheep.

Bintou wants to be able to face the improvement of her children's studies with her husband in the days to come.

loans.use: to buy sheep for resale.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Agée de 48 ans, Afi est une veuve femme et mère de quatre enfants vivant ensemble à Baguida. Pour soutenir sa famille, Afi vend les détergents et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Afi réalise sa rentabilité dans son activité et pour bien satisfaire aux besoins de ses clients, Afi désire ce prêt pour commander des sacs de détergents afin d’agrandir son stock et gagner des bénéfices qui l’aidera à soutenir ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire et à couvrir certaines charges du ménage.
texts.en: Aged 48 years, Afi is a widowed woman and mother of four children who all live together in Baguida. To support her family, Afi sells detergents and gets her supplies twice a month at the market. Afi is profitable in her activity and so as to satisfy her clients' needs, she would like this loan to order bags of detergents so she can increase her stock and earn profits which will help her to support her children in their school education and to cover some of the household's expenses.

loans.use: to buy twelve bags of detergents.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.pt:
A senhora Mariana tem 57 anos de idade   é pensionista  casada e mãe de 6 filhos 2 a frequentar o ensino primário 1 no secundário os restantes já maiores de idade sustenta 1 irmão e 1 sobrinho órfão de ambos enviando e  vive na casa própria.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo este  pretende comprar  cimento, varões, portas para dar continuidade a sua obra ( construção de uma casa de banho e reboco).
O seu sonho é terminar a obra, adquirir uma viatura para fazer transporte semi-colectivo de passageiros.
Diz que o seu maior desafio e o financeiros conta com ajuda de seu esposo que também é pensionista militar com os empréstimos anteriores fez a atual casa onde vive e diz ainda que ira solicitar mais empréstimos para concretizar seus planos.
texts.en:
Mariana is 57 years old and retired. She is married and the mother of six children, two of whom go to primary school and one who goes to high school while the rest are all adults. She supports one brother and a nephew who is an orphan by sending them money. She lives in her own home.

Mariana says that with the money from this loan she will buy cement, rods and doors to continue her home improvements (building a bathroom and grouting it).

Her dream is to finish building her home and acquire a vehicle to provide a public transport service for passengers.

Mariana says that her biggest challenge is her financial situation, but she has the support of her husband who is also a retired soldier. With the previous loans Mariana has built the home where she lives and she says that she will apply for more loans to make her dreams reality.

loans.use: to buy cement, rods and doors

loans.name: Alejandro Manuel

texts.es: Alejandro es un padre de familia que inició su negocio para aportarle a su familia bienestar, reside en compañía de su cónyuge e hijos en Cartagena y en esta localidad palpó la falencia de servicios ofimáticos, motivo por el que con sus ahorros aperturó un café internet en el que presta servicios de navegación, impresión, trascripción entre otros.  Diariamente todo tipo de público ingresa a su establecimiento a partir de las 8 a.m. con la finalidad de pasar un momento de esparcimiento, realizar trabajos académicos e incluso buscar oportunidades laborales.  En la actualidad cuenta con cinco años de funcionamiento y está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, un servicio de internet más ágil, insumos de papelería e impresión. Con esta inversión podrá ofrecer de sus servicios sin contratiempos. Su meta a futuro es ampliar su negocio y comprar su vivienda
texts.en:
Alejandro is a family man who started his business to support the well-being of his family. Alejandro lives with his wife and their children in Cartagena.

Alejandro noticed the lack of office services in Cartagena, and decided to open an Internet cafe where services such as internet navigation, printing and transcription are offered. Everyday, all sorts of people come into the cafe, which opens at 8 am. They come for a moment of diversion, to complete homework or to look for work.

Nowadays, this business has been running for five years. Alejandro is applying for his first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in order to upgrade to a faster internet, and to purchase stationary and printing supplies. With this investment, Alejandro will be able to offer faster services with fewer delays. His goals for the future are to expand his business and buy his own home.

loans.use: to upgrade to faster internet, and to purchase stationary and printing supplies

loans.name: Alice

texts.fr: Agée de 68 ans, Alice est une veuve femme qui vit à Baguida avec ses quatre enfants à charge. Alice se bat énormément en produisant et revendant de l’huile de palme  en bidons. Alice s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché du nécessaire pour la production et le revend en circulant dans les quartiers environnant. Pour commander des sacs de noix ce palme, Alice sollicite ce prêt pour financer son approvisionnement et mieux vendre en vue de réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de participer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Aged 68 years, Alice is a widowed woman living in Baguida with her four children in her care. Alice struggles a lot by producing and reselling palm oil in barrels. She gets her the necessary production supplies twice a month at the market and resells by walking around the surrounding neighbourhoods.

To order bags of palm nuts, Alice is requesting this loan to finance her purchase and to better sell in order to make a good profit margin and so participate in the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy eight bags of palm nuts.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn lives in Bien Unido with her family. She is married to a fisherman and they have six children together. For fifteen years, she has been helping him in their fishing business to earn a living. Since most nights her husband fishes, she also prepares what he needs in the day time, while also looking after her children and the household.

She is asking a loan of PHP4000 to buy new fishing nets and rice for family consumption. These will assure her that their boat will not encounter delays in their fishing activities and she can also stock a sack of rice for the whole family. A sack of rice is more practical compared to buying a kilo on a daily basis. Analyn, as a mother only wishes that her children ages 3 to 12 can finish their college education someday.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and rice for family consumption

loans.name: Kosal's Group

texts.en: Kosal’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Kosal makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farmer and seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Rufa

texts.en: Rufa is a 64-year-old woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married to a fisherman and they have 5 grown children. Rufa depends on their fishing business, catching crabs and Sari-sari store for a living. She is asking for a loan to buy crab traps, gasoline, fishing nets, toiletries, seasoning, noodles and canned food. She knows that a loan will go a long way in her business. The income will pay for healthy food for herself and her husband. In the future, she hopes to have enough savings so that they can expand her store.

loans.use: to buy crab traps, gasoline, fishing nets, toiletries, seasoning, noodles and canned food

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en: Guillerma is a 47-year-old woman from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married and has 7 children. Her oldest child is 25 while the youngest is 15. Guillerma engages in fishing and catching crabs for an income to help her husband who is a fisherman.  Catching crabs is common in her place because crabs are in abundance and there is a high demand from people. She also sells fish. Guillerma is asking for a loan to buy steel, nylon and crab traps. Guillerma greatly support her children's dreams for an abundant life through education. She wanted them to achieve their dreams in life. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy steel, nylon and crab traps

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: With abundance of farming activity in the town of San Miguel, Bohol, Leonida finds her livelihood buying and selling of banana and sweet potatoes from farmers.  She also farm rice and bananas for additional income. She is asking for a loan of PHP3000 to buy more bananas, sweet potatoes fertilizer for her own farm. She hopes to make her business a success and sustainable so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family, especially for the education of her seven children ages 1-17.

loans.use: to buy bananas, sweet potatoes fertilizer for her own farm

loans.name: Lorenca

texts.en:
Lorenca Lives in Maubessi, She is saw that every day many people always buy some goods in the market, so she has the idea to open her store there. So now she is applying for a loan of $1000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She is taking this loan because she wants to add with her working capital to buy more additional supplies to keep in her store, including cooking oils, aqua, biscuits, noodles, milks, sardines, sweets and other things to sell including soft drinks and hard drinks.

Lorenca has been involved in business activities for a few years ago She started with her own working capital of $650.00. She is earning a good income from her business because many people like to buy from her, so she is still happy to do her business. And with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin she hopes to make her business a bigger store. She also has animals like cows, pigs and dogs.

loans.use: to buy cooking oils, aqua, biscuits, noodles, milks, sardines, sweets, soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.en:
Nicanora has been running her convenience store for almost 10 years. She started from a small store with an initial capital of PHP 1000.00 that she had in her pocket after her wedding. She invested that little amount into buying consumable goods that is commonly used in a simple household and rolled over her proceeds. From that time on, she had expanded her little business and add on more products such as liquor, deodorants, over the counter medicines, and even rice and corn grains for human consumption and now she also sells animal feeds.

Nicanora recalls that her dreams of being a boss of her own business had come true. However, she said that this has been made possible because of the assistance of Paglaum MPC that she nurtured for a longer time. She continuously provides her immediate market with their needs that she asks for a loan of PHP 50,000.00 to buy rice & corn grains, groceries, animal feeds for retail.

loans.use: to buy rice & corn grains, groceries, animal feeds for retail

loans.name: Sokai's Group

texts.en: Sokai’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sokai makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 47-year-old farmer from Bien Unido, Bohol, Philippines. He has been in the rice farming business for sixteen years now. He also drive a motorcycle for additional income. Samuel needs a loan to buy fertilizer and pay for labor of other farmers who will be helping in the cultivation and in the planting season. With this, he will be able to improve and produce a good harvest from the farm. In the future, Samuel hopes of improving his business. Moreover, he wants to save money for the schooling of his youngest child aged 14.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor on his rice farm.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en: Cirila is into farming rice to support her family. She and her family lives in Bien Unido, a town in Bohol. She tils the land hoping for a good harvest out of her farm, while her husband is doing carpentry work to support for them. She applied for a loan knowing that this could help them. The money that they will get will be use to acquire fertilizers, pesticides and pay for labor. With these farm inputs, they can expect a better yield on their crops after four months. Any income derived from this business will be spent on her family’s daily consumption and school fees of her children ages 2-18. future business investment.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and pay for labor

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha is a loving mother to her adult age children. She is supported by her husband who is a farmer in Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. Editha learned about Paglaum MPC and signed up for membership. Her eldest daughter is in college and needs to pay her tuition fee and school fees. She asks from the cooperative for a loan to pay for tuition fee and other school fees.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fee and other school fees.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en: Brenda is a wife and a partner to her husband in their fishing business. They live in Bien Unido with her family. Fishing has become the most common source of income by people living in this municipality. She is asking a loan of PHP12000 to buy  marine plywood, paint and adhesive for the boat. This will allow her to have her boat repaired. These will assure her that they can fix their boat and continue their business as usual. The income from fishing will provide food for her children and pay for their school expenses.

loans.use: to buy marine plywood, paint and adhesive for the boat

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina hails in the town of Tolosa, Leyte. She runs a sari-sari(variety) store, selling merchandise like toothpaste, shampoo, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, eggs, noodles, and toiletries. She has been running that kind of livelihood for 2 years now. Aside from that, she also engages in food vending, as supplemental income.
She is 40-year old married woman with 3 dependents ages 21, 4 and 2 years old respectively. Her husband is a farmer. She is doing her best to give her family with nutritious diets and able to finance her respective studies as well.

She has requested a loan to buy stocks for the store like noodles, canned goods, toiletries, seasonings and additional capital for food vending. These could attract more buyers and able to maintain the merchandise on her store. Slowly, she could settle her finances and continue support the needs of her growing children.

In the long run, Gina could now able to expand and invest other business ventures to have stable source of income.

loans.use: to buystocks for the store like noodles, canned goods, toiletries,  seasonings and additional capital for food vending

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is engaged in food selling business to earn a living. She sells food like barbeque, fried fish, fried noodles, pork and vegetables. She has been doing this for four years, while her husband works hard as a farmer. They work together to provide the needs of their three children ages, 16, 15 and 10 years old. In the future, she wishes to expand her business. Perhaps she wants to give good education to her children. Thus, Marilou is asking a loan of PHP8000 to help her buy ingredients such as meat, fish, vegetables and spices. In addition, she is 39 years old and lives in Ajuy, Iloilo.

loans.use: to buy  meat, fish, vegetables and spices

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily finds joy in her hog raising business. She loves to see her piglets grow and she diligently feeds and cleans its pen everyday. This business seems like a daily hobby for her.

Lily recalls that she started this business venture upon learning from one of the PMPCs employees that it is better to create business and later on offers business opportunities. She received a loan and started up her hog raising business. Recently, she requested a loan amount of PHP 14,900 to buy additional piglets & purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets & purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.name: Condrada

texts.en: Condrada is 81 years old, widow with 2 adult age children. She is known in Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte on her sari sari store (convenience store) that she operated for almost her life time. She never get tired in attending her store despite of her age because through this business activity she was able to send her children to school until they finished college. Like among others, Condrada managed her good membership with Paglaum MPC that had provided her the needed financial assistance whether it is for personal use or for her business venture. Recently, she asks from the cooperative a loan to restock store with consumable goods like canned goods, noodles, coffee, milk, sugar, shampoo, detergents and other. She is looking forward for a good fortune to continuously provides the needs of her family and of her grand children.

loans.use: to restock store with consumable goods like canned goods, noodles, coffee, milk, sugar, shampoo, detergents and other

loans.name: Rodelia

texts.en: Rodelia earns a living through her clothing sales. She sees to have enough inventories to continuously provide for her family. For her capital needs, PMPC stood by her since the start of her business. She is happy that she is able to survive the odds of business with determination and her family as her inspiration. To earn more, she applied a loan to purchase more used clothing inventories to sell. Melanie hopes to live comfortably with her children as they finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing inventories to sell

location.town: Dipolog City-Lawag Galas Dipolog City Zamboanga de

loans.name: Loan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Loan, 51 years old, is a Kinh ethnic majority. She currently lives with her husband in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from the grocery trade, so the income after deducting all costs is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and save a small amount. She wants to repair her house but the saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family have a clean spacious house, and for herself, she will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en: Luzminda a responsible mother requests a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to increase her inventory. She wants to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables for retail. This way, she will be able to sell more products which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase more kilos of fruits & vegetables for retail

location.town: Dipolog City-Lawag Galas Dipolog City Zamboanga de

loans.name: Yvette  Yawa

texts.fr: Yvette est une veuve femme dynamique qui vit à Baguida avec ses quatre enfants à charge. Yvette est âgée de 50 ans et  s’active énormément pour avoir une bonne situation financière. Yvette est une revendeuse de pagnes qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Yvette nécessite ce prêt pour commander des pièces de pagnes de hautes et moyennes qualités afin de répondre favorablement aux besoins de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière remarquable  pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Yvette is a dynamic widowed mother to four children who lives in Baguida. She is 50 years old and works very hard to ensure her financial independence. Yvette earns a living selling pagne cloth which she purchases twice monthly from market.

In order to meet her goals, Yvette needs this loan to purchase both high and medium-quality pagne cloth so she can meet her customers' needs and ensure her financial independence. By doing this, she will be able to assist her children with their educations.

loans.use: to purchase six lengths of high-quality pagne cloth and two lengths of medium-quality pagne cloth.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en: Leonardo is 52 years old. He is known in the Dipolog City area for his rolling store selling various street foods. He is actively participating in the various programs and services that the coop offers. He hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which he applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks. He hopes to maintain his membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that he has been given a priority, as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what he is thankful for, when all his financing needs of his rolling store business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for his house.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda is an active member of Paglaum MPC and actively participates in the different activities of the cooperative. She avails various loan products of the cooperative for business, agriculture and for personal needs. This time, she avails a loan to pay for medical check up & purchase of maintenance medicines.

loans.use: to pay for medical check up & purchase of maintenance medicines

loans.name: Du's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Du, 31 years old, is a Kinh ethnic majority woman. She currently lives with her husband and her two children, one son and one daughter in Son La city under the Son La province.
Her family’s main income is from grocery trade, so the income after deducting costs is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and saved a small amount.
