She wants to repair her house and the sanitation work of the house but the saved amount is not enough for her to do it. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, and she hopes that the loan amount will help her family have better living condition with a clean spacious house.

loans.use: to repair her house and the sanitation work of the house

loans.name: Gitana Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por dos mujeres y un hombre todos muy emprendedores, que se organizaron hace 8 meses, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para mejorar sus pequeños negocios incrementando su mercadería y así poder mejorar también sus ingresos que les permita poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios.

MIRNA YAJAIRA: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una joven de 23 años de edad, con cualidades de líder, casada con 1 pequeño hijo de 2 meses. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y contribuir con los gastos del hogar. Vende de manera ambulante fritos y tacos. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar ingredientes: pollo, aceite, repollo, tomate, vinagre, cebolla, tortilla, entre otros productos. Ella sueña con tener una pulpería.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is comprised of two women and one man. They are all very enterprising. They were organized eight months ago with the objective of accessing financing in order to improve their small businesses by increasing their merchandise. This way they are able to also improve their incomes, which allows them to be able to cover their basic household necessities, to assure their children's education, and to expand their businesses.

Mirna Yajaira is the coordinator of the solidarity group. She is a 23 year old young woman with leadership qualities. She is married and has a little two month old son. In order to have her own source of income and to contribute to the household expenses she sells fried snacks and tacos.

She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients like chicken, cooking oil, cabbage, tomatoes, vinegar, onions, and tortillas, among other products.

She dreams of having a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like chicken, cooking oil, cabbage, tomatoes, vinegar, onions, and tortillas, among others.

loans.name: Vannary Group

texts.en: Vannary is a 47-year-old married rice farmer with three children. She resides in a village in the Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. Vannary is pictured 1st from the left and cultivated rice since 1988. Two of her children are the factory workers and other one attach school. Her husband is a 56-year-old rice farmer as well. Together, they can make approximately USD 9 per day. Vannary a group leader, would like to request a loan as a group of four members and Vannary is now requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for rice farming. With this loan, she will be able to gain better rice crops to sell, thereby improving the family’s finances. In the future, she is going to save money to buy more farmland to cultivate rice, renovate her house and support her youngest child to earn high diplomas.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for rice farming

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is a businesswoman who earns through retailing various consumable items in Olo, Siquijor.

She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurances and financial assistance.

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. She is on her way to renovating her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

loans.name: Gerellosa

texts.en: Gerellosa lives in Dipolog City, Zamboanga and supports her three daughters by building houses from the ground up. She has successfully repaid her whole loan, which she used to buy building material, paints, and to pay her workers. She wants her daughters to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work she has had to endure.

loans.use: to buy building materials, paint & pay her workers for her house building business

loans.name: Viwonou

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 38 ans, Viwonou est une femme qui avec deux enfants à charge. Habitant à Baguida, Viwonou prépare et vend de la pâte bandée appelée « Akpan » en parcourant les quartiers environnant et à domicile en vue d’avoir une bonne rentabilité financière. Viwonou s’approvisionne au marché du nécessaire pour la préparation. Pour commander le sac de maïs, des unités de poissons et des tas de condiments, Viwonou demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat en vue de bien vendre et de gagner plus de revenus pour faire face aux besoins de ses enfants dès la rentrée prochaine.
texts.en:
38-year-old Viwonou is a married mother to two children who lives in Baguida. She earns a living through making and selling "Akpan", corn patties, as a street vendor in her local area and out of her own home. She does this to ensure her financial independence.

Viwonou purchases the necessary ingredients from market. She is requesting this loan to purchase maize, fish and condiments so she can sell more patties and earn a greater profit. By doing this, she will be able to meet her children's needs for the upcoming school year.

loans.use: to purchase one bag of maize, 20 fish and four containers of various condiments.

loans.name: Rexie

texts.en: Rexie makes good earnings from her farming activities in Sandugan, Larena, Siquijor. This is how she supports her family and is able to send her children to school. She wants to increase her farm yield especially since she will have a high cost of living when her children enter college. Rexie approached Paglaum to loan an amount to purchase knapsack sprayer for insecticides. She has high hopes that she will have good produce this cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase knapsack sprayer for insecticides

loans.name: Ayélé Lucienne

texts.fr: Ayélé est une veuve femme de 66 ans qui habite à Baguida. Mère de trois enfants, Ayélé est une marchande des tubercules d’ignames qu’elle achète deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile et de quartier en quartier pour gagner des revenus. Pour commander des calebasses d’ignames, Ayélé nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement puis bien vendre et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et mieux couvrir les frais scolaire de ses enfants dès la rentrée prochaine.
texts.en:
Ayélé is a 66-year-old widowed mother to three children who lives in Baguida. She earns a living through selling yams which she purchases twice monthly from market and resells both out of her own home and as a street vendor.

Ayélé is requesting this loan to purchase yams so she can earn a greater profit. By doing this, she will be able to meet her family's needs and see to her children's school fees for the upcoming academic year.

loans.use: to purchase four containers of yams.

loans.name: Ernanie

texts.en: Ernanie signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the required capital to start up a sari-sari store. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Ernanie was able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of her good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta is a hardworking mother from Binuangan, Oroquieta City. She is 54 years old and a businesswoman who makes copra. She buys whole coconuts for this. Julieta has signed her membership with the cooperative to gain access to insurances and credit. She applied for a loan to buy whole coconuts for making copra. Julieta hopes to succeed in this business to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy whole coconuts to make copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production)

loans.name: Fe Y Alegria Group

texts.es: Esta es la alcancía comunal “Fe y Alegría” creada hace más de 5 años por personas con deseos de superarse en la vida, y ahora en este nuevo ciclo lo integran 6 mujeres muy responsables y perseverantes, con su representante la Sra. Eloisa de 55 años de edad, es conviviente con su pareja y con 2 hijos que aun dependen de ella. Tiene como fuente de trabajo un pequeño taller de carpintería en casa implementada hace algunos años con el apoyo de su pareja, adicional a ello también se dedica a preparar desayunos para luego venderlos al público, es por ello que el préstamo solicitado lo utilizara para invertirlo en comprar los materiales que necesita para su carpintería y terminar rápidamente con los pedidos que tiene. Es así como Eloisa trabaja arduamente para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y cumplir con sus objetivos planteados. Ella tiene pensado implementar una bodega en casa y vender todo tipo de bebidas y productos comestibles a sus clientes. En la foto grupal la Eloisa se encuentra de pie en medio de sus demás compañeras sentadas.
texts.en:
She is in the Fe y Alegría communal bank, which was created over five years ago by people with the desire to improve their lives There are now six women who are members in this new cycle. They are very responsible and diligent. Eloisa, age 55, is their representative. She lives with her life partner and her two children, who are still dependent upon her.

Her source of work is a small carpentry shop at her house, which was established a few years ago with the help of her life partner. In addition to this, she also prepares breakfasts to later sell to the public.

She will use the requested loan to buy materials she needs for her carpentry business to rapidly complete the orders that she has. This is the way that Eloisa works arduously to provide her family with a better quality of life and to achieve her goals.

She is planning on establishing a small grocery store at her house and selling all types of drinks and food products to her customers.

In the photo Eloisa is standing among the other members, who are seated.

loans.use: to buy materials for her carpentry business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es una mujer de 42 años de edad, es casada con una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 17 y 21 años, esta familia vive en una comunidad de San Pablo Jocopilas.
Elizabeth para obtener sus ingresos se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas y verduras, este negocio está ubicado en la comodidad de su hogar, tiene 4 años de realizarlo. Gracias a la amabilidad con la que atiende a sus clientes, su negocio tiene mucha demanda por esa razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de más verduras como; pepinos, papa, cebolla, mango, naranjas. Con esta inversión Elizabeth espera satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 42 years old. She is married and has three lovely children, the youngest of whom is 17 years old, the eldest 21. The family lives in a community in San Pablo Jocopilas.

In order to earn an income, Elizabeth makes a living buying and selling fruits and vegetables. This business is in Elizabeth's home and she has had it for four years. Thanks to how friendly she is with customers, Elizabeth has a lot of demand from customers. Elizabeth is therefore applying for a loan in order to buy more fruits and vegetables such as cucumbers, potatoes, onions, mangoes and oranges.

Elizabeth hopes this investment will help Elizabeth to better satisfy customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy and sell fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is a 55-year-old married woman and a mother of five adult children from Trinidad, Bohol.

Belen has been engaged in a hog-raising business for many years now. She is happy to have a business that she can just do at home. Right now, her hogs are being tied in a shed and sometimes under a tree.

Belen is asking for a loan to buy quality feed so that she can expect quality growth as well. She will also use the money to buy another piglet that she can raise. In the future, Belen plans to make her business bigger and house them in a proper concrete barn.

loans.use: to buy feed and a piglet.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es: Domitila es una mujer trabajadora de 31 años de edad que vive en la localidad rural de Toran, que está ubicado en Arequipa. Ella trabaja como peona agrícola y también se dedica a la cría de cerdos orgánicos, poniendo mucha atención en el cuidado y la alimentación que les brinda. Domitila solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar cerdos orgánicos y para la alimentación orgánica de estos. En el futuro Domitila espera poder mejorar su casa para poder vivir cómodamente.
texts.en:
Domitila is 31 years old and hard-working. She lives in Toran, a rural area in Arequipa. Domitila works as a farm labourer and also makes a living raising organic pigs. She particularly pays close attention to the feed she gives the pigs.

Domitila is applying for this loan in order to buy organic pigs, and organic pig feed.

In the future, Domitila hopes to make improvements to her house and live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy organic pigs and organic feed for her animals.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.en: Fidel is a fisherman from Bien Unido, Bohol. He has been in the fishing business for many years now. This is the source of his income. Fishing is a lucrative business in his area. Fidel is asking for a loan for the expansion of his business. He is requesting a loan to buy fishing nets and pay for boat repair. This loan will enable him to improve his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market. He hopes to make his business sustainable so he can send his 15-year-old daughter to College in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and pay for boat repair

loans.name: Emerberto

texts.en: Emerberto is a hardworking farmer in Dipolog City. He raised alone his 2 adult age children through his farming activities. He smiled at the thought that all his children had finished college and landed good job with the aid of Paglaum MPC where Emerberto is an active member. Tecently, he avails a loan to purchase maintenance medicines.

loans.use: to purchase maintenance medicines

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en: Liezel is a businesswoman from Tigbawan, Lazi, Siquijor. She is 35 years old, single and has the expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Liezel is a full fledged member of PMPC and has took several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she applied a loan to restock store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Liezel continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Jessyl

texts.en: Jessyl is 39 years old residing at Cangbagsa, Larena, Siquijor. She is married and blessed only with school age children. She joined PMPC on April 17, 2006 in order to access the programs and services of the said coop. Recently, she's accessing her 9th loan in the amount of PHP 50,000 for additional working capital of her existing business to buy variety of commodities which is selling a variety of food products in the local community.

loans.use: to buy variety of commodities

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en: Francisco is 78 years old, married with 6 adult age children from Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte. He is a retired government employee and is a member of Paglaum MPC. He enjoyed the perks of membership including insurance services. Now that his insurance will soon expires, he approached the cooperative for an amount to pay for insurance renewal.

loans.use: to pay for insurance renewal

loans.name: Nghiem's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nghiem, born in 1989, is a Thai ethnic woman. Her family consists of four members, including her husband, her son and her daughter. The family is living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family lives mainly based on breeding and cultivation, so the annual income after deducting costs is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and saved a small amount. She wants to raise ducks but the saved amount is not enough to buy breeding ducks. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, and she hopes that the loan amount will help her family develop the breeding well, and then the next duck herd will bring her family a considerable profit.

loans.use: to raise ducks

loans.name: Koemsoeung's Group

texts.en:
Koemsoeung is a 28-year-old, married rice farmer with two children in her care and resides in the Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice for over twenty years. Her husband is a 29-year-old a rice farmer as well, and her two children attend school. Koemsoeung and her husband can earn approximately $4 per day. 

Koemsoeung is pictured 1st from the right, as a group leader, would like to request a loan as part of five members and she will use her portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing expenses. This loan will help her have enough money to buy fertilizer for rice cultivation, so she will be able to gain better rice crops to support the family. In the future, she is going to build a new proper house and support her two children to earn higher education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing expenses

loans.name: Strella

texts.en: Living near the seashore gave some people an advantage. Just like Strella, who found a business in fishing for fifteen years in Bien Unido, Bohol. She helped her husband in their fishing business. She is asking a loan to buy marine ply wood, hard wood and pay for boat repair. These will bring back the full functionality of their boat and a boost to their productivity. Her income will be for the education of her children ages 2, 7 and 11.

loans.use: to buy marine ply wood, hard wood and pay for boat repair

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a 43-year-old woman from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married with six children; the youngest is one-year-old and the oldest is 20. Alongside her husband, they work hard in the field to provide for their family. However, she is struggling because they need to wait for the crops and the time to harvest. Arlene is applying for a 7,000 PHP loan through CEVI to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides. The loan will help her to continue her farming while also supporting the basic needs of her family. She will use all her farming income to pay for healthy food for her family and school fees for her children.

In the future, Arlene hopes to be successful by continuing to improve and expand her farm.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is a businesswoman who earns through retailing various items. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurances and financial assistance. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. She is on her way to renovating her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila has signed up with PMPC and availed the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store (small convenience store). She is thankful for the capital PMPC extends to a small borrower like her. Leonila is able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she availed a loan to restock store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to attain a descent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Encarnación

texts.es:
Encarnación es un hombre muy trabajador con la visión de superación, él tiene 48 años de edad es soltera, con una linda familia vive  en una comunidad de San Andrés Semetabaj. 
Encarnación para darle a su familia lo mejor se dedica al cultivo de milpa, con esta actividad lleva 15 años de realizarlo pero para mejorar sus ingresos se dedica al cultivo de frijol.
Encarnación durante esta época su cultivo de Milpa ya necesita de su mantenimiento para obtener  al final del año una buena cosecha, su preocupación ha ido aumentado porque no tiene los recursos para comprar fertilizantes y pagar la mano de obra, a raíz de esta necesidad solicita un préstamo de Q 3,00.00.
Encarnación su esperanza de vida es contar con una casa más amplia para que su familia viva mejor.
texts.en:
Encarnación is a hardworking man with a vision of exceeding. He is 48 years old, single, and lives with a beautiful family in the community of San Andrés Semetabaj.

In order to give his family the best Encarnación works growing corn and has been doing this activity for 15 years, and to improve his earnings he is growing beans.

Encarnación has maintenance needs in order to obtain a good crop at the end of the year during this time of corn cultivation. His concern has been increased because he does not have the resources to buy fertilizer and pay laborers. This is why he needs to ask for a loan of 3,000 GTQ (Guatemalan quetzales).

Encarnación hopes to expand his home so that his family can live better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay laborers.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.fr:
Pascal, un père de famille brave, responsable et débrouillard a 39 ans. Il est marié et le couple travail ensemble dans l'exercice de l'activité génératrice de revenu familiale. Il est père de quatre enfants dont le dernier seulement va à l'école actuellement.
Pascal exploite un commerce de quincaillerie avec sa femme dont cette dernière tient le point de vente fixe et il effectue une vente ambulante en rejoignant les grands marchés des autres villes environnantes.
Son souhait est de développer et étendre son commerce, c'est la raison pour laquelle, il continue le partenariat avec CEFOR pour un demande crédit. Le crédit va lui permettre de renouveler et augmenter les stocks de marchandises. L'amélioration du revenu entraine automatiquement l'amélioration du niveau de vie de la famille selon lui.
texts.en:
Pascal is a good, responsible, resourceful family man. He is 39 years old. He is married, and the couple works together in the business that generates income for the family. He is the father of four children, the youngest of which is the only one currently in school.

Pascal runs a hardware shop with his wife where she runs the shop and he does traveling sales, participating in big markets in neighboring cities.

His goal is to develop and expand his business and this is the reason for which he is continuing his partnership with CEFOR to request a loan. The loan will allow him replenish and increase his merchandise stocks. According to him, the improved revenue directly leads to an improvement in living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to buy electrical cables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cell phone chargers and spare parts [for resale].

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en: Ricardo is a loving father who raised his family through sun blocker-making. He has local costumers as well as costumers coming from neighboring towns. His business is supported by his loan availments from Paglaum MPC where he is an active member. Recently, he availed a loan to purchase bamboo, nylon, and other materials for his sun blocker-making business.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo, nylon, and other materials for his sun blocker-making business

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a hard working woman from the town of Tolosa, Leyte. She is married with ten children. Her income mainly goes for food and school fees. On the other hand, her husband earns by means of farming. She toils the land and grows rice.
She raises and sold hogs to support her family. She has been raising hogs for 3 years now.

Lolita has requested a loan to purchase materials for pig pen renovation and pig feeds. These will provide the animals with better shelter and has adequate supply for food that's vital in hog raising livelihood.

She could now maximize all the resources needed, and slowly she could able to improve it and handle her hog raising business successfully.

She is determined that her livelihood will become sustainable coupled with hard work and determination to succeed.

loans.use: to purchase materials for pig pen renovation  and pig feeds

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en: Luisa is a farmer who earns through vegetables farming and selling to the local market. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. She is on her way to renovating her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

loans.name: Geronima

texts.en: Geronima signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the required capital to start up a sari-sari store. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Geronima has been able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en: Candelaria is grateful to the services extended by Paglaum MPC to pensioners like her. She is 80 years old and a retired public school teacher. Due to her age, she suffers from various sicknesses and she needs a lump-some amount of money to respond to her medical conditions. She asks the cooperative this time for an amount to pay for expenses in medical check up and the purchase of maintenance medicines and vitamins.

loans.use: to pay for medical check up and the purchase of maintenance medicines and vitamins

loans.name: Adonis

texts.en: Adonis has a collection of ornamental garden plants. He finds pleasure in doing his gardening activities and earns for his family. As a micro-finance member of PMPC, he has seeked financial aid to purchase varieties of ornamental plants that he can grow and sell. In the future, Adonis wishes to become the supplier of flowers to the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase varieties of ornamental plants that he can grow and sell

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is 61 years old and has been a member of Paglaum MPC for almost 10 years. She has been supported by the cooperative in all her business needs and even her personal needs such as the renewal of her insurance purchases.

Recently, Josefa availed a loan to purchase maintenance medicines.

loans.use: to purchase maintenance medicines.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.en:
Lorenza learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups.

Lorenza tried her luck doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital.

Lorenza borrowed another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help give her farming income a big boost. Lorenza looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma was raised by a carpenter father. As she grew up, she assisted her father with carpentry work especially in making furniture, which has become a source of income for Vilma. Unable to sustain her business due to financial constraints, she signed up to Paglaum MPC for additional capital. Now that she successfully repaid all her loans without record of default, she applied for a loan to expand her furniture production. She is borrowing PHP 14,900 PHP to purchase lumber, varnish, paint, and carving tools for her furniture making business.

loans.use: to purchase lumber, varnish, paint, and carving tools for her furniture making business

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Thanh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thanh, born in 1971, is a Kinh ethnic majority woman. She currently lives with her husband and her two daughters in Son La city under the Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation, so the income after deducting costs is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and saved a small amount. She wants to invest in raising breeding cows to get more income for the family but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest in breeding cows effectively, and the next year it will bring her family some lovely calves. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to invest in raising breeding cows.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita is responsible and dedicated in her work as a tailor. This is her only source of income, and she is very grateful for her life and being allowed to be independent. She has a business producing school uniforms and carrying out repairs to clothes. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive. She applied for a loan in order to expand her business and increase production. She will buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies. This will allow her to generate more income and be able to provide tailoring services to meet the specific needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.en: Emiliana is a jack of all trade as they say. She's willing to do anything for her family to survive. But she hopes to find a good business ventures that can support the growing needs of her family. She learns about the financial assistance that Paglaum MPC offers to aspiring entrepreneurs like her and sign up for membership. She has the needed capital and start up her banana chips making. She delivers her product on every store on the local communities. She finds that she has growing demands of banana chips that she asks for a loan of PHP 8,000.00 to buy 100 kilos of banana, brown sugar and others for banana chips production. This will ensure Emiliana to meet her growing demands of her product.

loans.use: to buy 100 kilos of banana, brown sugar and others for banana chips production

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en: Amelia has been involved in activities since 2014. She started her business with her own working capital of $ 1500.00. Amelia has a shop in her business. So she is requesting a loan of $1000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy additional supplies according to people like, including candies, eggs,  noodles, cooking oils, detergents, biscuits, nuts, coffee, pens, tailored yarn, rice, slippers, shampoo and other things to sell Including soft drinks and hard drinks. She is happy with the loan that offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy candies, eggs,  noodles, cooking oils, detergents, biscuits, nuts, coffee, pens, tailored yarn, rice, slippers, shampoo, soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Khea's Group

texts.en: Khea’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Khea makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs and she also does extra work as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is driven by passion in selling. At the age of 48 and married in Pagadian City, she runs a store that primarily supports their family.

Everyday Nimfa tirelessly tends her store. Nimfa is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously repaid her obligations without records of default.

Now, Nimfa has taken another loan to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil and noodles to sell. Having enough inventories would mean income opportunities. In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil and noodles to sell.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Noeline

texts.fr:
Noeline est une femme simple, dynamique et travailleuse de 36 ans. Elle est divorcée et a trois enfants à charge. Un seulement de ces derniers va actuellement à l'école, l'ainé qui n'a que 15 ans l'appui dans l'exercice de de son activité et le dernier n'a que 2 ans. Elle élève seule ses enfants, son ex-mari ne lui verse aucune pension. 
Elle dirige un stand d'alimentation (kafe sy mofo) depuis long temps, c'est un métier qu'elle hérite de ses parents. Elle voudrait développer et étendre cette activité, elle voudrait même ouvrir un autre stand que son ainé puisse gérer. C'est une femme très courageuse, malgré la situation, la morale est toujours élevée. Elle n'est jamais déprimée.
texts.en:
Noeline is a simple, energetic and hard-working 36-year old woman. She is divorced and has three dependent children. Only one of her children is in school; the eldest,  only 15 years old, helps her out in her business, and the youngest is only two years old. She raises her children on her own; her ex-husband does not pay any child support.

Noeline has been running a food stall (“kafe sy mofo,” a typical coffee-and-beignets business) for a long time. She inherited this trade from her parents. She would like to develop and grow her business. She would even like to open an additional stall which could be managed by her eldest son. Noeline is a very determined woman and always upbeat in spite of the difficult situation. She  never gets discouraged.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr:
Jacqueline est une femme travailleuse infatigable de 32 ans. Elle est mariée et son mari travaille en tant que chauffeur de taxi-bus salarié, c'est à dire qu'il n'est pas propriétaire du véhicule qu'il conduit. Le couple a trois enfants de 3 à 13 ans dont les deux premiers sont scolarisés actuellement.
Jacqueline exerce deux activités source de revenu: exploitation de deux magasins de marchandises générales et vente ambulante de lait de soja. Elle emploi deux personnes pour le deuxième magasin général et la vente ambulante de lait de soja et c'est elle qui tient le premier magasin.
Actuellement, sa maison d'habitation et les magasins sont en location donc son désire est de pouvoir construire sa propre maison, et une grande maison qui pourra  lui servir à la fois d'habitation et de magasin.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is a tireless hardworking, 32-year-old woman. She is married and her husband works as a salaried taxi-bus driver, which means he does not own the vehicle that he drives. The couple has 3 children between 3 and 13 years old, the oldest two are currently in school.

Jacqueline works in two incoming-generating businesses: running two general merchandise shops and street sales of soy milk. She employs two people for the second general store and the street sales of soy milk, and she is the one who runs the first store.

Currently, she rents the house where she lives and the shops thus her hope is to be able to build her own house and a big house that will be able to serve both as a residence and a shop.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, sugar, containers of oil.

loans.name: Quinie

texts.en:
Quinie has operated her plastic wares within their market for three years. She is married with one child. She also raises hogs to earn additional capital.

Quinie would like to increase her stock of plastic wares, but her capital is not enough. For this reason, she's asking for a loan of PHP 20,000. She will use this amount to buy cups, plates, spoons and containers to sell.

Quinie believes that she can further improve her plastic wares business and gain more income for her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy stock of plastic wares such as cups, plates, spoons and containers to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel es un hombre de 43 años de edad, es casado con una linda familia de tres hijos, dos de ellos estudian tercero básico y el más pequeño cursa primero básico, ellos viven en una comunidad de la aldea ladrillera.
Daniel para obtener sus ingresos y darle a su familia lo necesario trabaja como jornalero, haciendo una variedad de actividades él tiene 13 años de realizar esta labor. Su casa afortunadamente está en buenas condiciones pero sus baños sanitarios están en malas condiciones y a raíz de esta necesidad él solicita un préstamo para la compra de cemento, cal y arena.  Con esta inversión Daniel espera que sus baños tengan una mejor apariencia para mayor comodidad de su familia.
Su esperanza de vida es darle a sus hijos la mejor educación y verlos convertidos en grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Daniel is 43 years old, married and has a lovely family. He has three children, two of whom are in third grade, while the youngest is in first grade. The family lives in a community in Ladrillera village.

In order to earn an income and provide his family with necessities, Daniel has been working as a labourer in various jobs for 13 years.

Luckily, Daniel's house in general is in good condition but his bathroom is in bad condition. He is therefore applying for a loan in order to buy cement, lime and sand. Daniel hopes that this investment will mean that his bathroom will look better and be more comfortable for his family.

Daniel hopes to give his children a better education and see them become great professionals.

loans.use: to buy cement, lime and sand to carry out work on his bathroom.

loans.name: Municipal Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras, que pertenecen a la etnia miskita de la Ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Se organizaron, hace 12 meses con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento con garantía solidaria, para incrementar el inventario de sus pequeños negocios y mejorar su calidad de vida. Decidieron nombrar al grupo solidario MUNICIAPAL, porque venden en uno de los mercados del municipio de Puerto Cabezas
 
Antonieta del Socorro: Es una señora sonriente de 30 años de edad, casada con 3 hijos: El mayor de 10 años estudia su quinto grado de primaria y dos menores de edad. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y contribuir con los gastos del hogar, estableció una pequeña pulpería, en un tramo que tiene en uno de los mercados del municipio. Gracias a los créditos otorgados por PANA PANA y financiados por KIVA, le han permitido crecer y vender carne chiverías, embutidos y carne de cerdo. Ella sueña con tener el capital suficiente para establecer una abarrotería.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three women entrepreneurs belonging to the Miskita ethnic group from the city of Bilwi in the Puerto Cabezas municipality. They began twelve months ago with the purpose of accessing loans with joint liability so they could increase the inventory of their small businesses and improve their quality of life. They decided to name their communal bank Municipal because their sales take place in the markets of the municipality of Puerto Cabezas.

Antonieta del Socorro is a smiling lady, 30 years old, and married with three children. The eldest is 10 years old and is in fifth grade and there are two younger ones. In order to have her own source of income and contribute to the household expenses, she opened a small-scale kiosk in a section of one of the city markets. Thanks to loans from Pana Pana funded by Kiva, she has been able to grow and she sells snacks, sausages, and pork. Her dream is to have enough cash to establish a convenience store.

loans.use: to buy snacks, sausages, and pork.

loans.name: Vitaliana

texts.en: Vitaliana is 45 years old with three grown children and her youngest is two. She is from the community of San Miguel, Bohol.  Vitaliana offers grinding services using her grinding machine. She grind rice, sticky rice and peanuts. She also cook and sell budbud ( rice cake snack or dessert wrapped in banana leaves)in her place. Most of Vitaliana's customers are those who are food vendor who usually sell rice cake in the market and those who make peanut butter. Vitaliana is requesting a loan of PHP20000 to buy 5 sacks of sticky rice, 5 sacks of ordinary rice and 5 sacks of brown Central (brand) sugar. Her income will be for family consumption, savings and reinvestment in the same business. In the future, Vitaliana plans to expand her business to make it even more successful.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of sticky rice, 5 sacks of ordinary rice and 5 sacks of brown Central (brand) sugar

loans.name: Rusliyanti

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Rusliyanti, who is a 29-year-old married. Rusliyanti is a beverages merchant for nine years and her husband is an entrepreneur for six years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7.000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build water source at their home to improve access to a new toilet and clear water for their family.

Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Rusliyanti will be able to repay the loan received.
She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: this loan will be used to build water source at their home to improve access to  a new toilet and clean water for their family.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is a native from the town of Tolosa, Leyte. She owns a tricycle (pedicab), and she earns an income from renting the vehicle . She has been engaged in this living for more than 20 years. She is married with five children. Two of her children are still attending high school.

She is hoping that by taking a loan she will be able to provide quality services and promote safety, as it her vehicle is being used daily for transporting passengers.

A loan of 20,000 PHP would help Luz to buy fuel, tires and provide maintenance like changing her oil. These are essential tools for improving her day to day living. She will now able to handle her earnings wisely.

Luz is looking forward to continuing financing the schooling of her two children and also to improving becoming sustainable in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy fuel, tires and provide maintenance like changing her oil.

loans.name: María Justina

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito Virgen  Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 53  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aún viven en su casa. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña María es una gran ama de casa que realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice en su trabajo, el tiene una lancha en la cual junto a sus hijos se dedican a la pesca, ellos se van a alta mar  en su pequeña embarcación a realizar sus faenas de pesca, se van de 15 a 20 días a realizar sus labores, ellos andan junto a un barco pesquero al cual le entregan todas las tardes el producto de la pesca del día, una vez transcurrido estos días ellos regresan a sus hogares para estar junto a sus familias ya que dentro de pocos días nuevamente salen ya que esta es su forma de ganarse la vida. 
Este crédito es para comprar redes, piolas, combustible y alimentos para los días que tienen que estar en alta mar. Lleva 8 años en el grupo de crédito y esta muy agradecida con la institución y con las personas que le ayudan con los créditos. Sus sueños es tener otra lancha y así ir mejorando su vida.
texts.en:
The communal bank of Crédito Virgen Del Mar meets twice a month in the beautiful seaside resort of San Mateo in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches that are visited all year long by domestic and foreign tourists. Most of the local people are fishermen or work in the fishing industry.

María lives here. She is 53 years old. She is married with three adult children. Two of them still live at home. Her husband engages in fishing.

María is a great housewife. She is asking for a loan for her husband to use in his work. He has a boat and he and their children fish together. They go off shore in their small launch to carry out their fishing, staying out for between 15-20 days doing their work. Every afternoon they come alongside a fishing vessel to pass over their catch up of the day. After these days pass they return to their households to be with their family for a few days before setting off again. This is the way they make their living.

This loan is to buy nets, rope, fuel and food for the days when they have to be at sea. She has been with the communal bank for eight years and she is very grateful to the institution and the people supporting the loans. Her dream is to have another boat in order to keep on improving their life.

loans.use: to buy nets, rope, fuel and food.

loans.name: Erlouse

texts.en: Erlouse is a businesswoman in Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She runs and operates a convenience store that existed for ten years already. Like any other business, Erlouse experienced downfall that brought her to bankruptcy. Paglaum MPC come to the rescue and provides her the needed capital to open up her store. She successfully repaid her loan that she asks for another this time to restock store with canned goods, noodles, coffee, milk, detergent bar and powder, bath soaps, shampoo, condiments and confectioneries.

loans.use: to restock store with canned goods, noodles, coffee, milk, detergent bar and powder, bath soaps, shampoo, condiments and confectioneries

loans.name: Leah Kathleen

texts.en:
Leah Kathleen has switched from selling consumable goods to selling breads and pastries through her bakery business. Her business is doing well now that she doubles her time perfecting her own breads and pastries recipes. With her husband's help, she has maximized her profits and kept pursuing her goals for the good of her family.

For this purpose, she availed another loan from PMPC to purchase bags of flour, sugar, butter, margarine, cheese, cooking oil, leavening, shortening and other ingredients. Today, Leah Kathleen is able to help others by selling her breads and pastries to neighboring towns and earns profit as well.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour, sugar, butter, margarine, cheese, cooking oil, leavening, shortening and other ingredients.

loans.name: Dexi Lilibeth

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito Virgen  Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Dexi, tiene  33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos de 15, 11, 7 años y un bebé de 7 meses, el mayor estudian en colegio y dos estudian en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Dexi es una mujer que trabaja para ganar algo por su cuenta y así contribuir con los gastos que generan el hogar y la crianza de sus pequeños, para esto ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y  productos por catálogos de Avon, y Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), actualmente también está vendiendo productos naturales lo cual le está dejando muy buenos ingresos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella trabaja tres o cuatro días a la semana, ella deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente. Lleva más de 7 años en este negocio con el cual se gana la vida.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y productos naturales.  Lleva más de 8 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe de la institución. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The "Virgen del Mar" loan group meets every fortnight in the beautiful beach resort of San Mateo, in the city of Manta. Manta is known for its beautiful beaches, which are visited throughout the year by both domestic and international tourists. Here, the majority of locals work in fishing and other work related to the sea.

And it is here that 33-year-old Dexi lives. She is married and has four children, ages fifteen, eleven and seven years old, and seven months old. The eldest child is in high school while two are in primary school. Dexi's husband is a fisherman.

Dexi works in order to earn her own income and contribute to household costs and the up-bringing of her children. She works selling clothes and all sorts of products from Avan and Yanbal catalogues (such as beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories). She is currently also selling natural products, which provides her with a very good income. Dexi sells door-to-door. She works three days per week, selling on credit and collecting payments once a week. Dexi has been doing this work for seven years and it allows her to earn an income.

Dexi will use this loan to buy clothes, perfumes, costume jewellery, make-up, creams and natural products. Dexi has been with the loan group for eight years and likes it because of the benefits of being with the organisation. Dexi's dream is to give her family the best that she can.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfumes, costume jewellery, make-up, creams and natural products.

loans.name: Marifil

texts.en:
Marifil is a thirty-one year old married woman with 3 young dependents. She engages in selling tuba (coconut) wine. She is working hard to support the needs of her family.

Her husband is a welder and a laborer as well. Aside from tuba vending, she is also a dealer of Avon products like lotion, body spray, deodorant, whitening soap and ladies apparel.

She is asking for a loan to buy more supplies of tuba and additional capital to purchase Avon products. This is vital to augmenting her livelihood. It enables Marifil to purchase adequate supplies to cater to customers orders. Her income will slowly improve, and will allow her to continue to provide her family with nutritious meals.

She is thankful for the funds and she is determined to uplift the living condition of her family for sustainable living.

loans.use: to buy more supplies of tuba (coconut) and receive additional capital to purchase Avon products.

loans.name: Nicer

texts.en:
Nicer is 28 years old, married and lives in Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. As a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, she is given priority in financial services to alleviate her present financial conditions, along with the necessary financial literacy and other training in which she has actively participated. Nicer has seen changes in her general living condition from the moment she signed up for membership with the cooperative.

This time, she is asking for a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase materials for boat making such as lumber, plywood, bronze nails, sealant, paint, bamboo, a boat engine and fishing nets.

loans.use: to purchase materials for boat making such as lumber, plywood, bronze nails, sealant, paint, bamboo, a boat engine and fishing nets.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia always has enthusiasm for farming. She has cultivated rice land in Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work. Recently, she applied a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparation. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting.

Patricia knows that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season. In the future, Patricia hopes to buy a hauling truck for easy transport of produce.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a Lebanese, married man. He’s 42 years old and has four children. He’s really attached to his family. Cooperating together, Ali is capable of covering their heavy expenses in order to live a respectable life. He owns a shop where he sells detergents.

Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay fees for his children's studies and to buy their books. One of his greatest dreams is to see them achieving higher positions. Ali pursues to develop his work in the near future, so he can better support his family.

loans.use: to pay fees for his children's studies and to buy their books.

loans.name: Preselina

texts.pt: A Senhora Preselina vive na casa propria é casada e mãe de 3 filhos,todos frequentam a escola,acaba de concluir o curso de direito,mas ainda não conseguiu emprego,seu marido trabalha como professor numa escola privada mas o salario não chega para suprir as despesas doméstica,ela é uma pessoa que sempre procurou ajudar seu marido fazendo alguns negocios para sustentetar os seus estudos na faculdade. Neste momento trabalha com o dinheiro do emprestimo da Hluvuku,tem agora o segundo emprestimo onde pretende  comprar TVs Plasmas na Africa do sul para revender. Ela diz que nunca teve  falta de clientes para o seus produtos. Seu maior sonho é  tornar se uma empreendidora  de sucesso.O seu maior desafio é conseguir emprego fixo.
texts.en:
Preselina owns the house where she lives. She is married, and the mother of three children that go to school. She just finished taking a course in Law, but she has not been able to find a job yet. Her husband works as a teacher at a private school, but his salary is not enough to cover the home expenses.

Preselina has always looked for ways to help her husband by running some businesses in order to pay for her studies at the university. In this moment, she is working with a loan she received from Hluvuku. She is requesting a second loan, with which she is planning to buy plasma TVs in South Africa for resale.

She says that she always finds customers for her products. Her biggest dream is to become a successful entrepreneur. Her biggest challenge is to find a fixed employment position.

loans.use: to buy plasma TVs in South Africa for resale.

loans.name: Casimira

texts.en:
Casimira has been involved in activities since 2005. She started her business with her own working capital of $15.00. Casimira has a shop in her business. So she is requesting a loan of $1,000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants use it to buy additional supplies according to what people like. These include shampoo, toothpaste, soap, lighters, noodles, biscuits, sugar, slippers, cigarettes, candles, hand & body cream, milk, sardines, soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell.
She is happy because, with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can build her business much bigger in the future and her income can be increased.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, toothpaste, soap, lighters, noodles, biscuits, sugar, slippers, cigarettes, candles, hand & body cream, milk, sardines, soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 49 years old, married and has one child.

Juliana is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Juliana has been in this business for one year now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Juliana would like to save money to provide for and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is aged 42 and the mother of four children living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by profession, and sells fresh vegetables from his shop in a nearby town for many years. He offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this vegetable shop. Nowadays, the needs of his family suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to increase his daily sales so he can generate additional income but does not have enough cash in hand to buy vegetables in bulk. So, Razia requested a loan to help her husband in purchasing seasonal and fresh vegetables for reselling from his greengrocer shop. Razia is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy seasonal and fresh vegetable in bulk for her husband's greengrocer shop.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar es un hombre de 31 años de edad, es casado con una linda familia de dos hijos, uno de ellos estudia en la escuela de la comunidad y la otra aún está bajo su cuidado. Esta familia vive en una comunidad de la aldea chocola.
Oscar para sacar adelante a su familia, desde hace 10 años trabaja como jornalero, realizando todo tipo de trabajo, pero en específico en el cultivo de café. Oscar tiene el deseo de mejorar su casa pero no tiene los recursos necesarios  por tal motivo solicita un préstamo para la compra de cemento, cal  y arena para la remodelación de los servicios sanitarios.   Oscar espera conseguir el crédito para darle a su casa un mejor aspecto con la remodelación de los baños. Su esperanza de vida es ver a sus hijos convertidos en grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Oscar is a 31 year old man. He is married with a beautiful family of two children, one of them studies in the school in their community and other other is still under his care. This family lives in a community of Chocola village.

For ten years Oscar has worked as day labor to get his family ahead. He does any kind of work but especially with coffee crops. Oscar wants to improve his house but does not have the resources needed so for that reason he is requesting a loan to buy cement, lime and sand to remodel his bathroom. Oscar hopes to receive the loan to make his house look better with the remodeling of the bathroom. His life hope is to see his children become great professionals.

loans.use: to buy cement, lime and sand to remodel his bathroom.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicks, animal feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Meddie

texts.en:
Meddie, a 56-year-old married woman, requests 4,000,00 UGX for her fourth loan cycle from UGAFODE MDI. She has four school-aged children who are 24, 21, 18, and 15 years old.

She has sold groceries and made bricks since 2006 in the Kashenyi Ishaka municipality. She started this business to raise money to educate her children. She says she will use this loan to buy firewood to increase her income and sell bricks. She has limited working capital.

Her dream is to educate her children. She works hard and applauds UGAFODE MDI for their good customer service. She also appreciates Kiva funders for contributing in the fight against poverty.

loans.use: to buy fire wood.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn, 42, is a fish vendor. She sells fresh fish to the neighbors in her area. She has been a fish vendor for six years now. Her husband is a fisherman. They are blessed with five children. Her eldest is 16 while the youngest is 5. She resides in the town of Tolosa, Leyte. She also engages in food vending, to have supplemental income.

Marlyn needs capital when her husband's catch is very low. She would like to purchase fish to meet the family's daily needs.

A loan will help Marlyn buy a variety of fish and provide additional capital for food vending. With these, she would be able to improve her income and slowly settle her obligations. Also, she is doing her best to continue improving her sources of income to be productive. She will also be able to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish and provide additional capital for food vending.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 62 years old. She stays alone and supports five grown ups aged between 30 years and 22 years old. 

She has had a farming business for 20 years, and is currently earning a monthly income of KES 35,000. 

She has borrowed KES 40,000 from VisionFund Kenya as her third loan after paying the previous loan successfully. Mary will be using the loan to purchase farm inputs.

Therefore, she hopes that with the anticipated profits she will be able to expand and diversify into livestock and crop farming.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a well established farming business and enjoy a better life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to stock up on 20 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Tuinuke Group

texts.en:
Mariam is in her early 20s and is single with no children. She has been running a grocery store since 2013. She works from 12 noon to 11 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mariam's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her drinks and started selling spirits and wines. She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to repay the loan, to take care of her young sisters and mother, to take care of herself and cover household expenses.

She will use this loan to buy fast-moving drinks for her grocery store. She dreams of owning a pub.

Mariam will share this loan with her loan group Tuinuke, which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fast-moving drinks for her grocery store.

loans.name: Kawthar

texts.en:
Kawthar is a 57-year-old married mother of four children who has been running a catering business from her house for a long time.

She is the main supporter for her husband in covering their family's increasing living expenses. Kawthar is very ambitious; she is working hard to develop her family's living by starting an additional income business.

Starting an additional income business is expensive and requires a certain amount of money to invest. Thus, for this reason, Kawthar is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to start another income business by opening a small grocery store.

She hopes to succeed in running both business and make sure she can stay in good health to continue supporting her family members.

loans.use: to start another income business by opening a small grocery store.

loans.name: Kasuku Group

texts.en:
Pili, who is in her mid 50s, is married with five children. One of her children is in school and the others are grown up.

Pili has been a food vendor for twenty years now. She works from 5am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Pili’s 20th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase on mamalishe stock (for her open-air café) and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profits to pay school fees and the loan repayment, and she bought a plot of land, a TV set, a radio, a fridge, a mattress, beds, a sofa set, and covered household expenses.

Pili will use this loan to restock the out-of-stock items in her food store. She dreams of building her own house.

Pili will share this loan with her loan group, Kasuku, which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items in her food store.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros prepares and sells home meals to the locals in her place. She sells stewed vegetables, fish soup, fried chicken and other native viand (dishes). This is her family's main source of income.

To have supplemental income, Milagros also engages in raising hogs. She is married with four children. She also earns a living by being a farmer.

Milagros is willing to improve both her livelihoods to support the needs of her children, especially in sending them to school. She requested a loan to buy pig feed and supplies for food vending like meat, vegetables and seasonings.

These tools would help enhance and augment her earnings. It would help her sell quality hogs and serve a variety of meals to her customers.

Milagros is very thankful for the support, and she is doing her best to provide her family with the best she can be.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and supplies for food vending like meat, vegetables and seasonings.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie has five children, and all of them are still attending school. They are ages 3-18 years old respectively.

She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells commodities like candies, sugar, cooking oil, condiments, rice, assorted canned goods and chips. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. During her spare time she also sells home meals as another means of income.

Since a year ago, she has owned and operated a sari-sari (variety) store serving her neighbors. She faces a problem in terms of capital to sustain her livelihood.

Rosalie decided to avail herself of the loans and boost her business. With the 8,000 PHP, she wants to buy rice and dry goods, and for additional capital for food vending.

loans.use: to buy rice and dry goods, and for additional capital for food vending.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is a 55-year-old married woman who lives in the town of Tolosa, Leyte. She has raised and sold hogs for a quite period of time. She has two children.

Teodora needs the loan to buy feed and piglets in order to raise and sell them to make some profits. Her livelihood faces two obstacles. The first one is the lack of liquidity which limits her ability to expand, and the other is the seasonality of the livestock trade.

For the future, Teodora hopes to expand her project by increasing the number of livestock. She is grateful for being able to avail herself of the funds and for your continued support.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 42 years old, married to Nelly and blessed with four children aged between 14 years and 4 years old. 

He is a tea farmer, and he has been in farming for three years now, earning a monthly income of KES 12,000.

He has borrowed a loan of KES 40,000 from VFK, and this is his 10th loan with VisionFund Kenya. 

With the loan, he intends to buy fertilizer and seeds to improve his farming for better productivity.

His dream is to attain financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Cruz Adelina

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito Virgen  Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señorita Cruz, tiene 49  años de edad, es soltera y vive en compañía de un hermano, ella al igual que su hermano sufren de una rara enfermedad la cual a ella no le impide salir adelante.
Doña Cruz  es una mujer muy luchadora que no le gusta depender de nadie y ganarse la vida con su trabajo, ella tiene una tienda de víveres, allí ella vende víveres de toda clase, frutas, legumbres, embutidos,  ahí mismo también vende productos Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja en compañía de su hermano pues tiene que cuidarlo además de realizar sus labores. Ya son más de 16 años que lleva con este negocio el cual le permite tener sus ingresos principalmente para solventar sus gastos y los de su hermano el cual requiere de muchas medicinas y cuidados.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes y otros víveres. Lleva 12 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos sale adelante. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
The "Virgen Del Mar" communal bank meets every fortnight in the seaside resort of San Mateo in the city of Manta, which is known for it's beautiful beaches. It receives many visitors both national and international throughout the year. The majority of inhabitants of this place work in fishing or other work related to the ocean.

Cruz lives in this place. She is 49 years old, is single and lives with a brother. She and her brother both suffer from a rare disease which does not stop her from getting ahead.

Cruz is very much a fighter who doesn't like to depend on anyone and earns her living from her work. She has a food store where she sells foods of all kinds, fruit, vegetables, cold cuts and she also sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and accessories for women). She works in the company of her brother as she has to care for him as well as doing her work. She has had her business for more than 16 years and it allows her to have income to mainly pay her expenses and those of her brother who requires much medicine and care.

She will use this loan to buy rice, oil, detergents and other supplies. She has been in the communal bank for 12 years and she likes it as thanks to the loans she can get ahead. Her dream is to continue to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, detergents and other foods.

loans.name: Evaristo

texts.es:
Evaristo con 62 años de edad, de estado civil viudo, vive en casa propia, en el distrito de Pucará, provincia Jaén, departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú.Cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.

Evaristo se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público , cuenta con una unidad móvil de su propiedad (mototaxi),con más de 06 años de experiencia en el rubro, por lo que tiene mucha experiencia, además el cuenta con habitaciones destinadas para el alquiler de las mismas, las cuales están alquiladas a estudiantes del instituto de Pucará,el préstamo lo utilizará para el mantenimiento de su unidad móvil.

Socio recurrente para nuestra institución financiera.
texts.en:
Evaristo is 62 years old. He is a widower. He lives in his own home in the Pucará district, the Jaén province, Cajamarca department, in Peru. He has good personal and work references from the area residents.

Evaristo works providing public transport. He has his own mobile unit (motorcycle taxi) with more than 6 years of experience in the field. So he has a lot of experience. He also has rooms which he rents. They are rented to students of the Pucara Institute. The loan will be used for maintenance of his motorcycle taxi.

The member is returning for another loan from the financial institution.

loans.use: to use for the maintenance of his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
Valentina es una mujer soltera con 18 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Medellín. Por problemas económicos tuvo que dejar atrás muchos de sus sueños.
Ahora con la ayuda de Interactuar esta mujer desea tomar una capacitación de todo lo relacionado con cocina,  ser la profesional que siempre soñó e iniciar con su vida laboral.
Para comenzar con su mini negocio con el préstamo comprara utensilios de cocina y variedad de alimentos. 
Su actitud positiva y los deseos de salir adelante, permiten ver en esta mujer unas ganas inmensas de superarse y por supuesto una respuesta favorable a su petición. 
En la foto está con su padre que siempre la ha apoyado.
texts.en:
Valentina is a single woman who's 18 years old and lives in the town of Medellín. Due to financial struggles, she has had to give up on many of her dreams.

Now, with help from Interactuar, she wishes to get trained on everything related to cooking. She wishes to become the professional she's always dreamed of being and to get her career started.

In order to start her small business she'll use the loan to purchase kitchen supplies and a variety of foodstuffs.

Her positive attitude and her drive to get ahead make it clear that this woman has an immense will to succeed and that she'll certainly get a positive response to her plea. *Her father, who has always supported her, is the man in the photo

loans.use: to purchase kitchen supplies and a variety of foodstuffs.

loans.name: Deysi Francisca

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito Virgen  Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Daysi, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 20 y 8 años de edad, el menor estudia en escuela, ambos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Deysi es una muy buena ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de productos  Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, con la ayuda de los créditos ella compra productos de oferta y después los vende al precio normal con lo cual ella se gana algo extra, ella también parte del crédito se lo da a su marido para que lo utilice en la pesca.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y materiales de pesca. Lleva más de 15 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos les ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
The Virgen Del Mar group gets together twice a month in the beautiful seaside resort of San Mateo in the city of Manta. It is known for its beautiful beaches which are visited all year round by domestic and foreign tourists. Most of the local people here are fishermen or work in the fishing industry.

Daysi lives here. She is 38 years old, married with two children who are 20 and 8 years of age. The younger one is studying at school and both still live at home. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Deysi is a good housewife and in order to have her own resources and be able to help her husband with the household expenses she sells Yanbal ( beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women). She works three days a week for two or three hours a day. She leaves her products on credit and collects every week. With the support of the loans she can buy products on sale and later sell them at the full price with which she earns a little extra. She will also use some of this loan to give to her husband to be used for fishing.

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, and fishing supplies. She has been with the communal bank group for more than 15 years and likes it because the loans help them a lot. Her dreams are to continue improving her life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, and fishing supplies.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.pt:
A cliente Rosa comerciante de 57 anos de idade, mãe de 07 filhos,todos já independentes, vive  na casa própria, não  sustenta a mais ninguém.
Com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar roupa usada, aumentar a sua mercadoria para reforçar o seu negocio.
A cliente tem como sonho ampliar o seu negocio, construir uma casa muito melhorada, e comprar um carro .
Tem como principais desafios financeiros e tem estado a trabalhar pretende tomar mais vezes o crédito para alcançar os seus so
texts.en:
This client's name is Rosa. She is 57 years old, and the mother of seven children; all of them independent. She owns the house where she lives, and is not responsible for anyone else.

With the requested amount, she will buy used clothes. She will have more products to sell, and will strengthen her business.

Her dream is to expand her business, build a much better house, and buy a car.

Her main challenges are financial in nature, but she has continued working. She plans to apply for more loans in order to realize her dreams.

loans.use: to buy used clothes, have more products to sell, and strengthen her business.

loans.name: Canela Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario CANELA, está conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras, viven en la Comunidad de Lamlaya que se localiza a 10 kilómetros del municipio de Puerto Cabezas; se unieron hace 12 meses con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para poder tener acceso a préstamos en Pana Pana, que les permitiera incrementar el inventario de sus pequeños negocios, mejorar sus ingresos y así mejorar poco a poco las condiciones de vida de sus familias.

SHORLEY MARISOL: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una señora sonriente de 24 años de edad, casada con 1 hijo de 6 años. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y contribuir con los gastos del hogar, vende mariscos y bastimentos. Esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar en la comunidad de Lamlaya pescados, camarones, mariscos para venderlo a precios accesibles a sus clientes de la Ciudad de Bilwi. Ella sueña con tener una pulpería.
texts.en:
The "CANELA" communal bank is made up of three enterprising women. They live in the commnuity of Lamlaya which is located 10 kilometers from the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They got together 12 months ago with the aim of working in solidarity to be able to access loans from Pana Pana. This has allowed them to increase the inventory of their small businesses, improve their income, and little by little improve the living conditions of their families.

Shorley Marisol is one member of the group. She is a smiling 24 year old who is married and has a 6 year old child. With the goal of having her own source of income and to contribute to the household expenses she sells seafood and supplies. She is requesting a loan to buy fish, shrimp and seafood in the community of Lamlaya to sell at accessible prices to her clients in the city of Bilwi. She dreams of owning a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Ma. Arlene

texts.en: Ma. Arlene is 45 years old with children of school age. Ma. Arlene personally sells the catch from their fishing boat in nearby municipalities.  Since she became a member of Paglaum MPC, she has been a member in good standing for almost 3 years. She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to Php 12,000.00 for the purchase of new nets.  As much as possible, they have to have all the needed fishing accessories to minimize chances of a low or zero catch.  She already has floaters to help guard their fish cages.  She also wants to buy the fish catch of her neighbors so she can sell more fish to the nearby fish market, where they will fetch higher prices.  In the future, she dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales.  She wishes to see her children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: to purchase of new fishing nets.

loans.name: Magdalena
