texts.en: Magdalena is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired to support for her family. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of animal feeds. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meatshop in nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena , Misamis Occi

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia lives in Trinidad, Bohol with her family. In her place, is a vast land with rice fields. Bonifacia herself is a rice farmer. She is dependent on her crops and harvest so she can buy what she needs. Her children are all adult but Bonifacia needs to repair her toilet.

She is asking a loan of PHP4000 to pay for the repair. It is also important for Bonifacia to maintain the cleanliness and proper hygiene of her household. She is determined to pay her loan once she can have her harvest of rice.

loans.use: to pay for toilet repair

loans.name: Blesila

texts.en: Blesila is 28 years old and lives in Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with three children. Blesilda has a fish vending business and owns a fishing boat business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase a fishing boat for her fish selling business. Blesilda has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat for her fish selling business.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma landed at a right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. She is a public school teacher for almost 30 years. PMPC to Elma came as a rescue for lending her money when she needed it the most. Now, she availed another loan for the next cropping season. She loaned an amount for land and seedbed preparation.  Elma perseveres and always believe to reach her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Her name is Cecilia, age 62, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Ever since her husband died, Cecilia has dedicated herself to raising her six children, of which five are already married. Being a widow has been her biggest challenge in life, but with her faith and perseverance, she came out of it victoriously.

Three years ago, Cecilia opened a small general store which helps cover her daily personal and household needs. She earns by buying grocery supplies and clothes at wholesale prices and selling by the piece.

To help her sustain her store, she is humbly requesting funds in the amount of PHP 10,000 to fill her small store with food and household items, such as rice, canned goods, instant noodles, beverages, biscuits, eggs, and toiletries. Now, she is focused on her store in order to be able to support herself since most of her children already have their own families.

Cecilia hopes to have a big store someday. She prays that her children and their families will have an abundant life. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages, and toiletries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Ngoc's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Ngoc, is a Kinh ethnic majority woman. She has been joining in the program of M7-MFI’s forerunner in 2004. Her family consists of three members, including her husband and her son. The family is living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main occupation is cultivation and pig breeding. Her family has more than 3,000 square meters of cultivated land for grafted longan and vegetables. The income after deducting costs is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and to save a small amount.

She wants to raise pigs, but she does not have enough money to buy breeding pigs and food for them. Therefore, she wants to take a loan for this purpose.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time and she hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest in the breeding with high productivity. And then, when selling pig herd this year, it will bring her family a considerable profit.

loans.use: to buy breeding pigs and food for pigs

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is responsible mother of 3 children who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 12 years. Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because its current condition is not good and it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis.

Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to do maintenance on his taxi. Therefore Shazia has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.
With the help of this loan Shazia's husband can afford the maintenance costs easily. And provide the better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Shazia also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.
Shazia is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.en:
Jacinto is 66 years old and married. He lives in Southern Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.

He is one of the 35 pioneering members of Paglaum MPC and is a member of the Board of Directors. He actively participated in all activities of the cooperative and has managed his membership well, making him one of the Members In Good Standing.

Recently, Jacinto asked the coop for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy fish in bulk to resell.

loans.use: to buy fish in bulk to resell.

loans.name: Crisologo

texts.en:
Crisologo is 52 years old and from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. He is married, and among his children, he is still supporting a 17-year-old.

Farming has been his source of income for his family for 20 years now. His wife also helps him, so when the farm does not need his time, he also does carpentry work for an income.

He wants to give his kids a better future, which is the very reason why he is working hard on his farming business and carpentry.

Crisologo is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy fertilizer for his farm to improve his yield. His profit will be used to finance his child’s schooling and future savings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Fifty-five-year old Alicia owns a farm and grows rice. She is married with a 20-year-old daughter still attending school.

She has been into farming for 10 years now. Alicia also raises and sells pigs as additional income for the family.

She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and pig supplement. These could help improve both her sources of livelihood, and she wishes to continue to expand.

Alicia is hoping that she would be able to let her daughter finish her studies for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pig supplement.

loans.name: Neza

texts.en:
Neza is from the village of Bato, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old and is married.

Neza owns and operates a sari-sari store (convenience store), selling consumable goods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Neza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Neza is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil and soy sauce.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil and soy sauce.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is a 63-year-old rice farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She has been in the rice farming business for five years now. She also sells vegetables, such as eggplant, squash, string beans and bitter gourd. This is the source of her income.

Diosdada is asking for a loan to buy vegetables, such as eggplant and squash. She hopes to expand her farming business in the future and make it a success so she can have a prosperous life in her old age.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables, such as eggplant and squash.

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa hails from the town of Ormoc. She is married and has no children. She earns a living by raising and selling hogs. She sells them to the local market and town settlers in her community.

She would like to boost her earnings by raising more quality hogs and having sufficient supply of feed to become sustainable. Slowly, she would be able to set aside enough savings to invest in business opportunities.

In the future, Andresa is looking forward to have a stable source of income, and she extends thanks in advance for the support of her loan.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a hard-working mother who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of supporting her family.

Recently, she requested a loan to purchase bags of animal feed.

Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she is thinking of adding to her business pig heads for commercial sale.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz has been a member of Paglaum MPC for 15 years and has enjoyed the benefits of membership. She is grateful to the cooperative, for she is supported on all of her medical needs.

This time, she approached the cooperative for another loan to purchase maintenance medicines and vitamins.

loans.use: to purchase maintenance medicines and vitamins

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene owns a rice paddy. She grows and sells rice to earn an income. She is married and has no dependents. Her husband is also a farmer. They support each other to improve their livelihood. She lives in the town of Ormoc City.

For the past 14 years, Arlene has been selling rice to the locals in her town. She would like to enhance the yield of her farm to become stable. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer, pesticide and rice seedlings. She could then start to maximize the resources and augment her income.

Arlene dreams of having a small business that could be reliable to support her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide and rice seedlings.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a 28-year-old lady and the responsible mother of one child. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

Her husband has been running his own press business for the past seven years. He needs to purchase a press machine and other tools for his business, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to do so. To fulfill her husband's business needs, Asma has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With this loan, she will help her husband to buy these items for his business. It will be good for him to earn more income, and this income will support him to meet his family's needs.

Asma is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a press machine and other tools for her husband's press business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy differently sized pots

loans.name: Renacer Boqueron 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “RENACER BOQUERON 2” es un grupo nuevo formado en Ciudad del Este, las integrantes son mujeres jefas de familia que decidieron dar el primer paso para mejorar sus condiciones de vida, y superar su situación de pobreza a través del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Deisy, una humilde vendedora de ropas que trabaja en esto hace ya un buen tiempo, ella por medio de su trabajo tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y sus seres queridos. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que se esfuerza por ser alguien en la vida y ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de ropas para la venta, como ser remeras, camisas, jeans, pantalones y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, y agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
The "Renacer Boqueron 2" Group is a new group in Cuidad del Este.  The members are women who are heads of their households who decided to take the first step to improve their lives and overcome their situation of poverty through the poverty elimination program.  

One of the members is Deisy, a humble clothing salesman who has been in business for a long time.  She is able to help her family and her loved ones through her work.  She is a hard-working person and a fighter who works hard to be someone in life and help her family.

She is asking for this loan so that she can buy clothing to sell, such as t-shirts, shirts, jeans, and pants, among other things, and therefore be able to continue selling as she has been.  She is thankful for this opportunity to improve her life.

loans.use: to buy various clothing, such as t-shirts, shirts, jeans, and pants, among other things.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man with 4 children. He describes himself to be humble.

Joseph operates a shoe repair business. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy materials for shoe repairs.

This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bean seeds and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a 34 year old cereals trader at Changamwe Kenya. He is a father of one who has been in this business for the last year and is doing well.

This is his first time borrowing from Visionfund Kenya to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase mung beans, maize, and beans. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business. He hopes to be successful in his business.

loans.use: to purchase mung beans, maize and beans.

loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre Las Mercedes, está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, una ciudad distante de la capital del país, que tiene poco acceso a ciertos medios, donde las integrantes luchan por mejorar cada día.
La Sra. Fermina, es una de las integrantes, ella tiene una despensa en la que todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas, tiene todo tipo de productos, y es por ello que siempre tiene buena clientela, pues ofrece variedad y calidad a sus clientes.
Fermina  solicita este préstamo para la compra de golosinas, bebidas, comestibles, panificados, verduras, frutas y otros, y así seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The Las Mercedes Group is in it's first cycle of the women's committee program.  The group is located in the city of Curuguaty, a city far from the capital of the country that has little access to certain amenities, where the members struggle to improve their lives every day.  

Fermina, one of the members of the group, has a grocery store where she works every day from very early in the morning.  She sells all kids of products, and therefore she has many customers since she offers them variety and quality.  

Fermina is requesting a loan to buy candy, drinks, food, bread products, vegetables, fruits, and other groceries, so that she can continue on with her work as before.  She is thankful for the opportunity to improve her life.

loans.use: to buy candy, drinks, food, bread products, vegetables, fruits, and other groceries.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en: Felipa is a 46-year-old married woman and the mother of four children ages 7 to 22. She is from San Miguel, Bohol. She has run a sari-sari or variety store business for more than three years now. She sells various goods and commodities to the people in her locality. Felipa is asking for a loan to buy additional merchandise to sell like coke, pepsi, sugar, gasoline and kulafu (liquor). With this stock, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers in her store who are asking for these types of goods on a daily basis, thus augmenting her sales and profit. In the future, Felipa has hopes of making her business a success and saving money for reinvestment in the same venture.

loans.use: to buy coke, pepsi, sugar, gasoline and kulafu (liquor)

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a responsible mother. She is requesting a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to increase her inventory of ingredients. She wants to purchase additional bags of flour for her bakery.

This way, she will be able to sell more products which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase additional bags of flour for her bakery.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a businesswoman from Sindangan. She is a 58 year old widow with expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family.

Aida is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

Aida continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma is 43 years old, married and lives in Eastern Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is receiving a monthly allotment from her husband working abroad that primarily suffices for the needs of her family. She also nurtures her membership with Paglaum MPC and she is grateful that she is supported for all her needs. Recently, she availed herself of a loan to buy out a pawned parcel of land.

loans.use: to buy out a pawned parcel of land.

loans.name: Cumadura Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por cuatro mujeres, todas son de la etnia miskita de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que luchan día a día por hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios; se organizaron como grupo solidario desde hace ocho meses para gestionar préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana. Decidieron nombrar al grupo solidario CUMADURA, en vocablo miskito significa arcoíris.

ROSALIA: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una señora amable de 34 años de edad, casada con 3 hijos: 2 adolescentes que estudian su primaria y una pequeña de un año de edad. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal como pescador artesanal. Con el propósito de contribuir con los gastos del hogar y tener su propia fuente de ingresos, vende ropa usada en un tramo que tiene en uno de los mercados del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar en Managua una paca de ropa usada mixta y venderla a precios accesibles a su clientela de Bilwi. Ella sueña con tener el suficiente capital para establecer una carnicería.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of four women. All of them belong to the Miskita ethnic group, from the town of Bilwi in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They are enterprising women who work hard every day to make their small businesses grow. They organized themselves as a communal bank eight months ago, to access loans with a solidarity guarantee through Pana Pana. They decided to name their communal bank "Cumadura," which means "Rainbow" in the Miskito language.

Rosalia is a member of the communal bank. She is a friendly 34-year-old woman, married with three children: two adolescents who are in grade school and a little one-year-old daughter. Her husband works in an informal manner as a traditional fisherman. With the aim of contributing to the household expenses and having her own source of income, she sells used clothing at a stand she maintains at one of the municipal markets of Puerto Cabezas. She is requesting a loan to buy a package of mixed used clothing in Managua, so she can sell it at affordable prices to her customers in Bilwi. She dreams of having enough capital to open a butcher shop.

loans.use: to buy a package of mixed used clothing in Managua.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a responsible mother of five children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her brother has been providing transport facilities by driving a Suzuki for three years. Her brother needs to do maintenance on his Suzuki because the current condition of his Suzuki is not good and it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis.

Due to insufficient financial means, her brother is unable to do maintenance on his Suzuki. Therefore Asma has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan Asma's brother can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Asma also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her brother's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Asma is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her brother to repair his Suzuki.

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia, age 38, is the mother of two children. Her husband owns an embroidery shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. Her husband needs to purchase a new variety of embroidery material to resell. However, due to lack of money, her husband finds it difficult. This will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally. For that, his wife Fouzia is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband.

Her husband will purchase an embroidery machine and a new variety of embroidery materials. Fouzia is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to increase his embroidery business.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora has switched from selling snacks to selling longganisa (sausages). Her business is doing well since she doubled her time perfecting her own longganisa recipe. With her husband's help, she has maximized her profits and keeps pursuing her goals for the good of her family.

She is taking another loan from PMPC, to buy more kilos of meat for her longganisa business.

Today, Flora is able to help others with their retailing businesses with her longganisa. They can also earn for their own families.

loans.use: to buy more kilos of meat for her longganisa (sausage) business.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. As a farmer in Silanga, Tangub City, he tried his luck and borrowed a loan to jump start his corn production. After several months, he was able to return his borrowed capital. To this day, Ernesto feels he owes his good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used for his business.

Recently, he asked for a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Ernesto wishes to sustain his business and be able to supply corn in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is responsible and dedicated in her work as a tailor. This is her only source of income and she is very grateful for her life and being allowed to be independent.

She has a business producing school uniforms and carrying out repairs to clothes. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive. She applied for a loan in order to expand her business and increase production. She will buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies. This will allow her to generate more income and be able to provide tailoring services.

loans.use: buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies

loans.name: Mari Gold

texts.en:
Mari Gold has wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming work from growing, caring, and harvesting and making a profit as well.  She has supported her husband in doing this type of work.  

Like a prudent farmer, Mari Gold has nurtured her membership with PMPC and maintained a good repayment record. She knew she could always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. 

Recently, she applied a loan to buy rice seeds, which she hopes will yield good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.  

Someday, Mari Gold hopes to buy more rice land to cultivate and add income for her family.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds that will yield good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings

loans.name: Menerma

texts.en: Menerma has never gotten tired of tending her sari-sari store (convenience store) to help her husband, who is working abroad, in augmenting their income. She is aware that she needs to do it knowing she has increasing expenses because she has two children studying in college. To pay for the tuition fee of her eldest son, she approached Paglaum MPC for a loan of PHP 10,000.

loans.use: to pay for the tuition fee of her eldest son

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is a strong-willed woman who will do anything for her family. She is 71 years old and married, with six adult children.  She lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. 

She operates a hog-raising business that is primarily financed by Paglaum MPC.  The business gives her a quarterly income of  PHP 15,000, which sufficiently provides for the needs of her family. 

Recently, she has requested another loan to buy piglets and bags of animal feed.

loans.use: to buy piglets and bags of animal feed.

loans.name: Cecille

texts.en: Cecille runs a sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place in Trinidad, Bohol. Cecille is also engaged in selling dried fish, which is very profitable.  She works hard to earn a living, so that she can help her husband in meeting their family needs. Cecille is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, candies, seasonings and buy dried fish in bulk. With this loan, Cecille believes that she can improve her business and her earnings.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, candies, seasonings and buy dried fish in bulk.

loans.name: Bobby

texts.en:
Bobby is 49 years old and a widow.  She lives in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. 

As a microfinance member of Paglaum MPC, she is given priority in financial services to improve her present financial condition by providing financial literacy and other training, in which she actively participated. 

Bobby has seen the changes in her general living condition from the moment she signed up for membership with the cooperative. This time, she is asking a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy materials for building a boat, such as lumber, plywood, bronze nails, sealant, paint, bamboo, a boat engine, and fishing nets.

loans.use: to buy all the materials for building a boat.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is an old client of BRAC and this is her fourth loan. She is receiving the loan for her husband. In fact, he drives an auto rickshaw. He has been driving the auto rickshaw for many years with petrol which is very costly. Due to an increase in the cost of petrol, he sold his old rickshaw and wants to buy a new CNG (compressed natural gas) rickshaw. With the contribution of savings and the selling price of the old rickshaw, he is still some amount short for buying a new CNG rickshaw.

Therefore, Shazia has contacted Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, and through the loan amount her husband will buy a CNG rickshaw so he can minimize the fuel expense and can generate income for his entire family.

Shazia seems very happy after taking this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a CNG (compressed natural gas) rickshaw for her husband so he can minimize fuel costs.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is preparing for the next cropping season. She wants to prepare well her land and seedbed. She wants to have enough corn fertilizer so she applied for a loan from the cooperative. Rebecca hopes to save enough for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy corn fertilizer for more produce.

loans.name: Maksuda

texts.ru: Максуда очень миролюбивая и ответственная женщина. Проживает она в Вахшском районе. Ей 43 года, она замужем и имеет 3 детей.  Вот уже 15 лет как она занимается сельским хозяйством. Несмотря на то, что для женщины этот труд даётся нелегко, Максуда с большим успехом справляется с этой работой. Однако после того как дети выросли потребности тоже увеличились. В этой связи Максуда хочет увеличить свою деятельность и купить семена разных видов овощей и минеральных удобрений, но для этого ей необходима ваша помощь. Она надеется только на нее.
texts.en: Maksuda is a very peace-loving and responsible woman. She lives in the Vakhsh district. She is 43 years old, married and has 3 children. She has been involved in agriculture for 15 years. Despite the fact that this work is especially difficult for women, Maksuda handles her work with a lot of success; however, after her children have grown up, the needs increased as well. This is why Maksuda wants to grow her business and buy different vegetable seeds and mineral fertilizers, but needs your help to do so. She has no one else to rely on.

loans.use: to buy different vegetable seeds and mineral fertilizers in order to grow her business

loans.name: Ma. Lina

texts.en: Ma. Lina is 43 years old and is a married woman with three children, two of whom still attend school. She has had a sari-sari store business for 12 years now. She sells chips, candies, glue, paper, canned sardines, corned beef, shampoo and detergent. She is able to help provide for her family's daily needs with her income from the store. However, Ma. Lina also experiences times when there's almost nothing left to reinvest in her store. She hopes for her daily income to increase so she can help more with their household needs. She plans to use her loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, and toiletries. Ma. Lina hopes for her sari-sari store business to grow.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, and toiletries

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a resident of Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married and has two children, ages 7 and 5 years old. Her husband is engaged in farming while Maricel runs a sari-sari (variety) store business.

Maricel has been in business for five years. Maricel and her husband work hard to earn a living and to provide for the needs of their children. They also want their children to have a good education.

Maricel wants to increase her family's income for her children's education. She dreams for them to finish their studies. She is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to help her buy grocery items such as soft drinks, toiletries, laundry soap, spices, eggs, canned goods, noodles, candies, chips, biscuits, sugar, coffee, powdered milk, powdered chocolate drink and juice.

She also plans to buy piglets for her hog-raising business and to pay for motorcycle maintenance. They own a motorcycle for easy transportation and as an additional source of income.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, toiletries, laundry soap, spices, eggs, canned goods, noodles, candies, chips, biscuits, sugar and coffee for her store; to buy piglets and feed; and to pay for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Florenita

texts.en:
Florenita signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the capital to start a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for capital extended to a small-time borrower like her. 

Florenita was able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of her good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. 

In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store, with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena , Misamis Occi

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe landed at the right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet when she went broke after her first business went bad. PMPC came to the rescue for Fe by lending her money when she needed it the most. Now, she has availed herself of another loan for the next cropping season. She borrowed an amount for land and seedbed preparation. Fe perseveres and always believes in reaching her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
To improve her life and to educate her two children, Zarina started her business selling livestock by taking out a loan from Kashf Foundation.

Zarina is 32 years old and married. She buys baby goats and calves at low prices, raises them and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income.

Zarina also sells milk to generate extra income. She needs to improve her business to meet her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more livestock to increase her sales.

She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Maximianito

texts.en:
Maximianito is 59 years old and married, and he lives at Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

To earn a living he buys piglets and raises pigs. With a desire to earn more, he decided to increase the number of piglets he raises. Through Pauglam MPC he obtained the capital to buy more piglets and feed. 

Now, he is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy more feed. He really hopes and prays that his business will grow and benefit his family, in addition to the income of his wife. 

Someday he wants to build a concrete pig cage to make it easier to keep sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of feed for his piglets

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena , Misamis Occi

loans.name: Sameena

texts.en: Sameena is a 28-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband is a driver by profession. In the past many days her husband purchased a new auto. However, due to the lack of money, her husband finds it difficult to cover the payment for the auto. Therefore Sameena has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of the auto payment. This will help him to continue his business. Sameena is so very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to pay the auto payment and increase his transportation business.

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en:
Flavia is 49 years old and the mother of two children, ages 16 and 18. She hails from Trinidad, a town in Bohol known for farming. which is Flavia's way of generating income for her family. She also raises hogs for supplemental income.

Flavia has requested a loan so she can buy her farming needs like fertilizer and more piglets to raise. Business profitability is her main goal so she can support her children’s schooling. Any additional income will go to her family’s daily needs and future savings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and piglets.

loans.name: Mary Bless

texts.en:
Mary Bless is 43 years old, married and has three school-age children. She has a collection of ornamental garden plants as her business venture.

Mary Bless finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities while earning income for her family. As a microfinance member of PMPC, she is seeking financial help to purchase a variety of ornamental plants to grow and sell.

In the future, Mary Bless wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of ornamental plants to grow and sell.

loans.name: Fortunato

texts.es:
Fortunato con 37 años de edad, vive en casa propia,de material rústico, vive junto a cónyuge,vive en el distrito de Cañaris, provincia de Ferreñafe, departamento de Lambayeque. Fortunato tiene 37 años radicando en la zona,cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.

Fortunato se dedica a la actividad de la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de cafeto, ubicado en el caserío de Shin Shin - cañaris, con una experiencia en el rubro de 30 años, el préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.

Fortunato es socio recurrente para la institución, la campaña pasada se le otorgó créditos los cuáles los canceló puntualmente. Firma con cónyuge.
texts.en:
Fortunato, aged 37, lives with his wife in his own rustic home in the Cañaris district of Ferreñafe, a province in the Lambayeque region. He has been living in that area for 37 years and has very good personal and work references from the locals. 

Fortunato earns a living in agriculture, growing coffee in the Shin Shin hamlet of Cañaris. He has 30 years of experience in this field.

He will use the loan to carry out agricultural work, buy and use phytosanitary products and fertilizers, and pay for labour to help him with the harvest. This investment will help him to improve the morphological characteristics and physiological processes of his coffee plants, and to have a timely harvest. As a result, he will have a higher yield and a better quality product, which he will have no difficulty in selling.

Fortunato is a returning client of the institution. Last time, he was granted a loan, which he paid off punctually. He co-signs the loan with his wife.

loans.use: to carry out agricultural work, buy and use phytosanitary products and fertilizers, and pay for labour to help him with the harvest.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store.  She sells merchandise, like cooking oil, seasonings, coffee, powdered milk, pouch vinegar, soap, shampoo, eggs, and toiletries.  She would like to improve her earnings by purchasing assorted supplies for the store, such as soft drinks, beverages, and assorted dry goods.  These will help her maintain inventory levels and drive more buyers to the store.

She is married with three young children, all of whom are still attending school.  Most of her expenses are related to food and school fees.  She is hoping  to make her business sustainable for the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, beverages, and assorted dry goods for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma is 54 years old and has six children of adult age.  She has coco land that she cultivates, and she integrates other commodities for additional income.  Veronica plans to disperse goats on her farm.  She approached Paglaum MPC for assistance in buying more goats for dispersal.  She wants to take advantage of the high demand for goats to be butchered. In the future, Elma hopes to sustain her business and would love to open an eatery.

loans.use: to buy more goats for dispersal on her farm.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Fifty-three-year-old Susan is an entrepreneurial, forward thinker. Some years ago she set up her own bakery, which she is still running to this day. In order to expand her product portfolio, she is requesting a loan to purchase more ingredients for bread baking. Susan has a small bakery located at home where she works alongside her husband. They start their work day every day at 5 a.m. and continue until 6 p.m. She started the business thanks to family support and a baking course she took some years ago.Aiming at increasing production thanks to the good reception her products have in the sector, her greatest dream is to position the business in the local market and become number one. She hopes to provide her family with a proper quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients for bread baking.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia has a banana farm in Calamba, Misamis Occidental.  This is her primary source of income; her husband also earns income to help support the needs of her family.  She emphasizes good land preparation to generate the maximum crop yield and good income.  Recently, she received a loan from PMPC to pay for irrigation costs.  Virginia wishes to sustain her business and to be able to supply bananas in neighboring towns.

loans.use: to pay for labor for irrigation to soften tillage pans on her farm.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is 33 years old.  Her husband is unemployed, and it is very difficult for her to manage household expenses while he is jobless.  She wants to help her husband find a source of income.

There are many people driving rickshaws in the community, and she considers this to be an occupation that her husband can adopt.  For this reason, she wants to buy an auto rickshaw for her husband to operate.

Farzana requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy an auto rickshaw and generate reasonable income for his family.  She is very happy and relaxed after receiving this loan, and she thanks Kiva, lenders, and BRAC Pakistan (field partner) for their support.

loans.use: to buy an auto rickshaw for her husband to operate so that he can generate income for the family.

loans.name: Daylinda

texts.en:
Daylinda is 47 years old and married with two adult-age children from Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is a responsible mother, and she requests a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to increase her inventory.

She wants to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables for retail. This way, she will be able to sell more products, which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of fruits and vegetables for retail.

loans.name: Elly

texts.en: Elly wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost, and fertilizer, etc., so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost, and fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en: Teofila is juggling her farming activities and supervising the renovation of her home. Teofila hopes to live comfortably in a house with good roofing supported by her loan of PHP 50,000. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. Teofila has been given a priority as a microfinance member of PMPC. This is what she is thankful for, when all her financing needs for her business were supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement, plywood, iron and others materials for her house renovation.

loans.name: Ramzan

texts.en:
Ramzan has been making shoes for many years with the support of her husband (also shown in the photo).  She is an energetic person and is eager to support her family.  She is responsible for providing for the basic necessities of her children, including food, health, and clothing.  She is also accountable for improving their standard of living.  

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she is fulfilling her dreams and is able to manage her children's education.  Now, she requested a 50,000 PKR loan to buy additional materials for shoe making, including leather, artificial leather, plastic soles, etc.  In this way, she can handle the growing demand for her shoes in the market and better support her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for shoe making, including leather, artificial leather, plastic soles, etc.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.en:
This is Maria Victoria, aged 31, from Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ferdinand, a businessman, and is blessed with one child who is still at the elementary level in school. The couple live a simple life and they do their best to prepare for their child's future.

Maria Victoria derives her income from her mini store and small remittance business. To sustain her business, she is requesting funds in the amount of Php 19,000 to fill her store with food and household items such as canned goods, instant noodles, oil, eggs, beverages and toiletries.

She will use part of the loan to finance her "Smart Padala" business, which is a small remittance service for sending money locally. This will really help grow her business and thus provide for their daily sustenance and for sending her child to school.

Just like any small store owner, she aims to have a big store to increase her income and to be able to acquire their own house. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and to fund her small remittance business.

loans.name: Karen Christine

texts.en:
Karen Christine is a resident of Matag-ob, Leyte. She is married with two young children. She raises and sells hogs. She works hard to support the needs of her children. Aside from hog raising, she caters and sells electronic prepaid load to the local mobile subscribers in her place. She needs funds to support her existing businesses.

She has requested a loan to buy piglets and additional prepaid electronic load. It will boost her income and she will continue to handle it properly, thus supporting her family and providing a better living condition for her children. She is hoping that someday she will be productive in her chosen field of business.

loans.use: to buy piglets and additional prepaid electronic load.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn and her husband own a motorcycle that is used for transporting passengers from one place to the other. Her husband drives this every day to earn a living and to be able to provide for the needs of their children. Marilyn is a 50-year-old woman and a mother of four children ages 20, 18, 16 and 14 years old.

She is asking for a loan to fully pay her remaining balances for their motorcycle (refer to their motorcycle that is used in business) to be able to enhance their livelihood. Thus, in the future she wishes to improve their business to have a sustainable life. Occasionally her husband is also a carpenter, aside from driving their motorcycle.

loans.use: to fully pay her remaining balance for their motorcycle.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, e cliente antigua de la fundación, se dedica a la venta de perfumes y cosméticos, vive con sus padres, y de esta forma ayuda en los gastos de la casa para poder mejorar.
Había empezado esta actividad para solventar sus estudios, hoy en día ya es una profesional exitosa, pero no ha dejado de lado esta actividad que le ha dado mucho.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de perfumes variados y cosméticos, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir teniendo los ingresos que necesita para poder mejorar.
texts.en:
Emilia comes from the city of San Ignacio, and is a long-standing customer of the Fundación Paraguaya. She sells perfumes and cosmetics, and lives with her parents so that she can help with the household costs.

She began her business to pay for her studies, and is now a successful professional, but has continued her business because it has helped her considerably.

She is requesting a loan to buy perfumes and cosmetics, so that she can carry on earning the income she needs to be able to improve her life.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Lakhnu

texts.en:
Lakhnu is a 47 year old, married woman with 3 children. Some years back Lakhnu was hardly managing her household activities with her husband's small income. Then, through loans from Kashf Foundation she has initiated her hand embroidery business.

Lakhnu is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns by hand. Her skill is known throughout the town. She has requested a loan of 60,000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, thread and frames to meet her customers' orders on time to earn a good amount of profits.

This monetary help can take Lakhnu closer to her dream of providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, thread and frames to meet her customers' orders on time to earn a good amount of profits

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn, married with one child, is 47 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, where she has been growing rice to earn a living for five years.

A member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for four years, Jocelyn is requesting a loan to purchase farm supplies, which she believes will give her a better harvest.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Musart's Group

texts.en:
Musart is a 57-year-old woman, living with her spouse and ten children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She wants to provide better living facilities for her children, but it seems impossible, in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Her husband has been driving a motorized rickshaw for several years. His income is insufficient to feed his entire family. He has to maintain the rickshaw’s body, but he does not have sufficient capital to fix the problem.

Therefore, Musart has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. As the leader of Musart's Group, she will use her portion of the loan to enable her husband to buy a body for the motorized rickshaw.

She thanks Kiva and the field partner for this honorable support.

loans.use: to enable her husband to purchase a new body for his motorized rickshaw.

loans.name: Ñepytyvo Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Ñepytyvo está en su ciclo número   5 del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo bastante numeroso formado en la ciudad de Itá, todas ellas son amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad que luchan y se esfuerzan por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las personas que integra este grupo es la Sra. Benigna, quien vende joyas variadas por su barrio, tiene una buena clientela que siempre le hace muchos pedidos, y de esa forma se gana la vida, de una manera digna y honesta.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de joyas variadas para la venta, como ser: cadenas, anillos, aros, y otras joyas, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The Ñepytyvo Group is in its fifth loan cycle with the Women's Committee Program. It is a fairly large group, located in the city of Itá, and all the women are friends and neighbors who are determined to fight to improve their living conditions.

One of the members of the group is Benigna, who sells jewelry in her neighborhood. She has lots of customers who make plenty of orders, and in this way she earns a living honestly and with dignity.

She is requesting the loan to buy jewelry such as necklaces, rings and earrings to sell so that she can continue her business. She is grateful for this opportunity to improve her living conditions and those of her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy jewelry such as necklaces, rings, and earrings to sell.

loans.name: Riaz

texts.en:
Riaz is 21 years old and a hardworking, young lady. She has been providing the service of stitching clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. Riaz ’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele.

Riaz has requested a loan amount 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is a 61-year-old woman. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years she has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. She buys cloth in various fabrics and different colors and designs, from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.

Now, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs, to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Sakina expects a boost in her earnings with the loan, and she plans to spend the part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa has always had enthusiasm for farming. She has cultivated rice land in Calamba, Misamis Occidental and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work. Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Elisa knows that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a 44-year-old woman. She lives with her family in the town of Concepcion in Iloilo, Philippines.

Rita earns a living by running a sari-sari store business. She sells grocery items, such as soft drinks, eggs, spices, toiletries, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, chips, candies, biscuits, laundry soap, sugar, coffee, powdered milk, and chocolate milk.

Aside from her sari-sari store business, she is also engaged in a pig-raising business. Thus, she is asking a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy grocery items (mentioned earlier) and to buy piglets to raise.

In the future, Rita wishes to have additional capital to run her businesses.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, eggs, spices, toiletries, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, chips, candies, biscuits, laundry soap, sugar, coffee, powdered milk, and chocolate milk for her store and piglets for her pig-raising business.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta is a farmer from Calamba, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old and married with three adult-age children. She avails various loans from Paglaum MPC to head up for the next cropping season. She avails a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase bags of fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Cacao Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por dos mujeres y un hombre todos muy emprendedores, que se organizaron hace 8 meses, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para mejorar sus pequeño negocios incrementando su mercadería y así poder mejorar también sus ingresos que les permita poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios.

Javier Nicasio: Es el coordinador del grupo solidario, originario de Puerto Cabezas, es un señor cordial de 36 años de edad, es casado, tiene un pequeño hijo de dos años de edad. Debido a la falta de un empleo formal, desde hace 4 años vende de manera ambulante en un triciclo chiverías. Solicita financiamiento para comprar gaseosas y chiverías. Su sueño es tener un negocio próspero y construirle a su familia una vivienda de cemento  para que vivan de manera más segura.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is formed by two women and a man, all entrepreneurs, who formed the group eight months ago in order to access finance so that they could improve their small businesses and expand their stock. In this way, they can increase their earnings and cover their household costs, ensure their children are educated, and expand their businesses.

Javier Nicasio, aged 36, is the solidarity group's coordinator. He is a warm-hearted man, and is married and has a two-year-old son. Owing to the lack of formal employment, he has been selling snacks from a three-wheeled vehicle for the last four years. His dream is to have a prosperous business, and be able to build his family a cement-brick house so that they can live more securely.

loans.use: to buy sodas and snacks.

loans.name: Faquihi

texts.pt:
O cliente Faquihi,  de 52 anos de idade, casado e pai de 06 filho, dos quais 01 no ensino secundário, e os restantes já são maiores de idade , vive  na casa própria e não sustenta a mais ninguém .
Com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar uma maquina para fundir ouro, e comprar alguns gramas de ouro para melhorar o seu negocio.
O cliente tem como sonho  ampliar o seu negocio ,desenvolver a sua técnica formando se na área de ourivesaria, ver  seus filhos realizado na vida .
Tem como principais desafios financeiros e tem estado a trabalhar para supri-los, pretende tomar mais vezes para alcançar os seus sonhos.
texts.en:
This client's name is Faquihi. He is 52 years old, married, and the father of six children; one of them goes to secondary school, and the remaining ones are adults now. He owns the house where he lives and is not responsible for anyone else.

With the requested amount, he is planning to buy a machine to melt gold, and some grams of gold to improve his business.

The client's dream is to expand his business, develop his technique by studying goldsmithing, and see his children achieve their goals.

His main challenge is financial in nature, and he has continued working to overcome it. He plans to apply for more loans to achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to buy a machine to melt gold, and some grams of gold to improve his business.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Starting in 2010, farming rice has been Imelda's source of livelihood in Trinidad, Bohol. She is 45 years old and has six children between the ages of one and seventeen. Imelda plans to boost her business. She plans to buy fertilizer and rice seedlings for the planting season. She is aware the success and yield in farming that is attributed to fertilizer. In the future, Imelda dreams of being a successful parent in giving her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seedlings

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en:
Ignacia lives in San Miguel, Bohol. She has run a farming business and a hog raising business since she got married, to help her husband support their family. She has four grown children.

She applied for a loan and will use the money to buy feed, rice, noodles and canned food for family consumption. Ignacia hopes that all of her hard work will pay off with the income that she will generate after the harvest season.

loans.use: to buy feed, rice, noodles and canned food for consumption.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida, 39 years old, is very responsible with her household obligations. She has always been known to provide the best for her family. She currently lives with her husband and three children in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is a farmer, focusing on rice and vegetable farming.

She wants to increase her crop yield on her rice farm. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase a water pump for her farming operation, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump for her farm.

loans.name: Russili

texts.en:
Russili lives a simple life with her family in the town of Concepcion in Iloilo, Philippines. She is married and has six adult children. Her husband is a farmer, while Russili is engaged in a sari-sari store business. She has been running this business for 10 years. Aside from the sari-sari store business, she also engages in a RTW (ready-to-wear) business.

Thus, she is asking for a bigger loan amount to help her to buy fertilizer for their farm. She will also buy grocery items such as drinking liquor, soft drinks, chips, candies, biscuits, sugar, toiletries, spices, eggs, cooking oil, coffee, powdered milk, juice and powdered chocolate drink. In the future, she wants to improve her business to enhance their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, drinking liquor, soft drinks, chips, candies, biscuits, sugar, toiletries, spices, eggs, cooking oil, coffee, powdered milk, juice and powdered chocolate drink.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is encouraged because she accessed loans in the past and has not failed to pay on time. The funds she borrowed have certainly helped sustain her store and thus helped in their daily sustenance and to fund her children's schooling.

Once again she needs funds in the amount of 19,000 PHP loan to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, and instant noodles which she sells at retail prices. Her store means a lot to her since it has been her source of income for the past fourteen years and has sustained her family's basic needs. Although there are times she encounters difficulty collecting payment from some of her customers, she maintains her pleasant disposition and believes that things will get better. She continues to thank God for Kiva's and CCT's guidance on her spiritual life and livelihood.

Janet's precious dream is to see her children get a college education since she knows that it is their hope and path for a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages for her store's inventory

loans.name: Aventura Group

texts.es:
I.	Este grupo solidario está conformado por dos mujeres y un hombre todos muy emprendedores, que se organizaron hace 6 meses, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para mejorar sus pequeños negocios incrementando su mercadería y así poder mejorar también sus ingresos que les permita poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios.

HERMECINDA ERLINDA: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una señora alegre y sonriente de 36 años de edad, madre soltera de 2 hijos menores de edad. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a sus hijos vende bastimentos y mariscos de manera ambulante. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar filipitas, coco, pescados, camarones, frijoles, carbón. Ella sueña con establecer una pulpería
texts.en:
This communal bank is comprised of two women and a man, all of them enterprising people. They came together six months ago with the intention to have access to a loan that would improve their small businesses by increasing their stock levels, and in that way their income. This will help them to cover their families' basic needs, guarantee their children's education, and expand their businesses.

Hermecinda Erlina: Shes is the group's coordinator. She is a joyful and smiling 36-year-old woman. She is single, and the mother of two underage children. Thinking of getting ahead with her children, she sells meals and seafood as a street vendor.

She is requesting a loan to buy filipitas (a type of plantain), coconut, fish, shrimp, beans, and charcoal. She dreams of opening a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy plantains, coconut, fish, shrimp, beans, and charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food, such as meat, spices, bakery products, and vegetables.

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Amanecer está en su ciclo número 1, es un grupo nuevo, donde cada una esta poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante. Están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando y esforzándose por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Todas las mujeres de este grupo son muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, pero entre ellas se destaca la Sra. Victoriana, ella es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropas de forma particular, tiene mucha clientela en la zona, ya que hace tiempo se dedica a esta actividad, y esto le genera ingresos para ella y su familia. Su esposo también trabaja, y de esa forma ambos se ayudan para poder mantener su hogar y a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas para la venta, como ser remeras, camisas, jeans, pantalones, y otros, y así seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The Amanecer Group is in its first loan cycle. It is a new group, and each member is trying their utmost to be able to grow and succeed. The members are part of the poverty elimination program, and are all determined to improve their living conditions.

All the women in this group are very hard-working and entrepreneurial, but Victorina stands out. She sells clothing, and has many customers in the neighborhood as she has been running her business for a long time. This provides her and her family with an income. Her husband also works, and together they support their household and their loved ones.

She is requesting this loan to buy various items of clothing to sell, such as shirts, t-shirts, jeans, trousers, etc., so that she can continue her business. She is grateful for the opportunity to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy various items of clothing such as shirts, t-shirts, jeans, pants, etc.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela is a 46-year-old, married woman with five children.

Thirteen years ago, she started working in the rice paddies to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She grows and sells rice to the local dwellers in her place.

Marcela is a hard worker who is trying desperately to develop her business, but she is also a sacrificing mother who deprives herself for the sake of her children.

Marcela has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer and feed and pay for labor expenses.

She hopes to expand her business in the future through creating a bigger piggery to increase her income and be able to continue financing the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and feed and pay for labor expenses.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie runs a sari-sari (variety) store, he sells various merchandise ranging from energy drinks, biscuits, tooth paste, shampoo, sugar, cooking oil, soft drinks and dry goods. Aside from running a sari-sari (variety) store he raises and sells hogs. He is 40-year-old single man from Tolosa, Leyte.

He would like to improve the content of his store by maintaining the inventory of his stocks. He decided to avail the loan to buy store commodities like soft drinks, beverages and assorted dry goods, and materials for the pig pen. These would boost his sources of living and he could maximize all to become more productive.

loans.use: to buy store commodities like soft drinks, beverages and assorted dry goods, and also materials for the pig pen.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Fifty-five year old Yolanda is married and has six grown children. She hails in the town of Tolosa, Leyte. For two years she has operated a sari-sari (variety) store, and she sells commodities like sugar, noodles, powdered milk, spices, soft drinks and toiletries.
 
Aside from running a sari-sari (variety) store, she also sells fresh fish as supplemental income. She operates the sari-sari store situated just near to her home and serving locals who live in her community.

A loan of 10,000 PHP can buy stocks of fresh fish and assorted stock for the store. These could help boost both her sources of living to become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fresh fish and assorted stock for the store.

loans.name: Velinda

texts.en:
Velinda supports her family by selling Avon products. She caters to the local settlers in her place. She is married woman with five children, and three of them are still attending school. Her husband works in a private company. His income helps defray the family's daily expenses. Aside from selling Avon products, Velinda also raises and sells hogs. She sells Avon products like ladies’ accessories like necklaces, bangles and earrings, whitening soap, body spray, lotion and ladies’ apparel.

These will improve her earnings and she will be able to settle her obligations. In the future, Velinda is exerting effort to handle both of her projects to become more successful.

loans.use: to purchase supplies of Avon and pig feed.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes has been a farmer for seven years now. She is from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman with four children. Her eldest is eight, and the youngest is one.

Lourdes is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for farm labor. With this, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest, while helping other farmers in the community.

In the future, Lourdes hopes to make her business more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and pay for farm labor.

loans.name: Hermocilia

texts.en: Hermocilia started a small-time business and became a boss with her sari-sari store. She has managed to have enough inventory and rolls up her capital to gain more profit. Every day she has made good sales because she is the only store in her barangay. Recently she approached Paglaum for much needed capital to restock her store with basic commodities. In the future, she hopes to mount a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani is a resident in the town of Tolosa, Leyte. She is 40 years old with six children. Her oldest child is 18 while the youngest is 2. She owns a sari-sari (variety) store selling merchandise like shampoo, Tide powder, insect repellent and Avon products like whitening lotion, beauty soap and the like.

She has requested a loan to buy supplies for the store and to purchase Avon products. With these, she can fill her store and attract potential consumers to avail the products. Thus, she will be able to provide her family with nutritious diets and better shelter to live. With these, Lani could now start to expand and be able to pay her obligations and handle her resources wisely.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the store and to purchase Avon products.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona operates a videoke entertainment service. Aside from that, she also engages in a food vending business. She is a 60-year-old, married woman with three grown children. Her husband is farmer.

She needs additional capital to improve her livelihood. She has requested a loan to buy supplies for food vending and fertilizers for the farm. These are vital in augmenting her sources of living. It could help boost and slowly enable her to expand. In the future, Ramona will do her best to improve the family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy supplies for food vending and fertilizers for the farm.

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.en:
Timoteo is a married man and the father of six children from San Miguel, Bohol. He earns a living by making charcoal out of empty coconut shells and farming rice. This is something that he is good at, and the income supports the needs of his family.

Timoteo is asking for a loan to buy more coconut shells for charcoal-making and piglets so he can start a hog-raising business. With this, he will be able to make more charcoal; thus allowing him to sell more in the market.

In the future, Timoteo has hopes of making his business sustainable. Moreover, he wants to save money for the school expenses of his children.

loans.use: to buy empty coconut shells and piglets.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina hails from Trinidad, Bohol. She is 53 years old and married, with four dependents aged 13, 15, 17, and 19. With her spouse, she works hard on the farm growing rice for an income, as well as running a sari-sari store business.

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, canned food, noodles, diapers, shampoo, detergent, coffee, and toothpaste. She wanted to increase her income for her family’s benefit. Any additional profit will go towards expansion of her farming business and the school fees of her children.

In the future, she hopes to see her children having a better chance in life through education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, canned food, noodles, diapers, shampoo, detergent, coffee, and toothpaste.

loans.name: Aukatangni Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por dos mujeres y un hombre todos muy emprendedores, que se organizaron hace 6 meses, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para mejorar sus pequeños negocios incrementando su mercadería y así poder mejorar también sus ingresos que les permita poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios. Decidieron nombrar al grupo solidario AUKATANGNI, en vocablo miskito significa flor del vejuco.

Lucha: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una señora sonriente de 45 años de edad, casada con 4 hijos adolescentes que estudian su primaria y secundaria. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal, como reparador de electrodomésticos. Con el propósito de contribuir con los gastos del hogar, educación de sus hijos y tener su propia fuente de ingresos, ha establecido en un tramo del mercado municipal, venta de cuajada, frijoles cocidos, bastimentos y cosméticos por catálogos. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar granos básicos, chiverías, carbón, productos lácteos, entre otros productos. Ella sueña con tener una pulpería.
texts.en:
This communal bank is comprised of two women and a man, all of them enterprising people. They came together six months ago with the intention to have access to financing to improve their small businesses by increasing the amount of products they sell, and improving their income. This would help them to cover their families' basic needs, guarantee their childrens' education, and expand their businesses. They decided to name the group Aukatangni, which in the Wiskito language means "liana's flower."

Lucha is a member of this communal bank. She is a 45-year-old smiling woman. She is married and has four teenage children who go to primary and secondary school. Her husband works in the informal sector, repairing home appliances. Thinking of contributing to cover the home expenses and her children's education, and generating her own income, she started selling cottage cheese, cooked beans, supplies, and catalog cosmetics at a spacew in the local marketplace.

She is requesting a loan to buy basic grains, Chivería brand products, charcoak, dairy products, and others. Her dream is to have a corner store.

loans.use: to buy cereals, snacks, charcoal, and dairy products, among other products.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a married woman and a mother of seven children from Trinidad, Bohol. She is engaged in a fishing business with her husband. Aside from fishing, she also farms rice, so she can save for the school fees of her children. This is their main source of income.

Cristina is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and fishing nets. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, and she can manage her farm well. This will give them more fish to sell in the market and an abundant harvest in four months time. In the future, Cristina hopes to build a beautiful house for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fishing nets.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Luchadoras  está en su ciclo número 2º  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas hacen la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Cinthia es una de las que integra este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales en forma ambulante, por medio de este humilde trabajo tiene los medios para poder procurar una mejor calidad de vida para su familia. Cinthia es una mujer muy sacrificada que todos los días empieza sus ventas desde muy tempranas horas, tiene ya una buena clientela que siempre va hasta ella.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de remedios naturales, para poder venderlos, y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
The group Mujeres Luchadoras (Tenacious Women) is in it's second women's committee cycle. They all take the poverty elimination survey to improve their living conditions and those of their loved ones.

Cinthia is one of the members of this group. She sells natural remedies door-to-door. Through this humble work she has the means to ensure a better quality of life for her family. Cinthia is a selfless woman that starts her sales at the early hours every day. She has a good clientele that always comes to her.

She is requesting this loan to invest in buying natural remedies so that she can sell them and thus continue to help her family. She is thankful for the opportunity she receives to improve every day.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies to sell.

loans.name: Carmilo

texts.en:
Carmilo is 39 years old and from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. He is married and has three children, ages 7-13. Carmilo relies on fishing to support his family. He has been engaged in fishing for an income for many years now.

He is asking for a loan to buy a new fish net, which he can use to replace the old one that has tear and has been repaired a few times. This will help a lot, so he can catch more fish and maximize his fishing time. The income from his business provides food and school fees for his children.
