In the future, he hopes to expand his business and be able to support his children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy a new fish net.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara has worked hard preparing for the post-harvest operations of her palay (rice)farm in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She wants to ensure that she will have ample time for the threshing, drying, storage and processing of her harvest to make way for another cropping season. She presented her proposal to Paglaum MPC and requested a loan.

Genara hopes to see all her children finish their degrees and have stable careers.

loans.use: to pay for post harvest operations

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 50 years old and earns a living through her internet cafe. Her business offers encoding, printing, web surfing, games and other services to her local costumers, mostly students at the nearest school. She believes that she is on the right track for she is earning an approximate income of PHP 35,000 per month. This income is enough to send all her children to school especially her eldest child who is in college.

In need of an amount for renovating internet cafe building, she is asking for a loan from Paglaum MPC. The amount shall be spent to purchase bags of cement, paints, plywood and others materials for renovation.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement, paints, plywood and others materials for her renovation.

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre Santa Lucia está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida a través del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
La Sra. Ana, una de las integrantes de este grupo, solicita este préstamo para la compra de bebidas variadas para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. La Sra. Ana es una persona muy trabajadora, que se ha hecho muy conocida en el barrio por tener siempre buena variedad de productos que ofrece siempre a sus clientes. 
Cada una de las integrantes pone su mayor esfuerzo para poder mejorar y crecer para poder ayudar a sus familias.
texts.en:
The “Santa Lucia” communal bank is in their first loan cycle with the women’s program committee, where all the members work to improve their standard of living through the poverty elimination program.

Ana, one of the group’s members, is requesting a loan to purchase assorted beverages so that she can continue with her sales as she has been doing. Ana is a hard worker who is very well-known in her neighborhood because she always has a good variety of products to offer her customers.

Each one of the members puts in their best effort in order to improve and grow so that they can support their families.

loans.use: to purchase beverages for sale.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.pt:
O cliente Fernando Serralheiro de 33 anos de idade, casado e pai de 02 filhos, dos quais 01 frequenta o ensino primário e 01 no ensino pré-elementar, vive  na casa dos pais e não  sustenta mais ninguém.
Com o valor do empréstimo ira comprar cantoneiras, ferro 06, tubos , chapas , ferro Z, ferro T, dobradiças, tranqueta para ampliar o seu negocio de seralharia .
O cliente tem como sonho ampliar o seu negocio e construir uma casa melhorada
Tem como principais desafios financeiros e tem estado a trabalhar para suprí-los, pretende tomar mais vezes o crédito para alcançar os seus sonhos. Com o credito anterior fez blocos e comprou algum material  de construção
texts.en:
Fernando is a client who works as a locksmith. He is 33 years old, married, and the father of two children; one of them goes to primary school, and the other one to preschool. He lives with his parents and is not responsible for anyone else.

With the requested amount, he will buy angle trims, 6" iron bars, pipes, sheets, Z-shaped brackets, T-shaped brackets, hinges, and locks to expand his locksmithing business.

This client's dreams are to expand his business and build an improved house.

His main challenges are financial in nature, and he has continued working to overcome them. He is planning to apply for more loans to achieve his dreams. With the previous loan, he made bricks and bought construction materials.

loans.use: to buy angle trims, 6" iron bars, pipes, sheets, Z-shaped brackets, T-shaped brackets, hinges, and locks to expand his locksmithing business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy soaps, bleach, fabric softener, and other laundry products.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is a businesswoman who earns through her snack vending business. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurances and financial assistance.

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. She is on her way to renovating her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene lives in Trinidad, Bohol. She is 37 years old and married, with two children, ages three and eight.

Irene farms rice and helps her husband who is into fishing. With her spouse, she works hard on the farm, growing rice for an income.

She is asking for a loan to buy crab traps. She wanted to increase her income for her family’s benefit. Any additional profit will go towards expansion of her farming business.

In the future, she hopes to see her children have a better chance in life through schooling.

loans.use: to buy crab traps

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a farmer from the community of Trinidad, Bohol. She also operates a Sari-sari store business for supplementary income. She is 28 years old and married with three children ages 1, 3 and 8. She is working hard so that she can provide for her family’s needs.

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and items for her store, such as milk, coffee, seasonings, bath soap, detergent, noodles, canned sardines, beef loaf and corned beef. Sales will help pay school fees for her child.

She hopes that with the help of the loan, she will be more productive in her farming and she will be able to have a good harvest and increase her store's sales. In the future, she plans to have a bigger farm to earn more.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and items for her store such as milk, coffee, seasonings, bath soap, detergent, noodles, canned sardines, beef loaf and corned beef.

loans.name: Caliente Group

texts.es: GLENDA: Es integrante del grupo solidario Caliente, es una señora sonriente y luchadora, de 41 años de edad, madre soltera de 5 hijos adolescentes que estudian su secundaria y primaria. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a sus hijos vende ropa usada y elabora pan de manera artesanal. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar ingredientes para elaborar; pan de coco, queque de banano, de yuca, Paty, entre otros productos. Ella sueña con tener un tramo en el mercado.
texts.en:
Glenda is a member of the Caliente group. She is a smiling and determined 41-year-old woman. Glenda is a single mother of five children and teenagers who study in high school and elementary school. In order to help her family get ahead, Glenda sells used clothing and makes traditional breads.

Glenda is requesting this loan in order to buy ingredients to make coconut bread, banana bread, yuca bread, Paty, and other items. Glenda dreams of having a section in the local market.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make coconut bread, banana bread, yuca bread, Paty, and other items.

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en:
Vicent is a new client of UGAFODE Microfinance and is 32 years old. He is a very active person involved in agriculture, especially tea farming and cattle rearing. He is married with four children, all school going, with one in secondary school and three in basic level.

He has requested a loan of UGX 1,500,000= (One million five hundred thousand shillings only) to improve his agricultural production, especially his tea crop. When he gets the loan, he will use it to buy organic manure, which will help to increase his production.

He started his business in 2012 to earn additional income for the development. He carries out his agriculture in the rural area of Katalemwa village, Kibazi parish, Bushenyi district. He works for eight hours daily and he also works with a tea factory company, where he earns an additional income. His clients are all kinds of people but the tea factory is the major client for his tea produce.

He is faced with bad weather conditions, especially in the dry season, which reduces his yields; limited capital to boost his business; and also pests and diseases that destroy crops.

Vicent hopes to increase and boost his agricultural business, which will help to improve the welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy organic manure

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria is very thankful to KIVA for the loan granted to her in the amount of PhP 35,000, with which she bought 50 memory cards, 50 usb flash drives and 50 portable speakers to start her electronic store. Her electronic gadgets along with her store are gaining steady income as it is patronized by her customers.

Because of the loan Ma. Victoria was able to pay off her loan on time and still increase her income. Ma. Victoria has been hospitalized and has had an operation due to myoma, but the revenue from her sales helps to pay the hospital bills and for the medicines. She is very thankful that they are now able to depend on themselves with this unplanned event.

Ma. Victoria wanted another loan this time to restock her store for the upcoming holidays. She is requesting a loan amounting to PhP 40,000 to buy 10 sacks of rice, more groceries like noodles, canned goods and soft drinks, and also to add electronic gadgets like memory cards and flash disks for her electronic gadget store.

Ma. Victoria wanted to take the opportunity to buy items when they are more affordable compared to buying items in the holiday season. She can sell at more affordable prices and still gain an income and also gain more customers.

Ma. Victoria wanted to continuously operate her growing business to help provide for her family and the education of her child and to continuously provide employment to her helper. Most of all, she wanted to save for unplanned events.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of rice and more groceries, like noodles, canned goods and soft drinks as well as to add more electronic gadgets.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase ingredients for cooking meals, such as meat, condiments, vegetables, bread-making supplies, and other items.

loans.name: Trabajo Y Esfuerzo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Trabajo y Esfuerzo, es un grupo nuevo que se formó para poder trabajar de forma unida y de esa forma poder ayudar a sus familias. Ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando por mejorar y ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio de su trabajo.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la Sra. Sara, quien se dedica a las confecciones, ella tiene muy buena clientela que siempre se acerca a ella para darle trabajos, y por medio de ello ayuda a su familia. Sara esta esforzándose para poder mejorar poco a poco su emprendimiento y es por eso que pide este préstamo, para poder comprar telas, hilos, gomas, botones, cierres y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus confecciones como lo viene haciendo. Agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben de poder mejorar por medio de las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
The “Trabajo y Esfuerzo” communal bank is a new group that was formed to enable the members to work in unity and, in this way, be able to help their families. They are part of the poverty elimination program, striving to improve and help their loved ones through means of their work.

Sara, who is engaged in dressmaking, is one of the group members. She has very good customers that always come to her and provide her with work, and through this means, she supports her family. She is working very hard to gradually improve her business, and this is why she is requesting this loan to purchase fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, zippers, and other supplies. This will enable her to continue with her dressmaking as she has been doing. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to improve through means of the training.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, zippers, and other supplies.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita has switched from selling snacks to selling longganisa (sausages). Her business is doing well since she doubled her time spent perfecting her own longganisa recipe.

With her husband's help, she has maximized her profits and been able to keep pursuing her goals for the good of her family. That is the reason why she requested another loan from PMPC, to buy more kilos of meat for her longganisa business. Today, Pacita is able to help others with their retail businesses with her longganisa so that they will also earn for their own families.

loans.use: to buy more kilos of meat for her longganisa (sausage) business.

loans.name: Renerio

texts.en:
Renerio, who makes a living to support his family through his retailing business, runs a lumberyard in Calamba and earns a promising income. He has signed up his membership with PMPC to gain access to capitalization. 

Renerio has requested this loan to purchase more lumber to sell. He hopes to sustain his business and send all of his children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more lumber to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a 42-year-old farmer from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. Other than farming she also offers manicure and pedicure services to her neighbors and friends. In addition to this, she sells snacks in the canteen.

She works hard because she has five children to provide for, ages 2-16. Alicia needs additional capital for her business. She is asking for a loan of PHP5,000 to buy more items for her store, like canned sardines, corned beef, beef loaf, shampoo, bath soap, detergent, manicure kits and to build a barn for a hog raising business.

She hopes that through the loan, she can improve her business profit and the life of her family.

loans.use: to  buy canned sardines, corned beef, beef loaf, shampoo, bath soap, detergent, manicure kits and to build a barn.

loans.name: Bernardino

texts.en:
Bernardino is a hardworking father who will do anything for his family. He is 65 years old, married and lives in Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental.

Bernadino operates a hog raising business which is primarily financed by Paglaum MPC. It gives him a quarterly income of approximately PHP 10,000. It sufficiently provides for the needs of his family. Recently, he requested another loan to purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed.

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena , Misamis Occi

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza lives in Trinidad, Bohol with her family. She is 41 years old and a mother of two children, aged six and sixteen. She farms rice and also sells nipa shingles.

Nipa shingles are in high demand in remote places to be used as a roofing material for some household that cannot afford to buy galvanized iron for a roof.

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and to pay other farmers who will help in land cultivation. The extra income that she can get from this will be used for her family’s daily consumption, school allowances for her children and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is driven by a passion for selling. She is single, and at the age of 41, she runs a store that primarily supports her family in Calamba, Mis. Occ. She never gets tired of tending her store everydat.

Jean is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without records of default. Now, she is taking another loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Having enough inventory will mean income opportunities.

In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is in an agriculture business, and she is selling onions, garlic, turmeric, tomato, legumes and vegetables. She is requesting a loan of $800.00 to improve her business.

She will use this loan to buy more vegetables in another place, and after she buys she will bring them to the market to sell. She started selling vegetables in 2014 with her own working capital of $500.00.

Now she is taking this loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy more vegetables such as papaya fruit, papaya flowers, leeks and onions, among other things to sell.

Everyday, her life is selling vegetables in the market because she is earning a good income from it.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables such as papaya fruit, papaya flowers, leeks, onions and other things to sell.

loans.name: Tini

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Tini, who is a 36-year-old married woman with four sons and two daughters. In this picture Tini was holding her young son.

Tini is a housewife and her husband is an employee. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7.000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a water source at their home to improve access to sanitation and clear water for their family.

Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources, but Tini will be able to repay the loan received. She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water.

She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build a water source at their home in order to improve access to sanitation and clear water for the family.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria hails from the town of Matag-ob City. She is single woman. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells goods ranging from eggs, seasonings, edible oil, and assorted canned goods, to biscuits and soft drinks.

Aside from running a store, she also caters food to the locals in her place.

She decided to take a loan to purchase a variety of stock, like beverages, condiments and toiletries. With the availability of these, she could maximize her resources, enabling her to maintain the flow of the merchandise.

Thus, she could start to save and invest in any possible business to become successful.

loans.use: to buy beverages, condiments and toiletries

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 45 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is a widow with 2 school age children.

Virginia has been engaged in managing a car radiator repair shop for ten years already and earns approximately PHP 12,000.00 each month doing this type of business activity.

She was in the grey light at the time her husband died and had pawned their parcel of land for burial expenses. As days passed and she regained her composure and now makes good proceeds from her business, she wants to redeem the pawned parcel of land. That is why she is asking for a loan from Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: to redeem a pawned parcel of land.

loans.name: Calixta

texts.en:
Calixta is a 50-year-old woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with three dependents. Calixta runs two small businesses, operating a Sari-sari store and farming palm oil. Palm oil is also a business in the municipality of Trinidad. It is a raw material and the crude produce is exported abroad.

She is asking for a loan to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, eggs, seasonings, toiletries and condiments.

Calixta hopes that she can manage her store and her palm oil farming well so she can better look after the needs of her children and the daily expenses of her household.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, eggs, seasonings, toiletries and condiments.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
María Victoria con 60 años de edad, de estado civil viuda, vive junto a su madre e hija, en el distrito de Pomahuaca, provincia de Jaén, departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

María Victoria cuenta con una bodega en su propio domicilio donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad,adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de cerveza, cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el rubro.El destino del crédito es para invertir en el negocio para capital de trabajo y poder de esta manera adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.

Socio recurrente, este es su sexto crédito en nuestra entidad financiera edpyme alternativa.
texts.en:
María Victoria is 60 years old. She is a widow, and she lives together with her mother and her daughter in the district of Pomahuaca, province of Jaén, department of Cajamarca, Peru. The inhabitants of this area mainly dedicate themselves to agriculture, ranching and commerce.

María Victoria has a small general store in her home, where she offers basic staple products. She also sells beer. She has more than 10 years of experience in this field. The funds from the loan will be used to invest in her business as working capital. In this way, she will be able to make an acceptable profit and improve her quality of life.

She is an ongoing member; this is her sixth loan through our financial entity Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to invest in working capital for her business.

loans.name: Multietnicas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras de la ciudad de Bilwi, Municipio Puerto Cabezas, se unieron hace 4 años, para acceder a financiamiento mediante crédito para ir incrementando sus pequeños negocios, para mejorar sus ingresos y poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de sus hogares, asegurar la educación de sus hijos, mejorar sus viviendas.

IRMA ISABEL: Es una señora luchadora de 53 años de edad, madre soltera de 5 hijos: 3 adolescentes y 2 mayores de edad que estudian su primaria y secundaria. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a sus hijos vende cosméticos por catálogo de manera ambulante. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar mercadería en Managua y venderla a precios accesibles a su clientela. Ella sueña con establecer una pulpería.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of three enterprising women from the city of Bilwi in the Puerto Cabezas municipality.  They formed their group four years ago in order to access financing through a loan.  This was to go about expanding their small businesses, to improve their incomes, and to be able to take care of the basic needs of their households, ensuring the education of their children and improving their houses.

Irma Isabel: She is a hardworking, 53-year-old woman.  She is a single mother with five children: 3 adolescents and 2 grown-ups who are primary and secondary school students.  With the goal of getting her children ahead, she sells cosmetics via catalog, as a mobile vendor.  She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise in Managua and sell it at an affordable price to her customers.  She dreams of setting up a small grocery store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in Managua

loans.name: Grupo Pasac Sector 2 Group

texts.es:
Domingo (el que se encuentra en medio con la balance en la mano) es un gran hombre, él trabaja mucho para que a su querida familia no le haga falta nada, Domingo como muchas personas buscan siempre la manera se salir adelante con su familia y en el momento en el que necesito de una ayuda su mejor alternativa fue solicitar un préstamo y gracias a ello pudo realizar la ampliación de su cultivo de maxan, pues el compro fertilizantes y plantaciones, a Dios gracias obtuvo una muy buena cosecha y eso le beneficio a él, ahora Domingo nuevamente se le presta la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para la compra y venta de banano pues ahora es su nuevo negocio y su mayor anhelo es poder mejorar su servicio hacia sus clientes.
Ahora su esperanza es contar nuevamente con el crédito para hacer posible su inversión, pero su más grande deseo es construir y ampliar su casa.
texts.en:
Domingo (the one in the middle with the scale in his hand) is a great man.  He works a lot so that his beloved family doesn’t lack for anything.  Like many people, Domingo is always looking for a way to get his family ahead, and at a time when he needed help, his best option was to ask for a loan.  Thanks to the loan, he managed to expand his crop of maxan leaves: he bought fertilizers and fields.  Thanks be to God, he had a very good harvest, which was a benefit to him.  

Now Domingo once again has need to ask for a loan to buy and sell bananas.  This is a new business and his greatest desire is to be able to improve his customer service.

Now, once again, his hope is that he can count on a loan to make his investment possible, but his biggest desire is to build and expand his home.

loans.use: to buy and sell bananas by the quintal [100 lb quantities]

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is a microfinance member of PMPC. She is 61 years old and married, and she has a fishing business in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. This is how she supports her family, with a meager income of 4,000 PHP per month. Recently, Lolita took out a loan to purchase nipa palm thatch for roofing. She wants to improve her family's living conditions and maintain her membership with the cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase nipa palm thatch for roofing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for repairs to his mototaxi, and to buy farmyard animals and pigs

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Amistad está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, para poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una, y conforme a ello poder trabajar para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
La Sra. Norma, una de las integrantes, solicita este préstamo para la compra de más cantidad y variedad de verduras, ya que ella vende distintas variedades, lo cual le facilita vender y generar ingresos de manera eficiente y cómoda para poder ayudar a su familia. Norma es una mujer muy sacrificada y emprendedora que lucha cada día.
Las integrantes agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The group La Amistad (Friendship) is in its second cycle with the women's committee program. They are taking the elimination of poverty survey to learn about the living situation for each one and accordingly, to work towards improving their quality of life.

Norma, one of the members of this group, is requesting this loan to buy a greater quantity and greater variety of vegetables since she sells different varieties. This makes it easier for her to make sales and to generate income efficiently and conveniently so that she can help her family. Norma is a very selfless and enterprising woman who fights hard every day.

The members are grateful for the opportunity they receive to improve their living conditions and those of their loved ones.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: El Saber Group

texts.es: TORIBIA: Es integrante del grupo solidario El Saber, es una señora cordial de 33 años de edad, casada con 3 hijos adolescentes que estudian su primaria y secundaria, pertenece a la etnia miskita del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Su esposo trabaja como conductor de un bus de la ruta Managua Bilwi. Con el propósito de contribuir con los gastos del hogar, educación de sus hijos y tener su propia fuente de ingresos, vende ropa usada en un tramo que tiene en uno de los mercados del municipio. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar en Managua una paca de ropa mixta y venderla a precios accesibles a su clientela de Bilwi. Ella sueña en construir su vivienda de concreto, ya que es de mayor durabilidad y seguridad.
texts.en: Toribia a warm, 33 year old woman, is a member of the “El Saber” communal bank.  She is married with three teenagers who are middle and high school students.  She belongs to the Miskita ethnic group, and lives in Puerto Cabezas.  Her husband works as a bus driver along the Managua-Bilwi route.  With the goals of contributing to the household expenses, educating her children, and having her own source of income, she sells used clothing at a stand she maintains in one of the town markets.  She is requesting a loan to purchase a bale of assorted clothing in Managua, and sell it at affordable prices to her customers in Bilwi.  She dreams of building a home made of concrete as this will provide more durability and safety.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of assorted clothing in Managua,

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely is married and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She joined PMPC in order to access the programs and services of the co-op. She's requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP for additional working capital for her existing business; she will buy a variety of rice to sell in the local community.

Mely hopes to continue her business and to be able to save enough money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy a variety of rice to sell in the local community.

loans.name: Dennis Alberto

texts.es:
Denis Alberto, de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge y su menor hijo, en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, país Perú.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Denis Alberto se dedica a prestar servicio como ayudante de construcción, desde hace varios años.Solicita préstamo para la compra de animales menores y alimentos para estos. El crédito a otorgarle le facilitará obtener ingresos adicionales para su unidad familiar.

Denis Alberto no cuenta con experiencia crediticia, es socio nuevo en nuestra institución financiera.
texts.en: Denis Alberto, in a common-law marriage, lives with his partner and their young son in the district of Cayalti, province of Chiclayo, Peru. The inhabitants of this town work mostly in agriculture, commerce and animal husbandry.  Denis Alberto has worked for many years rendering services as a construction assistant.  He is requesting a loan to buy small animals and food for these. The loan will let him get additional income for his family. Denis Alberto does not have experience with loans; he is a new member of our financial institution.

loans.use: to buy small animals and food for these.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Guapa 2  está en su ciclo  4 del programa de Comité de Mujeres, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas están luchando y esforzándose por salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Luisa, ella tiene una huerta en una zona rural y comercializa por su barrio las hortalizas que tiene por medio de una feria todas las semanas. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que se esfuerza por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
La Sra. Luisa solicita este préstamo para la compra de semillas y fertilizantes para acrecentar su producción de hortalizas y seguir de esa forma con sus cultivos.
texts.en:
The group named Kuña Guapa 2 is in its fourth cycle with the women's committee program. They are all taking the elimination of poverty survey and are all struggling and making an effort to get ahead.

One of the members is Luisa. She has an orchard in a rural area and sells her vegetables in her neighborhood at a market each week. She is a very hardworking woman who makes an effort to improve her living conditions and those of her family.

Luisa is requesting this loan to buy seeds and fertilizers to increase her production of vegetables and this way continue with her cultivation.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
El socio  pertenece al banco comunla HUAYNA CCAPAC,el socio sigue dedicándose al negocio de restaurant y a la venta de cerveza, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el culle va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, aceite, menestras entre otros insumos.
texts.en: This member belongs to the Huayna CCAPAC lending group. He continues to work running his restaurant and selling beer. He has owned his business for a long time, and it has gone very well for him thanks to the effort that he puts into it everyday. He wants to continue working so that he can continue to support his family. He is thankful for this loan and he is committed to making the payments on time. He is seeking a loan to purchase rice, oil, legumes and other ingredients.

loans.use: purchase rice, oil, legumes and other ingredients.

loans.name: Bridaine

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal HUAYNA CCAPAC, la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de repuestos de carros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de faros entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This member belongs to the HUAYNA CCAPAC communal bank. She continues to work in her car parts sales business. She has been in this business for quite some time, and it is going well thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day. She is a responsible person who wants to be able to keep working in order to continue supporting her family.

She requested this loan in order to buy headlights and other items. This member feels grateful for the loan, and she is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy headlights and other items.

loans.name: Remegia

texts.en:
Remegia runs and operates a printing business in Brgy. 7, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 69 years old and married, with adult-age children. She has local customers as well as customers from neighboring towns.

In need of a new printing machine and other materials, she is asking for a loan from Paglaum MPC. The amount shall be spent to purchase a new printing machine, bond paper, and other materials.

loans.use: to purchase a new printing machine, bond paper, and other materials.

loans.name: Choquequirao Inc Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO INC”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rocio Mayveli ella es soltera y tiene 41 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de artesania, la socia vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, la socia vende diferentes tejidos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su familia, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.
Los socios que están pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto después de la reunión porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de artesania, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de agencia de viajes.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: The members belong to the “CHOQUEQUIRAO INC” communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, province of Cusco and department of Cusco. Rocio Mayveli is the member. She is single and 41 years old. The member works in the business of handicrafts. She sells fabrics, sweaters, blankets and looms. She sells diverse fabrics. She works from 8:00 a.m to 7:00 p.m. Rocio Mayveli is an enterprising and hardworking woman, who supports her family through this business. She has already worked 8 years in this business and is doing very well. Her dream is to expand her business of selling fabrics and looms. She is requesting the loan to buy fabrics, sweaters and looms. The members who appear attached to the group photo had their photo taken after the meeting, because they had permission due to work reasons. The other members work in the businesses of clothing sales, handicrafts sales, grocery store and travel agency. Rocio Mayveli is grateful to those who form part of this dream, and through this way she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, sweaters and looms.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Matag-ob, Leyte, Philippines. Like most people with no other means for a stable job, Elizabeth has earned a living through her hog-raising business for many years now.

Elizabeth is asking to take a loan to buy additional piglets and animal feed. A loan will help her improve her hog-raising business as well as her income. Her profit will be used for food and reinvestment in more piglets someday.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is 38 years old with one child who is in college already. Doris personally sells the catch from their fishing boat in nearby municipalities.

Since she became a member of Paglaum MPC, she has been a member in good standing for almost four years. She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to PHP 12,000 for the purchase of new nets.

As much as possible, they have to have all the needed fishing accessories to minimize chances of a low or zero catch. She already has floaters to help guard their fish cages. She also wants to buy the fish catch of her neighbors so she can sell more fish to the nearby fish market, where they will fetch higher prices.

In the future, she dreams of purchasing another fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales.

loans.use: to purchase new nets.

loans.name: Ñ Rare Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad del Estado de México se ha formado un grupo integrado por cinco mujeres indígenas, todas ellas muy trabajadoras y siempre preocupadas por el bienestar de sus hijos. En dicha localidad aún se conserva su lengua materna y la mayor parte de la población mantiene sus conservaciones en mazahua. El nombre del grupo  es Ñ Rare y su significado en español es Río Grande. La cría de ovejas es practicada por todas las integrantes ya que la tarea de cuidar de ellas dentro de su comunidad es relativamente sencilla. 
     Doña Rosa es una mujer de carácter alegre y sumamente trabajadora quien está casada desde hace 16 años con Don Claudio, juntos han formado una familia con 3 hijos de los cuales sólo uno depende de la pareja. Se dedica  a la cría de cerdos desde hace dos años, “inicié esta actividad gracias al préstamo que me hizo VF México” comentó muy emocionada. Igualmente, se encuentra muy contenta pues actualmente adquirió cinco cerdos y una vaca la cual está a punto de tener otra cría; con este nuevo préstamo quiere comprar ovejas para aumentar su producción. Siempre compra los ejemplares desde pequeños para que, algunos meses después, los pueda vender dentro de su misma comunidad. "Mi meta es cuidarlos muy bien para que puedan alcanzar su peso y tamaño ideal" comenta Doña Rosa quien siempre obtiene buenas ganancias por la calidad de sus animales.
   Rosy, como la conocen sus vecinos, ha notado un cambio favorable en su actividad desde que ha hecho uso de los créditos. Incluso cuando los animales llegan a enfermar tiene especial cuidado en su trato pues los lleva con un veterinario de la comunidad. Una de sus metas es aumentar sus ganancias para que su hijo pueda terminar sin complicaciones sus estudios. De igual forma desea adquirir un molino para brindar el servicio en su colonia ya que no existe otro a cientos de kilómetros. 
  Las demás integrantes del grupo Ñ Rare son Eusebia, Celsa y Brígida quienes, como se mencionó al inicio, invertirán en la compra de ovejas y, por su parte, María Inés, en cerdos.
*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del quiosco municipal, Rosa es quien viste el suéter rosa*
texts.en:
A group of five indigenous women has come together in a community in Mexico. All five of the women are hardworking and constantly concerned with the wellbeing of their children. In this region, their native language is still preserved and the majority of the inhabitants speak Mazahua in conversation. The group is called "Ñ Rare," which is Spanish means "Rio Grande". All of the group's members work raising sheep given that in their community it is relatively easy to do so.

Rosa is a happy and hardworking woman who has been married to Claudio for 16 years. Together they have raised a family with three children, of whom only one lives with them. For the past two years, she has worked raising hogs. She says excitedly that she started raising hogs with a loan from VF Mexico. She is very happy because she recently acquired five pigs and a cow that is about to give birth.

With this new loan, she wants to purchase sheep to increase her productivity. She always purchases her sheep when they are very young so that she can later sell them within her own community. "My goal is to take very good care of them so that they can reach an ideal weight and size," says Rosa who always makes excellent profits based on the quality of her animals.

Rosy, as her neighbors call her, has noticed a favorable change in her business since she started using these loans. For instance, when her animals get sick, she takes special care of them and takes them to the local veterinarian. One of her goals is to increase her revenue so that her son can complete his education without any problems. She also hopes to purchase a a mill so that she can provide the service to her community since the closest one is hundreds of kilometers away.

The other members of the "Ñ Rare" group are Eusebio, Celsa and Brígida, who as mentioned previously, will invest this loan in purchasing sheep, and María Inés, who will purchase hogs.

The picture was taken on the steps of the town market. Rosa is dressed in a pink sweater.

loans.use: purchase sheep.

location.town: San Miguel La Labor, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en: Shirly signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Shirly was able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, such as canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items, such as canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

location.town: Tangub-Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mi

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 48 years old, married, and a resident of Migcanaway, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Her husband is a fisherman. The fish he catches are sold to the public market or to their neighbors. They have been in this business for many years already.

Since she wants to be more productive, she has now decided to enter into business herself, purchasing fish in bulk for resale at the market. In 2010 both Felicidad and her husband agreed to join Paglaum MPC to access a loan because they wanted to buy fishing nets. But aside from the financial assistance they received, they say that they also enjoyed the add-on benefits like insurance and savings.

She has now applied for a loan of 14,900 PHP to buy fish for resale. She is wishing that with Paglaum’s help, and with the patience and diligence of her husband, she is looking forward to being a successful vendor someday and to owning a stall in the public market.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Aurea

texts.es:
La socia Aurea pertenece al banco comunal HUAYNA CCAPAC   , la socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de autopartes para carros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de parabrisas, frenos de mano  entre otros.
texts.en:
The member Aurea belongs to the "HUAYNA CCAPAC" communal bank. She continues working in her business selling parts for cars. She is a responsible and persevering person. She feels grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the payments of her installments. She continues to sell her merchandise to her clients who request it, this being the way she gets her family ahead.

Aurea is requesting the loan to buy windshields and hand brakes amongst others.

loans.use: to buy windshields and hand brakes amongst others.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en: Ofelia is a strong-willed woman who will do anything for her family. She is 51 years old, married and lives in Sta. Maria, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She operates a hog raising business, which is primarily financed by Paglaum MPC that gives her a quarterly income of approximately PHP 50,000.00 that sufficiently provides for the needs of her family. Recently, she availed another loan to buy piglets and purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.use: to buy piglets and purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.name: Ronie

texts.en:
Ronie runs a sari-sari (variety) store. He sell basic household commodities such as coffee, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, shampoo, toothpaste, fabric conditioner, and a variety of canned goods.

He is a 33-year-old married man with three children. Aside from operating a sari-sari store, he goes fishing. He sold fresh fish to the locals in his place.

He is asking for a loan to buy assorted stock for the store like beverages, toiletries, and assorted dry goods. With these, he could maintain the inventory and attract potential customers to buy.

Ronie is determined that he could make his business more productive to improve the living condition of his family.

loans.use: to buy beverages, toiletries, and assorted dry goods.

loans.name: Beesan

texts.en:
Beesan is a student who is just beginning to blossum. She only needs financial help to achieve her dreams.

She is a simple girl who lives with her family in Irbid, and she is 21 years old. Beesan is studying at the University and is majoring in communication engineering.

She chose this major for her belief that there are many job opportunities in this field. She wants to graduate and find good work with a good salary, but the financial problems that are faced by her family is an obstacle standing in front of her. So, she decided to apply for an education loan to be able to cover her university fees and achieve her goals.

loans.use: To cover her semester fees

loans.name: Leopoldo

texts.en: Leopoldo is 62 years old, married and lives in Labuyo, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. As a microfinance member of Paglaum MPC, he is given priority in financial services to alleviate his present financial conditions with the necessary financial literacy and other training which he actively participated in. Leopoldo has seen the changes in his general living condition from the moment he signed up for membership with the cooperative. This time, he asked for a loan of PHP 50,000.00 to purchase materials for boat making, such as lumber, plywood, bronze nails, sealant, paint, bamboo, a boat engine and fishing nets.

loans.use: to purchase materials for boat making, such as lumber, plywood, bronze nails, sealant, paint, bamboo, a boat engine and fishing nets.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn is driven by a passion for selling. At the age of 38, married in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, she runs a store that primarily supports their family. Everyday she doesn't tire of tending her store. Arlyn is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without any record of default. Now, she borrowed another loan to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities. In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is married, 48 years of age, and lives in Lala, Lanao del Norte together with her three kids. Zosima operates a sari-sari store to earn a living. She has been in this business for 15 years, and she earns 10,000 PHP every month.

She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase supplementary goods for her general store. She joined GDMPC in 2015. In the future, Zosima will use her income to support her three kids in their studies until they finish college and in their daily needs.

Zosima wishes that her business would be more progressive.

loans.use: To purchase supplementary goods for her general store.

loans.name: Rabeaa

texts.en:
Rabeaa is a widowed women in her fifties with no children. She lives in Deir Ammar, a village near Ramallah city. In order to cover her needs, she started to sell goods through her humble store.

Rabeaa decided to expand so she's requesting a loan from Kiva partner Alibdaa to buy more sugar, rice and oil for her store.

This loan will help her to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, rice and oil for her store.

loans.name: Zain

texts.en:
Zain is a 45-year-old, married woman and a mother of three kids. She lives in Zarqaa, and she is a conservative woman and asked her son Ammar to take her place in the photo.

Zain is applying for the loan to help Ammar finish his Bachelor degree in Tourism and Archaeology; he is 23 years old and in his third year. He is working in a big well-known supermarket with a low salary. Zain is having financial problems. Her husband works for a low income that led her here to apply for an educational loan to help her son Ammar cover the rest of his semester fees and complete his education.

loans.use: to cover her son's education fees.

loans.name: Mayada

texts.en: Mayada is a 43-year-old married woman living with her husband and four children. She is a housewife and her husband owns a small coffee shop in his town and represents the main income provider who fulfills the family's needs. But because of the difficult living conditions, she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l, to pay her children's educational fees. This is the first time that she requested Kiva’s support to pay the school fees and she is very happy because she will be able to register her children for the upcoming school.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, is a 29-year old married woman with two young children. She raises hogs for a living.

Her husband’s occupation is a security guard. For the past two years, Teresita sold hogs to the the local settlers in her community.

She has requested a loan to buy feed and additional piglets. These will help boost and improve her earnings. Thus, she could provide her family with nutritious meals and continue to support their respective studies.

In the future, Teresita is aiming to have a healthy family and a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional piglets

loans.name: Ma. Ruby

texts.en:
There are many local Sari-sari stores in the place of Matag-ob, Leyte where Ma. Ruby is from. She is also one of the owners of the stores in her place. She is a 36-year-old married woman and a mother of two children.

She sells various goods and items to the people in her place. Ma. Ruby has been in the business for more than two years. She is asking to take a loan to buy more stock to sell such as noodles, rice, canned goods, soap, toiletries, soft drinks, other beverages, bread and biscuits.

A loan will help her to increase her stock, which is attractive to customers, thus increasing her income.

loans.use: to buy noodles, rice, canned goods, soap, toiletries, soft drinks, other beverages, bread and biscuits.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a resident in the town of Matag-ob, Leyte. She owns and runs a furniture shop. She caters to orders such as chairs, tables and doors made of wood. She also makes souvenir items for weddings.

She is a 34-year-old married woman and has three children. Her husband is a driver and a carpenter as well. She would like to improve her livelihood by acquiring additional funds to finance her current source of living.

Maricel has requested a loan to buy materials such as wood, and varnish (lacquer), and to pay for the laborers' fee. She will also buy glue, colorful cloth and beads. These could help boost her income and continue to improve her productivity.

loans.use: to buy wood, varnish (lacquer),  glue, colorful cloth and beads and to pay for the laborers' fee.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en: Mary Grace is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Leyte, Philippines. She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than a year now. She also sells barbecue for additional income. Her husband works as a carpenter and the demand is seasonal. Mary Grace is asking to take a loan to buy piglets, feed, meat, seasoning and condiments. In the future, Mary Grace hopes to make her business a success and sustainable. Her priority is the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed, meat, seasonings and condiments.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Fifty-six-year-old Rosita owns farm land. She toils the land and grows rice. She resides in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is 56 years old and married with five children. One of her children is still attending school.

She has requested a loan to buy fertilizers and pigs (for her hog raising startup). She could now improve the yield of her farm and start to raise quality hogs for additional income.

Rosita is grateful for availing the funds and in return, she is doing her best to improve her overall livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and piglets

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a twenty-one-year-old single lady, living in Baqaa. She’s trying to finish her second year in English language studies.

She chose this major because she believes that she will find a good job more easily in this field. The only income they have is the pension of her father. Amal is applying for the loan to pay her semester fees.

She’s hoping to find a job in her degree area and achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to cover her semester fees.

loans.name: Grupo Paculam Las Solteras Group

texts.es:
Petrona es soltera con una linda familia de una hija de tres años, ella y su hija viven en una comunidad del caserío Paculam. 
Petrona (la primera del lado izquierdo de la foto) es una mujer muy trabajadora, amable, responsable y disciplinada, ella trabaja elaborando pan, un pan tradicional de su región, con esta actividad lleva más de cinco años  y lo hace desde la comunidad de su hogar, permitiéndole cuidar mejor de su casa y de su hija. Petrona por sus años de experiencia elaborando pan, mucha gente la busca con frecuencia  por lo que sus productos ya no se dan abasto por esa razón solicita un préstamo  para la compra de productos como; harina, levaduras, azúcar y leña, con este material Petrona espera preparar más pan para su respectiva venta y satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes.
Su gran sueño es construir su casa de block, pero también anhela construir un nuevo horno para preparar su pan en ella.
texts.en:
Petrona is single with a beautiful family with a three year old daughter. She and her daughter live in the village of Paculam.

Petrona (the first on the left in the photo) is a friendly, hard-working, responsible and disciplined woman. She works making bread, a traditional bread of the region. She has been doing this business for more than 5 years and she does it in her community at her house which allows her to better care for her house and her daughter. Petrona with her years of experience making bread has many people who frequently request her products. So her stock runs out.

For this reason she is requesting a loan to buy products like flour, yeast, sugar and wood. With this material Petrona hopes to make more bread to sell and better satisfy the needs of her customers.

Her big dream is to construct a house of cinder blocks, but she also hopes to build a new oven to prepare her bread in it.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, sugar and wood to make bread.

loans.name: Soumaya

texts.en: Soumaya is a 25-year-old Lebanese married woman with three children. Her husband represents the main income provider in the family. He has owned a garage in his town for many years. His income is barely sufficient. That’s why currently, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay for her children's stationary for school with the aim of insuring them a good education.

loans.use: to pay for her children's stationary for school.

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal HUAYNA CCAPAC,la socia Ángela María continua  dedicándose al negocio de venta de regalos como peluches, perfumes entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar adornos ,peluches entre otros.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the communal bank Huayna Ccapac. Angela Maria continues to make living in the business of gift sales such as stuffed animals and perfume amongst other things to her customers who request it. The partner is having success with her business which goes well because of the effort she puts into the business every day. She wants to be able to continue working in order in this way to continue supporting her family

The partner is requesting the loan in order to buy ornaments and stuffed animals amongst other things.

loans.use: to buy ornaments and stuffed animals amongst other things.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana is a resident of Trinidad, Bohol. She is married and a mother of four children. She has two school-aged children ages 20 and 17 years old.

Her husband is a farmer while Marciana helps her husband in running their rice farming business. Aside from this, she is also engaged in Nipa selling. Marciana is in need of a loan to buy fertilizer to enhance the growth of their plants (rice). She also needs an amount for her children's school payment.

In the future, 49-year-old Marciana dreams of the best for her children. She wishes for them to finish their studies and to have better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay a school payment.

loans.name: Jinevery

texts.en: Jinevery is 25 years old and married. She resides in Lala, Lanao Del Norte with her family. She is peddling fresh fish in the local community aside from her retail store to make a living. For over six years, it has sustained and provided for her family and home improvements. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying goods to sell. She is now taking a new loan to buy spare parts for her fishing boat. She is hoping to earn more income and be able to operate her business safely.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.en:
A $ 1500.00 loan is offered to Albertina to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies, such as cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, Coca cola, sagiko, Sprite, beer, Fanta, body lotion, slippers, rice and shampoo.

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2011. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Albertina independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, Coca cola, sagiko, Sprite, beer, Fanta, body lotion, slippers, rice and shampoo.

loans.name: Maritza Maribel

texts.es: Maritza de 44 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y su hijo de 7 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida con una panadería que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha establecido, así también su esposo le apoya y ayuda en la administración del negocio. Negocio el cual lo ha instalado en su vivienda y el cual ha manejado durante varios años, ella elabora y distribuye una gran diversidad de pan dulce, actividad que le permite tener un ingreso económico necesario para los gastos de su hogar y para el estudio de su hijo. En la vivienda de Maritza se empiezan a notar cambios en la infraestructura ya que es una vivienda de muchos años y es por lo que desea cambiar el techo, ya que se encuentra bastante deteriorado dando lugar a filtración de agua en los días de lluvia y así también desea mejorar el piso de la vivienda, pero al no contar con los fondos necesario solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, polines y clavos, también en cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra para cambiar el techo y encementar piso de la vivienda y de esta manera mejorar su estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Maritza is 44 years old. She lives in her own house together with her husband and her 7 year old son. She is an enterprising woman who makes her living with a bakery that she established with much effort and dedication. Her husband supports her and helps with the administration of the business. The business is located in her house and she has operated it for a number of years. She makes and distributes a large variety of sweet breads, a business that allows her to have the economic income needed for the household expenses and her son's education.

Maritza has noticed changes in the infrastructure of her house which is quite old. So she wants to replace the roof as it is badly deteriorated and allows water to filter in on rainy days. She also wants to improve the floor of her house but she does not have the necessary funds. So she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in laminated sheeting, beams and nails, also cement, sand and pay for labor to replace her roof and cement the floor of her house. In this way she will improve her style of living.

loans.use: to invest in laminated sheeting, beams and nails, also cement, sand and pay for labor to replace her roof and cement the floor of her house.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. She is from Leyte, Philippines. Rowena earns a living through retail sales of clothes such as pants, dresses, and others. She also sells frozen food like hot dogs and sausages. Rowena has been in this business for more than three years now. This is the source of her income.

Rowena is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell, such as pants, dresses, undergarments, sausages, and more stock of hot dogs. A loan will help her increase inventory, thus attracting more buyers to choose from her items and increasing her profits.

loans.use: to buy pants, dresses, undergarments, sausages, and more stock of hot dogs.

loans.name: Florabel

texts.en:
Florabel owns and operates an agriculture business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Florabel has been engaged in her business for seven years and earns well from these activities. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for farming supplies.

Her farm is still doing well, and yet, she needs financial assistance to improve it. Recently, she took a new loan to buy fertilizer.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her farm to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her rice farm.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 54 year sold and married. She is from Matag-ob, Leyte. She raises hogs, which she has been doing for many years. This business provides her the income that she needs for her family's expenses. 

Rosalia is requesting a loan from CEVI, which she will use to buy feeds for the pigs she is raising as well as additional piglets to raise. She believes that this loan will help her to improve her business and generate more revenue. Rosalia hopes to see her family experiencing the fullness of life.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Patron San Jeronimo Ii Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PATRON SAN JERONIMO II”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Paula Genoveva ella es casada y tiene 55 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su  negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia vende lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes, la socia es una mujer trabajadora que por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia lleva los productos de belleza a diferentes lugares y amigos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cremas, lápiz labiales y perfumes.
El socio que esta pegado a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de internet, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "PATRON SAN JERONIMO II". This bank is located in the Cusco district, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Paula Genoveva. She is married and is 55 years old with 3 children. Paula works in her business selling beauty products. She sells lipstick, creams, and perfumes. Paula is a hardworking woman who through this work has gotten her children ahead. Paula takes the products to different places and friends. Paula requests the loan to buy creams, lipstick, and perfumes.

The member who is pasted to the group photo had his photo taken after the meeting because he asked permission due to work reasons.

The other members work in internet business, clothing sales, a grocery store, and a restaurant.

Paula thanks those who form part of this dream through these means, and she promises to fulfill her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy creams, lipstick, and perfumes.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 36 years old, married and lives in Pines, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental.

She ventured into farming so that she can support her husband in rearing their family. She is thankful to Paglaum MPC because it gave her the opportunity to venture into business by providing capital.

In need of additional capital for expansion, she asks for a loan to buy additional seeds like palcata, mahogany, durian and others to sell.

loans.use: to buy additional seeds like palcata, mahogany, durian and others to sell.

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en:
Safaa is a 19-year-old single lady living in Zarqaa, Jordan. She is studying to get her bachelor's degree in tourism management, and she is now in her first year.

The income that comes from her father’s work is the only source of income for her family, and because she wants to improve her standard of living, she is working in an accessories shop. The financial situation for her and her father led Safaa to apply for an education loan to help her cover her semester fees.

Safaa's future plan is to get a master's degree in the same field.

loans.use: to pay for her university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase earrings, necklaces, bracelets, and rings

loans.name: Magnolias De Acero Group

texts.es:
Magnolias de Acero  lleva por nombre un grupo integrado por mujeres que día con día se esfuerzan por brindar lo mejor a su familia. El nombre hace referencia a la película en la cual un grupo de   mujeres expresan sus miedos, sus esperanzas; a veces incisivas, otras irónicas o ingenuas pero siempre juntas por el gran valor de la amistad. Las integrantes del grupo son: Reyna quien vende abarrotes; Dominga, Marcelina y Laura, ropa; Janet, material para construcción, cosméticos y ropa; Rocío y Francelia, productos naturistas; Lilia y Guillermina, refresco; Amalia, cosméticos; Rosa, zapatos; Blanca, bisutería; María, abarrotes y comida y María G., lencería y artículos de plata.
   Doña Dominga es una mujer de carácter fuerte y trabajador, no obstante su edad ella se mantiene tan fuerte como un roble. Todos la conocen como Minga ya que desde hace 15 años  inicio con la venta de ropa en las calles de su colonia. Las ganancias obtenidas le han sido de utilidad para solventar los gastos de su hogar y satisfacer sus necesidades, además las ventas la mantienen activa.
   Tras tantos años de experiencia, conoce cada uno de los gustos de sus clientes y siempre cumple sus expectativas. Su producto continua vigente y ahora no sólo vende ropa interior sino que implementó ropa de todo tipo; “he vendido de todo un poco y las mejores ganancias provienen de la ropa interior por eso sigo en pie de lucha” comenta.
   Uno de los retos más difíciles fue poder superar la pérdida de su esposo pues, aunque sus hijos la visitan, jamás volverá a ser lo mismo.  Ahora, invertirá el préstamo en la compra de lencería y sabanas que le han solicitado sus clientas. 
   “Gracias Dios por iluminar los corazones de quienes hacen posible el crédito, bendícelos a donde quiera que vayan” son las palabras que expresaron las integrantes del grupo.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el patio de Janet, Doña Minga viste falda color azul.
texts.en:
Steel Magnolias is the name of this group of women who work hard every day to provide the best for their families.  The name refers to the film which expresses their fears and hopes.  They are sometimes incisive, and other times ironic or ingenuous, but they are always united by the great value of friendship.

The group is made up of Reyna, who sells groceries, Dominga, Marcelina, and Laura, who sell clothing, Janet, who sells construction materials, cosmetics, and clothing, Rocío and Francella, who sell natural products, Lilia and Guillermina, who sell soft drinks, Amalia, who sells cosmetics, Rosa, who sells shoes, Blanca, who sells jewelry, María, who sells groceries and food, and María G., who sells lingerie and silver items.  

Dominga is a hard-working woman of strong character.  Despite her age, she is as strong as an ox.  Everyone knows her as Minga since she has been selling clothing for 15 years in the streets of her community.  The profits that she has gained have been useful for covering her household expenses and satisfying her necessities.  Additionally, her sales activities keep her active.  After so many years of experience, she knows the tastes of each one of her customers and she always lives up to their expectations.  Her products continue to be current, and now has expanded from underwear to selling clothing of all kinds.

"I have sold a little bit of everything and the biggest profits come from underwear, so I continue on with my battle", she says.  One of the most difficult things for her was overcoming the loss of her husband.   Although her children still visit her, she will never be the same.  

Presently, she will use this loan to buy lingerie and bedding that her customers have ordered.  

The group wants to pass on this message:  "Thank God for illuminating the hearts of those who make this loan possible, and bless them wherever they may go."

*The photograph was taken on Janet's patio.  Minga is the one wearing a blue skirt.

loans.use: to buy underwear and bedding.

loans.name: Confeti Group

texts.es:
La comunidad conocida como “la novia del sol” fue fundada en el año de 1868 por  familias veracruzanas quienes edificaron sus casas con palmas, yaguas y caña de una especie conocida como otate. De igual forma, dentro de un arroyo de aguas cristalinas cuyo fondo era de tizate blanco dio pie a que nombraran a la zona como Paso Blanco.
   En una de las colonias de dicha comunidad se formó un grupo llamado Confeti para solicitar préstamos con VF México para invertir en sus actividades. Los integrantes del grupo son: Nancy quien vende zapatos y tamales; María S., Laura y Norma, cosméticos; Jonathan y Nancy, comida; Zuri, artículos de plata y oro; María F., repostería y Norma, ropa.
   Nancy  vive casada con Luis y juntos han procreado a 3 hijos quienes estudian en la escuela de la comunidad. Con el firme propósito de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y motivada por sus padres, inició con la venta de tamales de distintos sabores como los rancheros, de elote, bollitos y unos llamados “cabecitas de perro”. La elaboración consiste en azar las hojas, limpiar el producto, menar la maza, preparar las salsas y cocinar la carne.
   Las ganancias de la comida le permitieron iniciar con la venta de calzado por catálogo pues su carácter amigable hace que los clientes lleguen de manera sencilla. Comenta que, “mi familia es el motor principal, ver felices a mis hijos me llena de satisfacción y me alienta para seguir adelante”.
   En esta ocasión el préstamo lo invertiría en la compra de calzado escolar ya que los alumnos de la comunidad requieren  este producto. Agrega que, “deseo iniciar con la venta de artículos de plata y oro para completar sus ganancias”.
   El grupo Confeti agradece por los préstamos otorgados a sus miembros y por brindarles una nueva oportunidad de crecimiento en cada una de sus actividades.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el corredor de la casa de Nancy, ella viste blusa blanca y short azul.
texts.en:
The community known as the "bride of the sun" was founded in 1868 by families from Veracruz who made their houses out of palm, thatch and cane of a type known as "otate". In the same way, a streambed of crystalline waters whose bottom was of white chalk gave the impetus to name the zone "White Pass".

In one of the neighborhoods of this community, a group was formed called Confeti in order to solicit loans from VF Mexico to invest in their activities. The members of the group are Nancy, who sells shoes and tamales; Maria S., Laura and Norma, cosmetics; Jonathan and Nancy, food; Zuri, articles of silver and gold; Maria F., cakes; and Norma, clothing.

Nancy lives married to Luis and together they have spawned three children who study in the community school. With the firm goal of supporting her husband with the household expenses and motivated by her parents, she started with the sale of tamales of different flavors such as ranch-style, corn, cookie, and those called "little dog's heads". The production consists of preparing the leaves, cleaning the product, kneading the dough, making the sauces, and cooking the meat.

The earnings from the food allowed her to start the catalog sales of shoes. Well, her friendly character made it so that the customers showed up easily. She says, "My family is my primary motivator, to see my children happy fills me with satisfaction and encourages me to forge ahead."

On this occasion, she will invest the loan in the purchase of shoes for school since the students of the community need this product. "I would like to start with the sale of articles of silver and gold to increase my earnings," she adds.

The Confeti Group is grateful for the loans offered to its members and for affording them a new opportunity to grow in each one of their activities.

*The photograph was taken on the porch of Nancy's house. She is dressed in a white blouse and blue shorts.

loans.use: to buy shoes for school.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is married and a 54-year-old mother of two children. She owns and operates an agriculture business, growing corn to sell. Cecilia has been engaged in this business for many years and she earns well from these activities.  The farm is still doing well, but she needs financial assistance to improve it. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro to buy fertilizer to restore farm nutrients. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her farm to buy a vehicle for their transportation as part of the improvement of her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her corn farm.

loans.name: Saholinirina

texts.fr:
48 ans, mariée, Saholinirina est mère de quatre enfants dont deux déjà mariés et les deux autres encore à sa charge et scolarisés dans une école privée. Son mari est chauffeur de camion dont le travail n'est pas très stable.
Elle exerce depuis 1990 une activité de vente de sous-vêtements, produits de beauté et des produits de soins chevelure comme masque, shampoo, sérum etc.. Elle commençait avec la vente des sous-vêtements seulement en 1990, et elle  n'a cessé de développer petit à petit son affaire au fil du temps et ajouter d'autres articles au fur et à mesure. C'est une femme courageuse et débrouillarde. La construction de sa propre maison est en cours en ce moment .
texts.en:
Saholinirina, aged 48, is the married mother of four children, of whom two are already married, and the other two are still in her care in a private school. Her husband is a truck driver whose job is not very steady.

Saholinirina has been operating a business since 1990 selling undergarments, beauty products, and haircare products, such as masks, shampoos, serums, etc. She began by selling just undergarments in 1990. And she continuously developed her business a little at a time over a while and added other articles as needed. She is a courageous, problem-solving woman. Building a house of her own is currently in the works.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products, undergarments, and haircare products

loans.name: Dúo Alotenango 2 Group

texts.es: El Duo Alotenango 2 esta integrado por doña María Lina quien vive con su esposo y con el apoyo de sus hijos, este es su 2do crédito kiva  y desde hace 7 años posee una tienda y venta de regalos también se dedica a la venta de helados, ropa de paca ella solicita su crédito ya  que necesita invertir en la compra de utensilios de cocina como ollas, platos, vasos, tasas ya que en el mes de septiembre y octubre es donde ella vende mas regalos para toda ocasión  y  desea comprar por mayor y tener mercadería  para satisfacer a sus clientes su meta es poder establecer y obtener un capital para seguir invirtiendo y pueda sostener su negocio en un futuro.
texts.en:
"El Duo Alotenango 2" is made up of María Lina, who lives with her husband, and with the support of their two children. This is her second Kiva loan. She has had a store for 7 years, earning a living selling gifts, as well as ice cream and bundles of clothing. She is requesting her loan because she needs to invest in buying cooking utensils such as pots, plates, glasses, and cups, since the months of September and October is when she sells more gifts for all occasions and she wants to buy wholesale and have merchandise to satisfy her clients.
Her goal is to be able to set up and obtain capital in order to continue investing and to be able to sustain her business in the future.
