loans.use: to buy cooking utensils to sell.

loans.name: Omar Geovanni

texts.es: Omar de 20 años vive al lado de sus padres y su hermana en busca de ayudar a sus padres, Omar presta sus servicios en una empresa en las cercanías a su vivienda, labor que le permite aportar a la economía del hogar, pues su sueño es poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, ya que habita en una vivienda humilde y en la cual no cuentan con el servicio de energía eléctrica, además que de un momento a otro su terreno puede desbordarse y arrasar con su casa, la cual no cuenta con nada que la proteja de este tipo de desastres. En busca de mejorar esta situación solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillos, cemento, arena, hierro, cables eléctricos y caja térmica para instalar energía eléctrica y construir un muro de contención para brindar protección a su vivienda y su familia.
texts.en: Omar, 20 years old, lives with his parents and his sister. Seeking to help his parents, Omar provides his services in a business nearby his home, a job that allows him to support the economy of the home. His dream is to be able to improve his family's quality of life, since they live in a humble home that does not have electricity. On top of that, from one moment to the next, the land can flood and destroy his house. This leaves no other option than to protect it from these types of disasters. In an effort to improve this situation, he requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in: bricks, cement, sand, iron, electrical wire, and a breaker box to install electricity and build a retaining wall to provide protection for his home and his family.

loans.use: to invest in: bricks, cement, sand, iron, electrical wire, and a breaker box to install electricity and build a retaining wall.

loans.name: Flor Del Lirio

texts.es:
Flor, es una mujer soltera, su lucha constante es trabajar para sacar adelante a sus dos hijos menores de edad, ella no tiene ayuda del extranjero, su fuente de ingresos es administrar una tortillería, negocio que nació por la necesidad de cumplir con sus responsabilidades y lo ha mejorado con ayuda de créditos, trabaja todos los días de 5:00 am. a 11:00 am.
El financiamiento le permitirá comprar materia prima como: maíz, bolsas, leña y cal para preparar la venta de tortillas, adquirirá los productos al mayoreo para ahorra costos y tener un negocio más competitivo para que sus clientes estén satisfechos y ella pueda tener estabilidad económica, espera mantenerse trabajando y resarcir su deuda.
Sus sueños son sacar adelante a sus hijos, darles educación para que sean profesionales y tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Flor is a single mother.  Her constant struggle is working to move her two small children ahead.  She doesn't receive help from abroad.  Her source of income is managing a tortilla shop, a business that came about because of her necessity to fulfill her responsibilities.  She has improved the shop with the help of loans.  She works every day from 5:00 a.m. to 11:00 a.m.

The loan will allow her to buy primary ingredients such as corn, bags, firewood, and lime to make tortillas to sell.  She will buy the supplies wholesale in order to cut costs and have a more competitive business so that her customers are satisfied and she will be able to have economic stability.  She hopes to keep working and pay back her debt.  

Her dreams are to get her children ahead and give them an education so that they can be professionals and have a better future.

loans.use: to buy corn, bags, firewood, and lime to prepare tortillas for sale.  She will buy the products wholesale to cut costs and have a more competitive business.

loans.name: Lova Faniry

texts.fr:
Lova Faniry est une femme travailleuse infatigable de 30 ans. Elle est mariée et son mari travail entant qu'agent de sécurité dans une société privée. Le couple a trois enfants de 1, 10 et 14 ans. Les deux premiers sont scolarisés actuellement. 
Elle vend des volailles il y a maintenant 14 ans pour gagner sa vie, c'est une activité déjà pratiqué par sa mère lors de son enfance. Ce qui explique sa maîtrise de l'activité. Donc, elle a beaucoup de clients fixes comme des petits restaurateurs et gargotiers. 
Actuellement, elle vie avec son mari et ses enfants dans une maison patrimonial pas encore partagée entre les héritiers donc elle envisage d'en construire la tienne dès que ses épargnes la permettent.
texts.en:
Lova Faniry is tireless, hardworking woman. She is 30 years old and married. Her husband works as a security guard in a private company. The couple have three children, aged 1, 10, and 14 years old. The first two are currently in school.

Lova Faniry has been selling poultry for fourteen year to earn a living. This is a business her mother operated when she was young, thus explaining her mastery of it. As a result, she has a lot of fixed customers, such as small-scale restauranteurs and stall keepers.

Currently, she lives with her husband and children in her father’s house not yet divided up among those to inherit it. So she envisions building her own as soon as her savings allow.

loans.use: to purchase 22 chicks, 50 hens, 30 ducks, 15 geese, and 10 turkeys

loans.name: Nohemi Del Carmen

texts.es:
Nohemi está solicitando un nuevo crédito para comprar más fardos de ropa usada, para surtir el inventario de su negocio y cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes.
El préstamo anterior le ha servido para mantener su fuente de ingresos funcionando, cada vez adquiere más experiencia en la administración de sus ingresos, por ello su estilo de vida familiar ha mejorado y mantiene buena calificación crediticia.
texts.en:
Nohemi is requesting a new loan to buy more bundles of used clothing to supply her business and fulfill the needs of her customers.  

The previous loan allowed her to maintain a functional source of income.  Each time, she gains more experience managing her income, so her family life has improved and she has maintained a good credit rating.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of used clothing to supply her business and fulfill the needs of her customers.

loans.name: Suzana

texts.en:
Suzana has been involved in business activities since 2011, starting with her own working capital of $ 500.00. Now she is applying for a loan of $ 600.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has come to the age of 27. Her husband is a businessman, so he is very supportive of her having a business.

She has a kiosk in front of her house and she taking a loan from Tuba Rai Meti. She will buy additional supplies with the loan, including cooking oils, noodles, sardines, cigarettes, aqua, sugar, candles, gambling cards, lighters and other things to sell. She is very hopeful that this loan can be a help to her business.

loans.use: to buy cooking oils, noodles, sardines, cigarettes,  aqua, sugar, candles, gambling cards, lighters and other things to sell.

loans.name: Romina

texts.es:
La Sra. Romina vive en la ciudad de Villarrica, es dueña de una casa comercial, donde se dedica la venta de productos de consumo masivo, carnes de todo tipo, artículos de bazar y ropería.  
Se inició en el rubro hace más de 5  años, con una pequeña despensa, actualmente su negocio cuenta con clientela formada, y ha ido creciendo poco a poco gracias a su sacrificio.
Esta agradecida por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar, pide este préstamo para poder comprar artículos como Fideos, Azúcar, Arroz, Aceites, Panificados, artículos de bazar y otros.
texts.en:
Sra. Romina lives in the city of Villarrica. She is the owner of a retail warehouse where she sells consumer products in bulk, meats of all types, bazaar goods, and clothing.

Romina started in this trade more than five years ago with a small food pantry. Her business currently has an established clientele and it is growing little by little as a result of her sacrifice. She is grateful for the opportunity she has received so that she can improve.

Romina is requesting this loan in order to buy products such as noodles, sugar, rice, oil, baked goods, bazaar goods, and other items.

loans.use: to buy noodles, sugar, rice, oil, baked goods, bazaar goods, and other products.

loans.name: Martilde

texts.en:
Martilde is 61 years old and widowed with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan
through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

Martilde has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: David Enrique

texts.es: David de 38 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos de 2 y 6 años de edad, y tiene 14 años que reside en vivienda propia. David es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable que en busca de llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar labora en una empresa prestando sus servicios en diferentes actividades como las cuales son: limpieza de la empresa, control de la correspondencia y documentación, mantener ordenado, entre otras actividades relacionadas a estas, labor que realiza desde hace varios años en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Para lo cual necesita construir un servicio sanitario lavable, además crear un cuarto habitación para sus hijos debido a que ha crecido la familia y su vivienda es pequeña. Y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillos, arena, cemento, inodoro y tuberías para la construir un servicio sanitario y un cuarto dormitorio y de esta manera abonar a la sanidad de su hogar.
texts.en:
David is 38 years old. He lives with his wife and their two children, ages 2 and 6, in a home he has owned for 14 years. David is a very hard working and responsible person. In order to provide for the daily needs of his home he works in a business doing different things such as cleaning the business, overseeing the correspondence and documentation, and maintaining things in an orderly fashion, among other related activities. He has worked at this for several years, in search of a better quality of life for him and his family.

In that regard, he needs to construct a bathroom and a bedroom for his children since his family has grown and his home is small. For that reason he seeks a loan from FUSAI to invest in bricks, sand, cement, a toilet and pipes to construct a bathroom and a bedroom, and to improve the sanitation of his home in this manner.

loans.use: to invest in bricks, sand, cement, a toilet and pipes to construct a bathroom and a bedroom.

loans.name: Lito

texts.en:
Lito is 26 years old. He is from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. He has been a rice farmer for six years. His children are still young, aged 2 and 4. Thinking of his children, Lito can't help but dream of more for them. He is asking for a loan to expand his business. He would like to start raising hogs and open a sari-sari (general) store.

His loan will be used to buy merchandise like canned sardines, corned beef, toiletries, seasoning, condiments, piglets, and billiard poles. He hopes to make a better profit from his farm and store so he can buy items for his house. The additional income will go to savings and nutritious meals for his family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like canned sardines, corned beef, toiletries, seasoning, condiments, piglets, and billiard poles.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is 64 years old and has nine children. She is married and has one child still in school. Anita is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been in this business for the past 20 years and has borrowed 7 previous times from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Anita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Possible Chandika Health Clinic

texts.en:
Chandika Health Clinic provides high-quality, low-cost healthcare for 1,747 people in rural Nepal. Their facility includes a pharmacy and outpatient facility, and they are currently constructing a birthing center. Chandika patient Bhajan is expecting her second child in December and hopes to give birth at the clinic. “When I had my first child, I started making clothes for her from the minute I found out, but I have been busy with my little girl while pregnant with this one,” she admits. Bhajan learned about the hospital's Antenatal Care Program from her community health work, also named Bhajan, pictured above in the bright blue sari. 

Chandika is part of a healthcare network run by Possible, an award-winning nonprofit dedicated to providing high quality, low cost health care. Your Kiva loan will fund a 2.2 kW solar energy system at Chandika, transforming the level of care they can provide. 

*The solar energy system will be installed by SunFarmer (www.sunfarmer.org), a social enterprise the provides reliable and affordable electricity for hospitals, schools, and farms in Nepal. The loan will pay for the upfront costs of the solar energy and battery storage system. SunFarmer provides long-term monitoring and system maintenance, and provides an electricity guarantee to the Chandika community.

loans.use: To pay for solar equipment that will provide reliable electricity at their health clinic.

loans.name: Umoja Agri Riz Group

texts.fr: Le crédit précédent a aidé Mazeze à financer ses travaux de labour, sarclage, achat de produits phytosanitaires et à subvenir à ses charges familiales (frais scolaires, alimentation, épargne, soins médicaux et autres). Durant le crédit, ils se sont butés au problème de canalisation d'eau d'irrigation, l'envahissement des oiseaux et l'absence d'une coopérative agricole dans le milieu pouvant faciliter la commercialisation. Par rapport à la contrainte liée aux oiseaux, il s'est donné la peine de surveiller son champ. Ayant élargi son étendue culturale, un appui financier serait le bienvenu afin de lui permettre d'effectuer ses diverses tâches.
texts.en: The previous loan helped Mazeze to finance his plowing, wedding, and purchase of plant health products, and to meet his family expenses (school fees, food, savings, medical care, and others). During the loan, they had difficulty because of problems with the pipes for water irrigation, the invasion of birds, and the absence of an agriculture cooperative in the area to facilitate marketing. With respect to the constraint tied to the birds, he was given the burden of surveying his field. Having expanded his extensive cultivation, financial support would be welcome in order to allow him to carry out his diverse tasks.

loans.use: to transplant, weed, harvest, and purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Celidet

texts.es: Celidet es una confeccionista con una amplia experiencia que inició su propia microempresa familiar en el año 2008, motivada por ser una empresaria independiente, además de contar con el apoyo de su madre y hermanas quienes conocen del oficio, emprendió esta idea de negocio en un local ubicado en el municipio de Cartagena. Ella confecciona todo tipo de prenda de vestir; camisas, pantalones, vestidos, uniformes de colegios, entre otros, también ofrece un amplio surtido de insumos de modistería como hilos, elásticos, cuellos, ruedos entre otros. Con el pasar del tiempo sus clientes se han mantenido, pues brinda un excelente servicio y calidad en sus prendas, las cuales son elaboradas sobre medida y con diseños novedosos. Todos los días de la semana a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. trabaja en su taller para cumplir con su producción y en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá insumos de modistería para cumplir con un contrato.  Su meta a futuro es conseguir más contratos con fundaciones del sector y ampliar la capacidad operativa del negocio.
texts.en:
Celidet is a seamstress with ample experience that started her own small family business in 2008. She is motivated by being an independent business-woman. She also has the support of her mother and sisters that know the trade. She started this business idea in a venue located in the city of Cartagena. She sews all types of clothing; shirts, pants, dresses, school uniforms, and other items. She also offers a large selection of sewing supplies such as string, elastic, pins and other things.

As time passes by her customers have remained because she provides excellent service and quality in her clothes, which are made to measurement and have original designs. Every day of the week, from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m., she works in her workshop to complete her production. Currently, she is requesting a loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to invest in sewing supplies in order to fulfill a contract. Her future goal is to obtain more orders with institutions in the area and increase the operating capacity of the business.

loans.use: to invest in sewing supplies in order to fulfill a contract.

loans.name: Ma. Herna

texts.en: Ma. Herna is 56 years old, married with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Herna has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. She has requested a 27,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business. In the future, Ma. Herna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es una mujer con grandes aspiraciones en la vida, ella tiene 41 años de edad, es casada con  una linda familia de cuatro hijos de las edades entre 8 y 17 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad del caserío Pahaj. Julia es muy trabajadora pues desde hace cinco años se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica de su región, gracias a este negocio a su familia ha sacado adelante. Con muchos sacrificios todos los días se esmera para que su negocio prospere, y con tanta amabilidad a sus clientes atiende dándoles el mejor servicio y ofreciéndoles  productos de buena calidad, con sus pocas ganancias a estado ahorrando por muchas años para la compra de media cuerda de terreno para la construcción de su vivienda, pero esto no ha sido posible porque  no tiene las posibilidades suficientes y ahora que tiene la oportunidad de comprar su terreno a decidió solicitar un préstamo para la compra de su terreno que le hace mucha falta a su familia.
Julia como mujer tiene las esperanzas puestas para que su préstamo sea financiado para hacer posible su compra. Su gran sueño es construir su casa en el terreno que comprara.
texts.en:
Julia is a woman who has great aspirations in life. She is 41-years old, married and has a lovely family with four children between the ages of eight and seventeen. This humble family lives in a community of the Pahaj village.
Julia works very hard. For the last five years, she has made her living buying and selling clothing typical of the region. Thanks to her business, her family has been able to get ahead. Julia takes great pains to be sure that her business prospers, which means a lot of sacrifices every day. She is very friendly with her customers, provides them with the best service and sells high quality products.
Julia has been saving her small earnings for many years to be able to purchase half a plot of land on which to build their home. But, she hasn't been able to because she doesn't have sufficient means. Now that she has the opportunity to make her purchase, she has decided to request a loan to purchase the land that her family so needs.
Julia, as a woman, has placed her hopes in her loan request being financed so that she can make her purchase. Her greatest hope is to build their home on the land that she will purchase.

loans.use: to purchase half a plot of land to build on.

loans.name: Brian

texts.en:
Brian is a 27-year-old youth and a permanent resident of Kitende, Kajjansi Wakiso.

He operates a retail shop as his major source of livelihood; however, he has other small incomes aside. The income from the shop is used for supporting his personal developments and growing his business career.

He has approached UGAFODE Microfinance for a loan to buy stocks of sugar, rice, and corn flour to sell in his shop and boost his other agricultural innovations like a a piggery.

The appraisal and assessment done on him prove him worth being a potential payer who will see growth in business sales and profit.

He has applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 which he says will pay very well to qualify for a bigger loan the next cycle.

loans.use: To boost his retail trade

loans.name: Ilucion Group

texts.es:
Las famosas "caritas sonrientes" son esculturas prehispánicas que han trascendido el tiempo y ahora adornan la entrada principal de una ciudad veracruzana. De igual forma uno de los símbolos más representativos de la ciudad es el monumento a la bandera, el monumento a la madre y la locomotora llamada “Prieta Linda” que representa la importancia del ferrocarril en la ciudad.
   En un extremo de la ciudad se integró un grupo llamado Ilucion y aunque la palabra se escriba distinto, para las integrantes el significado es el mismo, es decir, el deseo que tienen para que sus actividades prosperen. Ellos son:  Loida y Benita quienes venden abarrotes; Claudia, fruta; Reyna, Santa y Cristian, ropa; María, queso; Gabriel, artículos domesticos y Filiberto quien maneja un taxi.
      Santa es una persona muy responsable, tiene dos hijos por quienes, junto con su pareja, trabaja arduamente para ofrecerles lo mejor. También es una persona muy sonriente y siempre pone de muy buen humor a las personas que la rodean; esta actitud le ha permitido dedicarse al comercio de manera efectiva. Aprendió de sus padres dicha actividad y se siente orgullosa de seguir sus pasos ya que aunque el trabajo resultaba extenuante siempre tenían tiempo para sus hijos. Tras padecer una pequeña parálisis finalmente decidió dedicarse completamente a la venta de ropa en un local ubicado en el centro de su comunidad. Cuenta con un extenso surtido y precios accesibles para todos sus clientes a quienes también les ofrece facilidades de pago; la mercancía la exhibe en maniquíes o ganchos. “Obtener mis propios ingresos y ver sonreír a mis hijos es lo que más me motiva a continuar, superando cada uno de los obstáculos que me pone el destino” comenta entusiasmada.
      Las ganancias obtenidas le son de utilidad para  pagar el salario de la empleada que trabaja en el local, los pagos de la renta, los gastos de la casa y la reinversión de mercancía. Con el préstamo comprara pantalones, shorts, playeras y blusas ya que son las prendas de mayor demanda. 
*La fotografía fue tomada frente a la tienda de Doña Loida, Santa viste blusa blanca y está delante de su hermano Cristian.
texts.en:
The famous "smiling faces" are prehispanic sculptures that have transcended time and now adorn the main entrance to a city in Veracruz. In the same way, one of the most representative symbols of the city is the monument to the flag, the monument to the mother, and the train engine called "Prieta Linda" that represents the importance of the railroad in the city.

In one extreme of the city, a group called ilucion was formed, and although the word is spelled differently, for the members the meaning is the same, that is to say, the desire they have for their businesses to prosper. They are: Loida and Benita who sell groceries; Claudia, fruit; Reyna, Santa and Cristian, clothing; María, cheese; Gabriel, domestic items and Filiberto who drives a taxi.

Santa is a very responsible person. She has two children for whom, with her partner, she works arduously to offer them the best. She is also a very smiling person and always puts those around her in a good mood. This attitude has allowed her to work in the commercial sector effectively. She learned the business from her parents and she feels proud to follow in their steps, since even though the work was grueling, they always had time for their children.

After suffering a small paralysis, she finally decided to dedicate herself completely to selling clothing in a shop located in the center of her community. She has an extensive supply and affordable prices for all of her customers, whom she also offers credit terms. She shows her merchandise on mannequins or on hangers. "To obtain my own income and see my children smile is what motivates me the most to continue, beating each obstacle that destiny puts in front of me," she says enthusiastically.

The obtained earnings are useful for her to pay the salary of the worker who works in the shop, rent payments, expenses of the home, and reinvestment in merchandise. With the loan she will buy pants, shorts, t-shirts, and blouses since they are the items with the most demand.

*The photo was taken in front of Doña Loida's store. Santa is dressed in a white blouse and is in front of her brother, Cristian.

loans.use: to buy: pants, shorts, t-shirts, and blouses.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana de 45 años de edad, vive al lado de su compañero de vida y de sus hijos, un niño de 13 años y una hija mayor de edad. Ana con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación trabaja ejerciendo la labor de servicios domésticos además de eso, ella tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de dulces y lociones en su vivienda. Actividad que ha venido realizando desde hace varios años y lo cual le permite sacar adelante a su hijo quien a estas alturas se encuentra estudiando. Ana  habita desde hace 10 años en su humilde vivienda, la cual es bastante pequeña y por el número de integrantes de su familia se necesita modificar. Es por ello que Ana solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, ladrillo, arena y mano de obra para construir paredes divisorias en su hogar, ya que no cuentan con divisiones que permitan tener su propio espacio a cada uno de los integrantes de la familia.
texts.en:
Ana is 45-years old. She lives with her husband and her children, a 13-year old son and a daughter who is grown.
Ana puts a lot of effort and dedication into her work as a housekeeper. In addition, she has a small busienss selling sweets and lotions from her home. She has run her business for several years, and it allows her to get her son, who at this stage goes to school, ahead.
For the last ten years, Ana has lived in her humble home. It is quite small, and with the number of people in her family, they need to make some changes. That is why Ana is requesting a loan from FUSAI. She wants to invest in cement, brick and sand and to pay for labor to build partition walls in her home. Currently, they don't have partitions that allow each member of their family to have their own space.

loans.use: to invest in cement, brick and sand and to pay for labor to build partition walls in her home.

loans.name: Airen

texts.en:
Airen is 32 years old and married with two children still in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods, and personal care products.

Airen has been in this business for 10 years. In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, milk, drinks, coffee, spices, bread, snack foods, and personal care products.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr:
A39 ans, Jacqueline est mère de cinq enfants de 9 à 20 ans. Ces derniers sont tous scolarisés dont les deux premiers sont  déjà des universitaires (filière économie) et n'habitent pas avec la famille à cause de l'éloignement de l'université mais encore à sa charge. Donc elle loue deux maisons pour l'habitation.
Jacqueline exerce avec son mari une activité de vente des matières en plastiques (sacs, et ustensiles de cuisines) depuis l'an 2000. Auparavant, elle vendait en mobile des lunettes. 
Elle désire développer et étendre l'activité afin que celle-ci  génère davantage de bénéfices et que son revenu s'améliore. Elle voudrait pouvoir continuer à financer jusqu'à terme les études de ses enfants surtout les deux premiers universitaires en ce moment. Son souhait est la réussite de ses enfants dans leurs études et qu'ils auraient un bon et brillant avenir .
texts.en:
39 years old, Jacqueline is the mother of five children, from 9 to 20 years old. They are all in school, with the first two already at university (studying economics). They do not live with the family because of the distance of the university, but are still her responsibility. Thus, she rents two houses for living in.

Jacqueline has been running, with her husband, a business of selling plastic goods (bags, kitchen utensils) since the year 2000. Back in the day, she was traveling selling glasses. She wants to develop and expand her business so that it generates more profit and so that her income improves. She would like to be able to continue to finance the studies of her children through the end of the term, especially the first two university students at this time. Her wish is for the success of her children in their studies and that they will have a good and bright future.

loans.use: to buy some bowls, buckets, plastic utensils, and plastic bags.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen is a 49-year-old lady; she is living with her husband and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband is a turner by profession; he manufactures and renews spare parts of vehicles. He has been operating a lathe machine for many years and can easily renew or manufacture the spare parts of various vehicles.

His lathe machine has become out of order due to continuously working and needs maintenance. He has spent his all savings buying raw material for manufacturing spare parts and does not have cash in hand to fix the lathe machine.

Therefore, Parveen has requested a loan for her husband so that he can fix the lathe machine. She is relaxed now because she hopes that her husband can easily operate his lathe machine again. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to fix the lathe machine for her husband's turner work.

loans.name: Shukufa

texts.en:
Shukufa lives in Mahmudlu village in the Fuzuli region with her family, but they have been IDP (internally displaced persons) from their native land of Fuzuli city for 22 years. Her husband actively helps Shukufa with her business.

Shukufa has been in the agriculture business for many years. Now she has also a poultry business. She wants to improve this new business.

Previously she took a loan from Kiva and with this loan she successfully developed her business of raising cattle. Today she needs her third loan in the amount of 2300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). She wants to buy ducks, chickens, turkeys, etc. Shukufa is thankful for help from Kiva and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy ducks, chickens, and turkeys

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora and her family live in the town of San Miguel in Bohol, Philippines. She is a mother of four children ages 20, 16, 15, and 13 years old.

She raised her children by doing the sari-sari store business. She has been doing this for three years. In the future, she is aiming to be successful in her business to have a sustainable life and to give good education to her children.

She is asking for a loan to buy canned goods, noodles, spices, toiletries, laundry soap, sugar, coffee, powdered chocolate drink, and juice. She will also buy fertilizer from the money she is requesting. Perhaps, they will own a rice farm.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, spices, toiletries, laundry soap, sugar, coffee, powdered chocolate drink, juice, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge con 75 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, sin hijos a su cargo ,vive junto a su cónyuge en casa propia, en el distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú, en una zona rural. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría al comercio, ganadería y agricultura.

Jorge se dedica a brindar servicio de jornaleria; hace mas de 8 años, negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, solicita préstamo para invertir en activo fijo; mantenimiento de su terreno compra de una mochila para fumigar; esto le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus herramientas y darle una mejor apariencia, para poder brindar mejores servicios.

Socio recurrente y calificado como triple A en Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Jorge is 75-years old. He lives with his wife and has no dependent children. Jorge and his wife live in their own home in a rural area of Oyotún District, which is in Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Department, Perú. The residents of the area make their livings primarily by running shops and in livestock and agriculture.

Jorge has made his living for more than eight years offering services as a day laborer. He runs his business out of his home. He is requesting the loan to invest in fixed assets; he will maintain his land and purchase a backpack sprayer. This will help him to have his tools in better condition and give him a better appearance so he can offer better services.

This is a returning member with a AAA rating with Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to invest in fixed assets; he will maintain his land and purchase a backpack sprayer.

loans.name: Rosadelima

texts.en:
Rosadelima is married with two children. She helps her husband to run a fishing business for a living. She has been doing this for 26 years and earns well for the family.

She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro-credit to buy new fishing nets. She wants to improve their business and be able to provide a better living for the entire family in the near future.

loans.use: To buy new fishing net for fishing activity.

loans.name: Victoria's Group

texts.en:
Victoria is 52 years old and a mother of 7. She lives with her husband in Okwu-Ubaha Village. She is a very hard working woman and ever ready to support her husband who cares for a very large extended family. She is a very happy woman although she has never had an opportunity for any formal education.

Her dream is to have at least 3 college graduates from her family. This is a very big challenge for such a low income individual in Nigeria, but she is ever determined to achieve this.

Her first loan was funded by Kiva lenders and she is ever grateful to them because that loan brought a great change in her life. A portion of this loan will help her purchase palm fruits during this session and increase production so as to meet up with her goals.

Victoria and her group members appreciate all those who support this loan

loans.use: to process and store palm oil products.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
54-year-old Ramon is a father to three children aged 15, 17 and 20. He is from Trinidad, Bohol. He has been farming and harvesting palm oil tree, farming rice, and raising hogs. These businesses require a lot of hard work, even staying on the field under the heat of the sun.

He is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy feed and fertilizer. This will take care of the amount needed for his business to prosper.

In the future, Ramon plans to make his businesses bigger and more sustainable, and to hopefully venture into other businesses that promise better revenue.

loans.use: to buy feed and fertilizer

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a very hard working woman. She raises and sells poultry to the locals in her area. She is married with four young children. Her husband earns a living by means of farming. She toils the land and grows rice. In addition to that, she also engages in making “landang”, a local term for palm flour, rolled into balls, like sago (edible starch which is obtained from a palm and is a staple food in parts of the tropics). This is also used as a topping on sweet snacks like ginataan (a rice porridge that is sweetened with coconut milk, sugar and sago).

She has requested a loan to acquire capital to purchase buli trees (palm), a source of this starch to make "landang". She could also produce more supplies and enables her income to increase.

In the future, Maricel is hoping that she will become successful in her business to improve the family’s living condition and also finance the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy buli palms (a kind of tree).

loans.name: Placideta

texts.en:
For the past four years, Placideta, has engaged in raising hogs for a livelihood.  She raises and sells pigs to the local settlers in her area.  She is forty-four years old, married, and has seven children. Three of them are still attending school. Her income mainly goes for food and school expenses. 
She has requested a loan to buy feed and pig supplement. These will help enhance her income and slowly settle her obligations.
She is thankful for the funds and is determined to manage it successfully to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy feed and pig supplement

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is managing her food vending business in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur. She had mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. The business has been doing well supporting the needs of the family. She has local customers and also accepts catering for added income. Recently, she borrowed to purchase more meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and would be more happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more meat and spices for her food vending business

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia used the previous loan to buy cocoa to sell. She is a 30-year-old married woman with four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda.

She is a farmer who grows mainly cocoa but also buys from other farmers because the demand for the crop is high and she can hardly meet it with her farm yields.

Her inspiration to work hard is driven by her desire to educate her children and also have a better life with all the necessary basics.

Her main challenge is limited capital to buy more cocoa during the season for increased profits and the unpredictable weather patterns while her dream is to become one of the leading cocoa suppliers. Scovia is in need of a loan to buy more cocoa to sell..

loans.use: to  buy cocoa for resale

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana de 43 años de edad, vive al lado de su compañero de vida y de su madre de 76 años de edad. Ana con mucho esfuerzo día con día lucha por que a su familia no les falte nada y de esta manera su madre pueda vivir bien. Ella se dedica a vender productos de belleza por catálogo y así también posee una tienda en la que vende productos básicos del hogar. Obteniendo de esta manera los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos de su familia, así también su compañero de vida ayuda con la economía del hogar. En busca de mejorar su calidad de vida, Ana decide solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, lámina, clavos, hierro, y pago de mano de obra para reparar pared  y el techo de la vivienda. Ya que tanto la pared como el techo se encuentran deterioradas y necesitan mantenimiento.
texts.en:
Ana, 43 years old, lives alongside her life partner and 76 year old mother. With a lot of day to day effort, Ana strives for her family to not lack in anything and in this way, her mother can live well. She works selling beauty products from a catalog and also has a shop in which she sells basic household products. In this way she obtains the necessary income to cover her family’s costs. Her life partner also helps with the household finances.

Seeking a better quality of life, Ana decided to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in: cement, sand, sheet metal, nails, iron and to pay labor costs to repair a wall and the roof of her home. Both the wall and the roof have deteriorated and need maintenance.

loans.use: to invest in: cement, sand, sheet metal, nails, iron and to pay labor costs for repairing a wall and the roof of her home.

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en: Eleanor, a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of six children from Matag-ob, Leyte, has been engaged in the hog raising business for more than five years. This is the source of her income. Eleanor is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed for them. Hog raising is a good business as long as the time is maximized for the pigs. A loan will help her improve her hog raising business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Lumturi

texts.en:
Lumturi is in the photograph with her husband, Shefki, and they are both in their early 40s.

With the previous loan, they invested in olive groves, and now they want to add a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda resides in the town of Matag-ob, Leyte. She operates a Sari-sari (general) store. She sells commodities like noodles, milk, sugar, seasonings, soap, shampoo and assorted canned goods. She is married with two children. 
Her sari-sari store is situated near her home and serves customers, mostly neighbors and nearby residents. 
Rosalinda would like to improve her main source of living to become more productive and improve the family’s living condition.
She would like to buy supplies for the store like rice, beverages, condiments, toiletries, diapers, coffee and soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy ice, beverages, condiments, toiletries, diapers, coffee and soft drinks.

loans.name: Sulltane

texts.en: Sulltane wants to buy a dairy cow with this loan, since the previous cow they had died unexpectedly. Her family owns agricultural land where they plant beans, corn, and wheat and they sell the products to wholesale buyers. In the photograph, Sulltane is holding a dish with fresh made bread. Rural households in her region make their own bread since almost everyone grows wheat and then grinds it in primitive mills.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow; the one she had died unexpectedly.

loans.name: Valeriu

texts.en:
Valeriu is 43 years old and works as a military guard at the railway station in Ungheni. He is married and has two sons (ages 17 and 1) and a daughter. His wife, Tatiana, used to work as custodian at a national museum in the Ungheni region, but now she raises his baby.

His elder son Vasile studies at a musical college. Over the past 3 years, Vasile has sung at different ceremonies, including weddings, birthdays, and other celebrations. With the money he earns, he can afford to pay for his studies and help his family. He owns a musical flap, but it is old and does not sound good. This loan will help Valeriu to buy a new musical flap for his son Vasile and to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a musical instrument

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is 40 years old and the mother of 7 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a tea stall, selling tea and dhoodh pati, etc. Her husband is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the house hold.
Robina's husband needs to purchase tea items for his business to increase the his business, improve his sales growth and earn more profit. Due to an unfavorable financial position her husband is not able to purchase these items for his business.
Therefore, Robina has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This will help her husband purchase the above items for his business. 
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his tea stall business

loans.name: Dúo Marta De San Pedro Group

texts.es: Dúo Marta de San Pedro La señora Marta, tiene dos hijas, es casada, y es la encargada de este grupo,  se dedica a la venta de ropa típica como cortes, güipiles, fajas, blusas desde hace 15 años y es ambulante. Su sueño es ser una gran vendedora, tener un lugar específico para atender a sus clientes sin tener que caminar tanto.  Tiene varios pedidos de cortes típicos y güipiles, pero el dinero que tiene no le es suficiente, por eso ella pide otro préstamo para comprar lo que le hace falta y así no quedarles mal a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Marta de San Pedro Duo. 

Marta has two daughters, is married, and is in charge of this group. She has been selling traditional clothing such as traditional skirts, woven embroidered blouses, belts, and blouses, for the past 15 years. She is a street vendor.

Her dream is to be a great saleswoman, and to have a location to serve her customers without having to walk as much. She has several orders for traditional skirts and blouses, but the money that she has is not sufficient. For that reason, she is requesting another loan to buy what she is lacking, and therefore keep her customers satisfied.

loans.use: to purchase new traditional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Ii Group

texts.es:
Wilgermine continúa con su negocio de venta de artículos de medicina natural se encuentra a la derecha, viste blusa azul). El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de medicinas naturales para la salud. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque pudo vender toda su mercadería. la mercadería de su negocio rota constantemente y es por eso que ella necesita reabastecer su negocio con medicinas naturales, “vendo al contado y también a crédito eso hace que la mercadería se venda mejor…” comenta. la ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas a crédito y al contado la desventaja es que por su forma de venta se queda sin dinero para comprar nueva mercadería. Su sueño es ser la elegida por sus clientes, ella desea comprar productos médicos naturales por mayor para reabastecer su negocio. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Wilgermine solicita un préstamo para la compra de medicinas naturales para la salud por mayor para reabastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Wilgermine still has her business selling natural medicinal products. (In the above photo, she is on the right and wearing a blue blouse). The last loan she received was invested in the purchase of natural medicinal and health products. She punctually repaid her loan because she was able to sell all of her merchandise.

The merchandise in her business rotates constantly, which is why Wilgermine needs to restock her business with natural medicinal products. She says, "I make cash sales and also sell on credit, which helps the merchandise sell better." The advantage is that she can sell on credit and for cash; the disadvantage is that these sales options leave her without enough money to purchase new merchandise.

Wilgermine's hope is to be her customer's business of choice. She wants to purchase wholesale natural medicinal products to restock her business.

This is Wilgermine's second lending cycle with the institution in the two years that she has been running her business. Wilgermine is requesting a loan so she can purchase wholesale natural medicinal health products to restock her business.

loans.use: to purchase natural medicinal products to re-stock her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Matag-ob, Leyte. Elizabeth has earned a living through her hog-raising business. This business has existed for a decade now. Elizabeth is asking to take a loan to buy additional piglets and animal feed. It takes loving care for the animals for them to grow healthy. Elizabeth even gave them a bath so they will grow healthy. In the future she is hoping for an increased income.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
30 year old Zenaida owns rice paddies.  She has grown rice for almost 10 years. 
She is married with no dependents yet. She is striving hard to improve her income. She lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol.
She would like to avail of a loan to purchase farm supplies like fertilizer, and supply capital for hog raising and additional capital for the sari-sari (variety) store.  Slowly, it will help improve the display of goods at her store and attract potential buyers to shop. 
Zenaida is determined that she can handle her sources of income successfully.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, supply capital for hog raising and additional capital for the sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en: Lucila is a dried fish vendor in the Calamba Public Market. She's been in this business for 15 years and is making good profits from it. Lucila recalls that it was through Paglaum MPC that she started her business. She obtained her initial capital from the cooperative and rolled it up until she managed to acquire stalls in their local market. Lucila wants to expand her business by restocking inventories of dried fish. She asks for a loan to buy bulk inventory of dried fish for resale.

loans.use: to buy bulk inventory of dried fish for resale

loans.name: Dotela

texts.en:
Dotela is 52 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for her family.
Dotela runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods, and personal care products. She has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Dotela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods, and personal care products.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is a 28-year-old woman who lives in the town of Trinidad in Bohol, Philippines. She is married and has two children ages two and three months old. Her husband is a delivery boy and is also engaged in rice farming business.

Merly is doing the same thing, and she is also engaged in the rice farming business. She and her husband work together in running this business to earn a living and to provide for the needs of their family.

She is in need of a loan to buy fertilizer and piglets as well. She is thinking of another opportunity to help them enhance their livelihood. In the future, she dreams to be successful in their business to have a better means of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and piglets

loans.name: Ryan

texts.en:
Ryan is 30 years old from Matag-ob, Leyte. He is married with a 6-year-old son.

Since 2012, he has been operating a sari-sari (variety) store and a billiard pool table business. He is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy canned goods and beverages, chips, noodles, and toiletries for his store. This will stock his shelves and attract more customers.

It is his hope that with a better capital, he can earn more from his business and will be able to provide better for his family. His income will be for his son's education.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and beverages, chips, noodles, and toiletries for his store.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en: Esmeralda has signed up her membership with PMPC and availed the needed capital to start up a sari-sari (general) store. She is thankful for the capital it extends to a small time lender like her. Esmeralda is able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she availed of a loan to restock the store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, soy sauce, etc. In the future she hopes to make a descent home for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, soy sauce, etc.

location.town: Sindangan-Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.en:
With his previous loan, Victoriano was able to buy fresh chicken meat for the operation of his food business and also pay for the maintenance of his food cart. He thought it would take some time before the his current loan application would be approved, but CCT completed the process quickly. He wants to send his gratitude to all the people who helped him with his previous loan.

This business is his bread and butter so Victoriano operates the food stall rain or shine. He’s able to pay for his children’s education and other expenses. As a father, his dream is to help his children finish college and find a good jobs someday.

He aims to improve the food cart further because he faces challenges during rainy seasons. Victoriano is saving money for his family and for future investments. He decided to apply for another loan worth 10,000 PHP. He will use the amount as capital to buy additional fresh chicken meat. Some will be used for the improvement of his food cart so that customers will be comfortable buying from his stall when it's raining.

Victoriano has been consistently attending CCT fellowship group meetings, which consist of 15 to 30 members who hear the word of God and testimonies from partners. This has helped him to become spiritually strong.

loans.use: to buy more chicken meat and other ingredients for his fried chicken stall.

loans.name: Harman

texts.en:
Harman is a resident of Kireka, Kira town council Wakiso district. He is a regular saver with Ugafode Micro finance. 
His main business is selling glass and mirrors along with cutting and repair. He buys in bulk and sells in small units and from the assessment the business is very promising. 
It's through this business that he earns a living and takes care of his old mum. His character and general behavior is good according to the community.
His major hindrance in the business is the small extent of his capital, which does not meet the business needs.
He has therefore applied for a loan of ugx1,500,000 to boost his business by buying more glasse that he will cut and then sell. He appreciates the generous support from the Kiva funders.

loans.use: To boost his glass business

loans.name: Maria Paula

texts.es: María, tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y reside en el Municipio de Tocoa Colon, junto a dos de sus hijos. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio en busca de generar ingresos, y vendía accesorios de acero para damas. Hace año y medio se dedica a vender productos de la canasta básica en la pulpería que tiene en su casa. Vende arroz, azúcar, harina, churros, refrescos, frijoles, carnes, jugos, embutidos y otros. Ha obtenido cuatro créditos anteriores con la institución y actualmente está solicitando otro por la cantidad de 20,000 Lempiras para comprar arroz, azúcar, harina, productos de aseo, carnes, refrescos, jugos y frijoles, con el fin de incrementar el inventario y obtener mejores ganancias. Tiene como meta hacer crecer el negocio para ayudar a sus hijos con la educación.
texts.en:
Maria is 39 years old, a single mother, has 3 children and lives in the city of Tocoa Colon with two of her children. She has always worked in sales in search of generating income and used to sell ladies accessories.

For the past year and a half she has been selling basic food products in the small grocery store she has in her home. She sells rice, sugar, flour, churros, refreshments, beans, meat, juices, sausages and more. She has previously received four loans with the institution and is currently requesting another in the amount of 20,000 Lempiras to buy rice, sugar, flour, cleaning products, meat, refreshments, juices and beans. Her aim is to increase her inventory and to obtain better earnings. Her goal is to grow her business in order to help with her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, flour, cleaning products, meat, refreshments, juices and beans with the goal of increasing her inventory and obtaining better earnings.

loans.name: Rosa Aminta

texts.es:
Rosa, es casada, vive con su esposo e hijos, tiene como negocio el destazo de reses y cerdos, además practica la siembra de granos básicos, lo hace desde aproximadamente 8 años, es muy reconocida entre sus clientes como una persona luchadora y honesta.
El préstamo le será de utilidad para comprar reses y cerdos para el destazo, asimismo invertirá en insumos agrícolas para darle un mejor trato a los cultivos de granos básicos, espera atender a nuevos clientes y tener mejores ingresos para disminuir las necesidades de su hogar.
Su visión es continuar trabajando y guiar a sus hijos por el mejor camino.
texts.en:
Rosa is married and lives with her husband and children. She works as a butcher of cattle and pigs. In addition, she grows basic grains. She has been doing this for approximately 8 years.

She is well-known among her customers for being a determined and honest person.

The loan will be used to buy cattle and pigs for butchering, as well as to invest in agricultural supplies to best grow her basic grain crops.

She hopes to serve new customers and have more income to reduce her household needs. Her vision is to continue working and to guide her children along the best path.

loans.use: to buy cattle and pigs for butchering, as well as to invest in agricultural supplies to best grow her basic grain crops

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat, aged 44, is a responsible mother and living happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son owns a scrap shop and deals with scrap goods such as iron, aluminum, plastic bottles, waste paper, etc.

He has been purchasing scrap goods from the common people and sells it to the recycling factories. Nowadays, due to household expenses, he does not have the amount to buy scrap goods and does not have a stock of scrap to sell for getting money.

Therefore, Nusrat has requested a loan for her son so that he can buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents.

She is very impressed with this honorable support and shows her wish to take more loans after the payment of this loan. She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy recyclable material for her son's recycling business.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham is a 52 year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children. Her husband represents the main income source in the family in order to enhance their way of living.

Today, she hopes to help her children with their education. For that reason, she wants to borrow a loan from Kiva's partner vitas s.a.l to pay the first installment of the study fees. She will be more than happy to see them graduating and achieving their master’s degree. In the future, she plans to take new Kiva loans and keep on covering their study fees.

loans.use: to pay the first installment of the study fees

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita lives in Matag-ob, Leyte. She is married with two children, ages 4 and 9.

For the last five years, Pacita has been engaged in a hog-raising business. It is quite a challenge for someone like her to be in this business because she has to wait for four months before she can sell her pigs. She take of care of her pigs, even giving them a bath to keep healthy and clean.

She will use the loan to buy feed and piglets to increase her hogs. Her income will be for her children's school fees and family consumption. She hope that someday, she can have other means for a better and abundant living for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 54 years old, married, and has four children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Gloria requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs. Gloria has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Marizza

texts.en: Marizza is a hardworking female entrepreneur with four children. She has a fish vending in the Philippines and has requested a 26,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell to customers. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Marizza dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell to customers.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 43 years old, married, and has six children who are presently in school. Gloria is in the pig fattening agricultural business in the Philippines. Gloria requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig. Gloria has been in this business for the past 5 years, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
SAFIA is a 42-year-old mother of six children living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a turner (machinist) by profession. He works over a lathe and manufactures and renews the spare parts of vehicles such as motorbikes, motor cars and auto rickshaws. He renews the interior parts of engines of vehicles, renewing the turbine and radiators. He has been in this business for many years and up to now his business has been very steady. Due to continuously using the lathe, some important parts are wearing out and urgently need to be replaced. Without the replacement parts the lathe won't operate.
Her husband is a poor person and does not have sufficient cash on hand to buy the required spare parts to fix the lathe or buy cutting tools. 
Therefore, SAFIA has requested a loan for her husband so that he can fix the lathe and buy cutting tools. 
SAFIA hopes that this loan will prove productive for the business as well as for her family.

loans.use: to fix the lathe and to buy cutting tools so her husband can operate his business and generate income for the family.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
A $1500.00 loan is offered to Lucia to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2012 with her own working capital.

She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store like a refrigerator, milk, water, Coca Cola, Agiko, Sprite, Fanta, beer, body lotion, and cigarettes. She is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family. She is happy with this loan because it will improve her living condition in the future.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, milk, water, Coca Cola, Agiko, Sprite, Fanta, beer, body lotion, and cigarettes.

loans.name: Darine

texts.en:
Darine is a 36-year-old single woman living with her parents. She works in vending housewares and toys and she cooperates with her siblings to collect enough money to be able to pay the heavy life expenses.

Today, Darine is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l, to pay her sister's registration fees at school. She said that she is very happy and willing to always benefit from Kiva’s loans to continue her sister's education suitably.

loans.use: to pay her sister's registration fees at school.

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.en:
Victoria  is a 46-year-old married woman with two children ages 11 and 16 years old.  Ten years ago she started working in the field to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children.  She grows and sells rice. 
Victoria is a hard worker who is trying desperately to develop her business, but she is also a sacrificing mother who deprives herself for the sake of her children.  She has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner CEVI, to purchase fertilizer and laborers' fees.

Victoria hopes to expand her business more in the future through investing in other business ventures to increase her income and improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for laborers for her farm

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina is a 55-year-old married mother of two dependents from Matag-ob, Leyte. She is a farmer who grows ginger and rice, and is also engaged in a hog raising business.

Magdalina has been in the farming business for more many years now. She is requesting a loan to buy additional piglets and animal feed, and fertilizer for the farm. Through this, she will be able to grow healthy pigs as well as improve her harvest from her farm.

In the future, Magdalina hopes to make her business a success by doing more improvements and expansion. She also wants to save money for school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy piglets and animal feed, and fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Riza

texts.en: Riza has always had the enthusiasm for farming. She has cultivated their rice land in Calamba, Misamis Occidental and has made good earnings doing this type of work. Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparation. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Riza knows that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season. In the future Riza hopes to buy additional parcels of land to cultivate.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
RANI is a 42-year-old woman, living with her children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services by using a three wheeled auto rickshaw. With the help of savings, he has purchased a used auto rickshaw. Its engine quality is good, but the body is totally damaged. He does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy a new body and seat covers. He wants to start driving it and is looking for a lump sum amount to buy a rickshaw body. Therefore, RANI has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy a new rickshaw body and can drive the rickshaw smoothly. RANI hopes that now her husband will be able to generate more income. 

RANI is very happy after taking this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy rickshaw seat covers and body for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is a single parent who is a farmer in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is also an active member of Paglaum MPC since 2002. She enjoys the perks of membership including insurance. Now she needs a loan to purchase bags of fertilizer and bottles of pesticides for her farm. She believes that having enough inventory of farm inputs will give her a greater harvest.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer and bottles of pesticides

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en: Nestor is 59 years old and married with 3 children of adult age. He lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. For the past two years Nestor has been a farmer. He earns 15,500 PHP each month and is a new member of PMPC. Nestor is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future he hopes to expand and improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a responsible mother of 7 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a Suzuki for 8 years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to repair his Suzuki because the current condition of his Suzuki is not good and it requires more maintenance on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to repair his Suzuki. Therefore Rukhsana has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.
With the help of this loan Rukhsana's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Rukhsana also plans to make savings with the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.
Rukhsana is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: help her husband to repair his taxi

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina works hard to support her family. Angelina is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to re-sell.

Angelina has been in this business for 29 years now.

In the future Angelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to re-sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 38 years old and married with three children.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Josephine is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Josephine has been in this business for 10 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Hedeliza

texts.en:
Hedeliza is 37 years old, single with one child.

Hedeliza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, spices, bread, snack foods and other personal care products.

Hedeliza has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from a bakery shop.

Hedeliza aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, spices, bread, and snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a resident of Kyebando, Wakiso district and has been a client of Ugafode Microfinance for more than 4 years. He is a married man with one wife and four children.
Mr. Jackson sells purified honey as his major source of income to meet all his household needs. He buys raw honey from upcountry cheaply and he purifies it, stores it in buckets then packs it into containers of different sizes and prices. From assessment and the evidence he earns a profit of more than a half of the cost of the raw honey. 
However his major hindrance is the long time and energy spent during purification and packaging. He has therefore applied for a loan of 4,000,000 (Four Million Ugandan Shillings) to buy a simple honey purifier which will help him to quicken the process. This will help him to process more honey in a shorter time and also allow him time to engage in extra income generating activities. He is hard working and resilient. He dreams of constructing a house for his family because he rents a one room house now despite his large family.

loans.use: To buy a  machine for purifying honey

loans.name: Lenny

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Lenny works hard to support her family.

She has a basket manufacturing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from motorcycle transportation and a general store. Lenny is borrowing PHP 29000 through NWTF to buy raw materials for her basket making.

Lenny has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her basket making

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 51 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Gina has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more clothing to sell.

Gina has been in this business for nine years. In the future Gina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene is 43 years old and married with three children, with one child still in school, Marlene works very hard to provide for them.

Marlene runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, spices, bread, snack foods and other personal care products.

Marlene has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Marlene would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, spices, bread, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Jennylyn

texts.en:
Jennylyn is 23 years old and married with one child. For the past three years she has been raising pigs along with running a sari-sari, or small general store, to earn a living in the Philippines.

Jennylyn has applied for a 13,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy feed, vaccines, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs. She works hard with the goal in mind of building her business so as to secure the future financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: José Rodolfo

texts.es:
José, de 71 años de edad,  estudió solamente primer grado, no continuó sus estudios debido a que sus padres eran de escasos recursos, está casado, es padre de 3 hijos, todos son independientes. En casa solo vive él y su esposa.

José, se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, estas actividades las realiza desde los 14 años de edad y estos trabajos los aprendió gracias a sus padres; el terreno donde tiene su cultivo está a una distancia de medio kilómetro y se levanta muy temprano para ordeñar las vaquitas que tiene y luego se traslada hacia el cultivo.

José, utilizará el crédito para comprar 2 novillos de repasto, los cuales cuidará y luego los venderá para obtener ganancias.

El sueño de José, es seguir trabajando para llegar a tener una casa digna y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is 71, and only went as far as first grade in school. He did not continue his studies due to the fact that his parents had scarce resources. He is married and the father of three children; all are independent. Only he and his wife live in the home.


José farms and raises livestock. He has been doing these activities since he was 14 years old, and learned these occupations thanks to his parents. The land that he cultivates is half a kilometer away. He gets up very early to milk his cows, and then goes to the area where his crops are.

José will use the loan to buy 2 calves for grazing, which he will look after, then sell to earn profits.

José's dream is to keep working, so that he can succeed in having a decent house and in improving their quality of life.

loans.use: To buy 2 calves for grazing.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a permanent resident of Katabi, Entebbe and a married man with four children. He is operating a bar in Entebbe town where he earns money along with his other incomes to meet the costs of his living and that of his family. He is also doing a piggery business at his home, which supports the bar business. Christopher requires more capital for his bar so as to boost his sales. He will buy a stock of beer to resell. This will increase his profit and income.
He is of a good character and we are committed to serving him since our assessment has proved positive in all ways. 
Christopher has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 (Three Million Shillings Ugandan Shillings).

loans.use: To buy beer to resell

loans.name: Choeurn

texts.en:
Choeurn is a 23-year-old, single goldsmith. He resides in the Takeo Province of Cambodia. He has earned his main income from the business since 2014, earning approximately $5 per day.

Now, he would like to buy cows for his brother to fatten and breed for calves to sell, but he does not have sufficient finances. That’s why he has decided to request a loan. This loan will help Choeurn have enough finances to buy cows for his brother to improve his family’s income when the cow is able to produce calves.

In the future, he is going to run a small business at home.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
The most common source of income in the town of Trinidad, Bohol, is farming. Rodrigo, a 64-year-old man, raised his family through this business.

He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and to buy piglets because he is also engaged in a hog-raising business to enhance their livelihood. Thus, Rodrigo dreams to improve his earnings to have a sustainable life in the future together with his family.

Additionally, he was blessed with two children who are already grown up.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and piglets.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 55 years old. She is married and has six children. Her business is selling bread, cakes, flour, water, vegetables and paraffin. She has been in the business for eight years. 

She earns a monthly income of five thousand Kenya shillings. This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase bread, cakes, flour, water, vegetables and paraffin for resale.  


Mary will use the profits from expanded business to invest in the paraffin business. Her hopes and dreams are to attain a high standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase bread, cakes, flour, water, vegetables and paraffin for resale.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 68 years old and married with five children.

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Nenita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Nenita has been in this business for six years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza works hard to support her family. Esperanza is married and has a butcher meat business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 50000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of meat to sell.

Esperanza has been in this business for 8 years now.

In the future, Esperanza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of meat to sell

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Pelagia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store.  Pelagia is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell to her local market.

Pelagia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell to her local market

loans.name: Fionah

texts.en:
Fionah is a first-year student at Kepler. Because of her impressive academic record, she was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. Fionah chose Kepler because it shared her values and offered her the best opportunity to pursue her dream of becoming a business leader.
