Fionah plans to major in communications with a concentration in business, and will graduate Kepler with a B.A. from an accredited U.S. university. She thinks her greatest contribution to Kepler will be her sense of humor and ability to work in teams.

After graduating, she hopes to use her skills to give back to her family and her community.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a U.S. college degree.

loans.name: Hamzeh

texts.en:
Hamzeh is 21 years old and lives in Irbid, which is located in North side. He is studying in university, majoring in economics. He tried to find a part time job, to pay for his daily expenses but he could not.
The pension that comes from his father`s death is not enough to cover the household expense and the educational expenses, and that lead Hamzeh to apply for an educational loan to help him pay for his university fees and achieve his dreams.

Hamzeh needs you support to complete his education and find a good job with good salary to help his mother in the household expenses.

loans.use: To pay for his university fees

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is 45 years old and married with seven children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Jasmin has a fishing business in the Philippines. Jasmin requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Jasmin has been in this business for four years. In the future, Jasmin would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Lavdije

texts.en:
Lavdije is 48 years old and the married mother of two children, the youngest of whom is 16 years old. Her husband is disabled and receives a disability pension of $83 per month. For the past 20 years, Lavdije has worked in agriculture and livestock to earn a living for her family. On the land that her family owns, she plants beans, corn, wheat, and fodder for the animals. Selling these products and also raw milk from two cows, she earns the following annually: beans, $1200; corn, $362; wheat, $483; and raw milk, $2609.

The region where Lavdije and her family live is known for the prolific soil and high production of beans and chickpeas, red onions, red peppers, corn, apples, wheat, and other grains. The terrain and climate works well for livestock such as cows and sheep.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's visit to a health specialist.

loans.name: Jeanine

texts.fr:
33 ans, Jeanine est mariée et les deux époux exercent ensemble l'activité de mûrisserie de banane, source de revenu de la famille. Cette activité est commencé en 2003 et n'a cessé de développer depuis ce temps. C'était avec les fruits de cette exploitation que le couple a pu entretenir; nourrir, vêtir et surtout éduquer ses trois enfants. 
L'objectif de la famille est d'acquérir un véhicule de service avec lequel, son mari pourra effectuer toutes les  grandes livraisons des bananes mures.
texts.en:
Jeanine is thirty-three years old and married. She and her husband work together ripening and selling bananas to earn a living. They began their business in 2003 and it has grown continually since then. Thanks to this business, the couple have managed to feed, clothe and educate their three children.

The family's aim is now to buy a vehicle to use to deliver the ripened bananas.

loans.use: to buy 1.5 tonnes of green bananas.

loans.name: Jacques

texts.fr:
Jacques, un brave père de famille de 48 ans, exerce une activité d'élevage de poulet de chair depuis 2009. Avant cette année, il exploitait seulement des cultures vivrières et maraîchères. La raison était pour améliorer le revenu de la famille en plus ce sont deux activités complémentaires. 
Jacques est marié et sa femme tient une petite gargote. Le couple a trois enfants,  encore à charge et scolarisés. 
L'objectif de jacques est de pouvoir offrir à ses enfants une meilleur éducation et une meilleure condition de vie. C'est pourquoi , il ne cesse pas de chercher des nouvelles idées et activités à effectuer tant qu'il en a la possibilité. Sa priorité est le bien-être de ses enfants ainsi que sa femme. C'est un père consciencieux et responsable.
texts.en:
Jacques is forty-eight years old and a strong family man. He has been raising chickens since 2009. Before this time, he only grew vegetables but he wanted to increase the family's revenue and the two activities are complementary.

Jacques' wife runs a small restaurant and the couple has three children who are all still in school. They would like to offer their children a better standard of living and a higher standard of education. This is why Jacques is always looking for new ways to make money.

As a conscientious, responsible man, Jacques wants only to take care of his wife and family.

loans.use: to buy chicks, poultry feed, vitamins and charcoal.

loans.name: Tuungane B Group

texts.fr: Pascaline est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédits «Tuungane B», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 32 ans, mère de 4 enfants dont 3 scolarisés et 1 est gosse. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires à son domicile dans une avenue de la ville depuis 2 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en huiles, tomates et arachides. Elle commença son business avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Pascaline is a trader and a member of the loan group 'Tuungane B' which is a client of the field partner, Hekima. She is thirty-two years old, married and mother to four children. Three of her children attend school and one is still too young.

Pascaline has been selling basic foodstuffs from her home on an avenue of the town for two years. She began her business with funds provided by her husband and this loan will buy oil, tomatoes and peanuts.

In the future, Pascaline would like to buy a plot of land, feed and educate her children. She is grateful to Hekima for the support they offer to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy oil, tomatoes and peanuts.

loans.name: Prondelita

texts.en:
Prondelita is 65 years old and married with nine children.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs. She has been in this business for 5 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Prondelita is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 34 years old and married, and she is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Julia has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase new fishing nets, and materials for the repair of her fishing boat. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Julia would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase new fishing nets, and materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: .abishyizehamwe B. Group

texts.en:
Abishyizehamwe is a group led by Rose, who is 42 years old. The group name means “Altogether” in English.

Rose is married and has seven children aged between 4 and 21 years. She owns a shop and has been doing this business for the past six years. The group members sell different items, and they have same idea for changing their lives.

With this loan, Rose would like to buy more sugar, salt, and rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, and rice to sell.

loans.name: Primisilia

texts.en:
Primisilia has always been enthusiastic about farming. She has been cultivating their rice land in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, and has had good earnings doing this type of work.

Recently she applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Primisilia knows that she has to get things right in order to increase yield and earn more income from this cropping season.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase animal feeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Khakim

texts.ru: Хаким житель города Исфара. Жители города Исфара честные, талантливые, гостиприимние и трудолюбивые. Они постоянно двигаюися, ищут что-то новое. Хаким один из тех жителей города. Он занимается мастером по ремонту домов. Уже 8 лет Хаким продвигает свою работу. Его отец раньше занимался этой сфере дейятельности, и Хаким решил идти по стопам отца. Кто-то же должен сохранить деятельность родителей. Хаким семейный мужчина. У него жена и один маленький ребенок. Хаким живет вместе матерью, братикам, женой и ребенкой. В семье только работает Хаким, и он кормить свою семью. Его братик болеет и ему нужно сделать лечению и купить лекарство. У Хаким есть денег но еще не хватает, и он решил взять кредит для лечение брата. Хаким ждет поддержку с Вашей стороны.
texts.en:
Khakim is a resident of Isfara city. The people of Isfara city are honest, talented, hospitable and hardworking. They are constantly moving, in search of something new. 

Khakim is one of these people. He works as a home repair specialist. Khakim has been in this line of work for 8 years. His father worked in this sphere of business before, and Khakim decided to follow in his father's footsteps. Someone has to maintain the family business. 

Khakim is a family-oriented man. He has a wife and a small child. Khakim lives together with his mother, brother, wife, and child. Only Khakim works, and he provides for his family. His brother is ill and he needs treatment, and to buy medicine. 

Khakim has money, but it is not sufficient, and he has decided to take a loan for his brother's treatment. Khakim is waiting for your support.

loans.use: to get his brother medical treatment and to buy medicine.

loans.name: Yulduzhon

texts.ru: Турсунзаде красивый город, и жители активные, талантливые и жизнелюбивые. Молодая, шустрая девушка Юлдузхон. Ей всего 21 лет. Она тоже проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Юлдузхон как другие жители имеет свой собственный бизнес. Она занимается шитьем женской одежды. Юлдузхон любить заниматься таким видом деятельности. Она имеет ежедневный доход и постоянный клиент. Юлдузхон хочет приобрести мебель для дома. Они недавно отремонтировали дом, и хочет купить новый мебель для нового дома. По этой причине Юлдузхон просит кредит. Она верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Tursun-zoda is a beautiful city, and the residents are active, talented, and full of joie de vivre. Yulduzhon is a young, clever woman. She is only 21 years old. She also lives in Tursan-zoda city. 

Yulduzhon, like other residents, has her own business. She sews women's clothing. Yulduzhon loves working this line of business. She has a daily income and regular clients. 

Yulduzhon wants to buy furniture for her home. Her home was recently renovated, and she wants to buy new furniture for her new home. Thus, Yulduzhon is requesting a loan. She believes in you and your support.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her home.

loans.name: Maylene

texts.en:
Maylene is 42 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. Maylene works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, coffee, etc. She has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Maylene would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Raquita

texts.en:
Raquita is 61 years old and married with six children.

She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Raquita has been in this business for 17 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ma. Cristina

texts.en:
Ma. Cristina is 25 years old and married with two children. With both children in school, Ma. Cristina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack food and other groceries.

In the future, Ma. Cristina would like to save money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn has been helping her husband in working on their own farm to make a living. She has repaid successfully her previous loan used for organic fertilization of her farm. Her budget with her previous loan was not enough to cover the entire farm. So she took a new loan recently to buy additional organic fertilizer for her farm. She is hopeful of gaining more income from her farm for she has invested more capital in order to improve her farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely is 64 years old and widowed with two children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Mely is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetable seeds and fertilizers for her farm.

Mely has been farming vegetables for 40 years.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetable seeds and fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rosemarie works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling recycled materials. Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rowena works hard to support her family.

She has a beauty salon business in the Philippines and earns additional income from rice retailing. Rowena is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy materials like shampoo, cream, and conditioner and to maintain her beauty salon business.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials like shampoo, cream, and conditioner and to maintain her business.

loans.name: Nerrie

texts.en:
Nerrie is 33 years old and married with six children, five of whom are in school. Nerrie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell.

Nerrie has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Nerrie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene is a first-year student at Kepler. Due to his strong academic record, he was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year, and chose Kepler because he wants to earn an internationally competitive degree.

Rene plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate from Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. He doesn't have precise plans for his life after graduating, but he hopes to use the skills he develops at Kepler to succeed in business, or perhaps continue his education in graduate school.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Sharon Rose

texts.en:
Sharon Rose works hard to support her family. Sharon Rose is single and has a buy and sell of ready to wear business in the Philippines.

Sharon Rose requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of ready to wear like t-shirts, pants, dress, slippers, underwear, etc to sell.

Sharon Rose has been in this business for two years now and earns additional income from her beauty salon.

In the future, Sharon Rose would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready to wear like tshirts, pants, dresses, slippers, and underwear to sell.

loans.name: Amilyn

texts.en:
Amilyn is 40 years old and married with three children. Two of the children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Amilyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Amilyn has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Amilyn would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna works hard to support her family. Edna is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of vegetables to sell.

Edna has been in this business for 29 years now.

In the future, Edna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en: Geoffrey is a 30-year-old ambitious man with one child living in Masindi, Uganda. He deals in agriculture as his major source of income but also has a photo studio in order to earn a daily income. He is very passionate about photography and farming and he cannot help but keep on sharing his vision for his businesses. The loving father that he is, he desires to educate his child up to the University. Now that the new season has approached, he plans to expand his farming activities and diversify the nature of his crops so as to get more profits after harvesting. Geoffrey intends to use the loan to pay workers who will help him plough his garden and weed his crops.

loans.use: to pay workers who will help him plough his garden and weed his crops.

loans.name: Tayamika Group

texts.en:
Flora is 33 and is married to a field officer. She has three children and one orphan who depend on her. 

Flora owns a grocery store. She will use this loan to buy stock for her store such as cloth, baking powder and soap. Her family members help with the day-to-day activities of the business. 

She started the business so she can provide for the basic needs of her family. The profits help her feed her family three times a day. In a few years to come, Flora would like to buy a plot of land. She would also like to open a second location for the grocery store.

loans.use: to buy cloth, baking powder and soap.

loans.name: Changu Group

texts.en:
Chrissy is 35 years old and married. Her husband is a farmer. She has four children and one relative who depend on her.

Chrissy owns a grocery store. She would like to receive a loan to buy more sugar, salt, biscuits and soap for her store. Her family helps with the running of the business.

She started her business to become self dependent and to support her husband financially by buying food and paying school fees for her children. Chrissy hopes to open a big shop that will help her make more profits in the future.

loans.use: To buy more soap, salt, biscuits and sugar

loans.name: Malaina Group

texts.en:
Vaileti is 29 and married. Her husband is a farmer. She provides for her three children and one relative.

She sells kitchen utensils for a living. She is going to use this loan to buy more kitchen utensils for her business. One of her family members help with the running of the business.

Vaileti started her business so that she could assist her husband in supporting her family financially. The profits from the business will help her buy food and clothes for her family.

In a couple years to come, Vaileti aspires to expand her business and open a shop. She also hopes to use the profits from the kitchen utensil sales to support a new pig and goat rearing endeavor.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils to sell.

loans.name: Chiyanjano Group

texts.en:
Esnart is 39 years old and widowed. She is raising two children on her own.

She started a small restaurant which has now grown into a larger general store. She would like to get a loan to stock up her store by buying more sweets, sugar, and plastics. Her family helps with the running of the store.

Esnart started her business so she could support her family and be self-dependent. From her profits, she hopes to save more money so she can build a house and open another store in the future.

loans.use: to buy sweets, sugar, and plastics.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane works hard to support her family. Mary Jane is married and has a vegetable farming business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mary Jane has been in this business for three years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 45 years old and married with seven children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marites has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. Marites requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more clothing to sell.

Marites has been in this business for three years. In the future, Marites would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Pavlina

texts.en:
In front of Pavlina in the photograph, is a beehive.

Pavlina is a 41-year-old mother of three. Sixteen, 10 and 6 are the ages of her children. Sadly, the oldest child has been suffering lately from a deadly illness and receives a disability income of about $150/month. For the past eight years, she and her husband have been focusing on the bee business. Annually she sells approximately 60 kg at a price of 1200 all/kg; thus, earning about $1300. Her husband works for a monthly pay of $220. Despite the little earnings, their expenses are way more than the earnings, due to the medication needed for their ill son.

Pavlina wants to add a dairy cow and comments from her are that she very much will appreciate your financial help. " I need milk for my children, and up until now we have been buying it because i couldn't grow animals at home because i had to care about my son 24/7 and had no help from husband who works 7 days a week as well. However, now i have decided to have my own cow despite the timing and tardiness," said Pavlina to the loan officer.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow; her oldest child, a 16-yr-old, suffers from a deadly illness.

loans.name: Ernesto Eliseo

texts.es:
Ernesto agradece el apoyo que le da Padecomsm para mantener su negocio y mejorar las circunstancias económicas, está diversificando su negocio, atiende a nuevos clientes y brinda a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
Nuevamente solicita un financiamiento para invertirlo en abono, herbicidas e insecticidas, también podrá pagar obreros para limpiar el terreno en el que cultivara maíz está nueva temporada, espera mantener la continuidad de su negocio.
texts.en:
Ernesto is thankful for the support Padecomsm gives him to maintain his business and improve his financial circumstances. He is diversifying his business, serving new customers and offering his family a better standard of living.

He is asking for a loan again to invest in fertilizer, herbicide and insecticide. He will also pay to clear the land where he will grow corn this new season. He hopes to maintain the continuity of his business.

loans.use: to invest in fertilizer, herbicide and insecticide, as well as pay laborers to clear the land where he will grow corn this new season.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 40 years old. She is married and has four children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines.

Regina requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in the pig fattening business for five years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Regina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Miriam Del Carmen

texts.es:
Míriam, de 43 años de edad, está casada, es madre de 3 hijos, de los cuales solo 1 vive con ellos, estudio hasta sexto grado, no continuó sus estudios porque se dedicó a trabajar en la agricultura, para ayudar a sus padres porque eran de escasos recursos.

Míriam, se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería desde la edad de 12 años, trabajo que aprendió de sus padres y lo realiza junto a su esposo, optó por dedicarse a esta actividad porque no podía acceder a un empleo formal por su grado académico.

Míriam, utilizará el crédito para comprar 2 novillos de repasto, para cuidarlos y venderlos a buen precio para cancelar a tiempo el préstamo y de la ganancia espera cubrir algunas necesidades.

El sueño de Míriam, es seguir trabajando en la ganadería y la agricultura para obtener mejores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Míriam is 43 years old. She is married and the mother of 3 children. One of them lives with her. She went to school up to the sixth grade and didn't continue her education because she started to work in farming to help her parents because they were of low income.

Míriam has worked in farming and ranching since she was 12 years old. She learned the work from her parents and she does it with her husband. She decided to do this activity because she couldn't get a formal job due to her level of education.

Míriam will use the loan to buy 2 steers to graze, to care for them and sell them at a good price to pay off the loan. With the profits, she hopes to pay for some necessities.

Míriam's dream is to keep working with ranching and farming to obtain better income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy two steers to graze.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 40-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband sells fodder in a nearby village, where most of the people keep cattle in their houses for producing milk, beef and mutton, and for pulling carts. There is lot of demand for fodder for those people who keep cattle. His shop is situated in a poor community, and most of his customers take fodder on credit and do not pay for many days. Now his credit amount has gone past its limit, and even he cannot buy fresh fodder to sell.

Shaheen is poor woman and cannot sustain these kinds of irregularities in payments, because selling fodder is the only way of getting income for her family. Therefore, Shaheen has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy fodder to sell. From now on, her husband will avoid selling fodder on credit. She hopes that this loan will easily fill their deficiencies.

Shaheen is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy fodder for her husband's fodder selling shop.

loans.name: Ramon Alberto

texts.es: Ramon de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, el es un hombre muy trabajador quien busca la manera de poder sacar adelante a su familia por esa razon decidio hace 4 años poner un negocio de venta de lubricantes y repuestos para vehiculos y motos su negocio le genra buenas ganancias por esa razon puede solventar algunos gastos del hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas lubricantes y repuestos por mayor para poder seguir con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Ramon is 37 years old. He lives in a house that he owns with his partner and their two children.

Ramon is very hard-working and looks for the best possible way to move forward with his family. He therefore decided four years ago to open a business selling lubricants and spare parts for vehicles and motorcycles. This business provides Ramon with good profits and so he is able to cover some household costs.

Ramon is applying for a loan in order to buy lubricants and spare parts in bulk. He can thus continue with sales and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy lubricants and spare parts in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for her clothing store.

loans.name: Casa De Dios Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad del estado de Veracruz es célebre la historia de cómo los periodistas locales nombraron como “la novia del sol” a su ciudad natal. Para ellos, el clima caluroso durante todo el año se debe al amor que tiene el sol por su tierra. Por tal motivo, las familias acuden a balnearios o ríos y otros más compran su propia alberca para poder refrescarse de manera recreativa.
   En una de las colonias de dicha comunidad se integró un grupo llamado Casa de Dios cuyo nombre obedece a la fe que tienen sus miembros los cuales son: Guadalupe quien vende abarrotes; Benita, cosméticos, artículos de plata y tamales; Alida, zapatos, ropa y plata; Ruth, plata y cría de cerdos; Blanca L., estética; Aracely, ropa; José, fotografía; Odilia, cosméticos y comida típica; José Antonio y Josué, tacos y Blanca, zapatos.
   José Antonio es conocido por todos como Toño y por ser un padre ejemplar que ha cuidado solo de sus dos hijos. Para ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida, decidió emprender un negocio propio desde hace cuatro años; en la venta de tacos encontró la mejor oportunidad para cumplir sus metas. Asimismo se asoció con su sobrino y juntos han logrado enriquecer la taquería a tal grado que después de sólo vender 150 tacos al día, hoy venden en promedio de  400 a 500.
   Las ganancias obtenidas le han servido para, además de solventar los gastos familiares, comprar dos motos, una camioneta de carga y abrir otra taquería ubicada en un punto estratégico de la localidad. Por otro lado, uno de sus grandes sueños es “lograr una franquicia de tacos de tal manera que sean un patrimonio para mi familia” y agrega “gracias por cada préstamo en lo particular a mí me han sido de utilidad para lograr llegar hasta donde estoy”.
   Toño ha solicitado el préstamo con VF México para comprar: carne, cueritos, chiles, pepinos, cebolla, tortillas, gas, servilletas, vasos, bolsas y papel aluminio todo con el objetico de incrementar su producción.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el patio de Doña blanca, detrás se encuentra el salón de belleza de Blanca Isabel, Toño viste playera roja y porta cachucha gris con letras azules.
texts.en:
In a community in the state of Veracruz, the story of how the local journalists named their hometown as "la novia del sol" [the bride of the sun] is famous. For them, the warm climate throughout the year is due to the love that the sun has for their land. For this reason, families go to seaside resorts or rivers and others buy their own pool to be able to cool recreationally.

In one of the colonies of that community, a group called "Casa de Dios" [House of God] was formed, whose name is due to the faith their members have, which are Guadalupe, who sells groceries; Benita, cosmetics, silverware, and tamales; Alida, shoes, clothes, and silver; Ruth, silver and pig farming; Blanca L., aesthetics; Aracely, clothing; José, photography; Odilia, cosmetics and traditional food; José Antonio and Josué, tacos, and Blanca, shoes.

José Antonio is known by all as Toño and for being an exemplary father who has taken care of his two children by himself. To offer them a better quality of life, he decided to start his own business four years ago. In selling tacos, he found the best opportunity to achieve his goals. Also, he teamed up with his nephew and together they have managed to enrich the taco stand to such a degree that after selling only 150 tacos a day, today they sell on average 400 to 500.

Proceeds earned have helped him, in addition to cover the family expenses, to buy two motorcycles, a pickup truck, and open another taco stand located in a strategic point of the town. Moreover, one of his greatest dreams is to "achieve a taco franchise in such a way that is an asset to my family," and adds, "Thanks for each loan. Particularly to me, they have been useful to be able to get where I am."

Toño has requested the loan with VF Mexico to buy meat, pork skins, peppers, cucumbers, onions, tortillas, gas, napkins, cups, bags, and aluminum foil as means to increase his production.

*The photograph was taken in the courtyard of Blanca. Behind, there is Blanca Isabel's beauty salon. Toño wears a red shirt and a gray cap with blue letters.

loans.use: to buy meat, pork skins, peppers, cucumbers, onions, tortillas, gas, napkins, cups, bags, and aluminum foil.

loans.name: Hadijja

texts.en:
Hadijja is a resident of Kacukira, Kawempe Maganjo-Wakiso. She is a married woman with three children. She is a third-time borrower with Ugafode Microfinance Limited, and had previously been borrowing in group. Her main source of income is food vending, where she earns her living and gets money to cater for her family and pay school fees for her children.

She intends to start up a very small-scale restaurant which is positioned in one place, since the current mode of operation is tiresome. This is the reason for her requested a loan of 500,000 UGS, which she will use to rent a structure and also buy food items to sell.

loans.use: To pay rent and buy food items

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is married and lives in Clarin with her family. She earns a good income from her transportation business and has been able to support her child's education. She has also bought some home appliances from the income she has generated.

Ester's previous loan was used for maintenance of her vehicle, and it was repaid successfully. To make her services more comfortable and safe, she recently took out a new loan to purchase spare parts and accessories for her motorcycle, and to cover repair costs. She plans to use her profits to buy a sidecar to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for motorcycle repair.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
With the help of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) and lenders, Mercedes is able to buy fresh supplies of pork and chicken needed in her business. This has increased her revenue, as what she sells are surely fresh and quality meat products. The business is growing and she’s thankful to God for providing customers each day.

Customers who make late payments is the issue that most often affects her business revenue. Mercedes applied again for a loan of PHP 15,000 so that she will have additional funds to compensate for delayed payments, and she can still buy fresh pork and chicken to sell to customers. She works hard to be successful and to be able to provide for her family’s needs and household expenses.

Mercedes is consistent in attending a weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members, where she gains spiritual strength from members' life-changing testimony, shares her own experience of God’s love, pays Micro Finance loans, and hears God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies of pork and chicken needed in her business.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 36 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Amelita has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, personal care products, and school supplies.

In the future, Amelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Muyinga

texts.en:
Muyinga is an enterprising woman in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She grows cocoa but also buys from other farmers in order to meet the increasing demand for cocoa. She got involved in these businesses to earn income and meet increasing family demands.

Like most farmers in this area, she is challenged by bad weather and impassable roads when delivering cocoa to markets, and this sometimes leads to losses.

Muyinga's dream is to buy a pick-up truck to help her with transportation, and also to become one of the leading cocoa suppliers in the region. Her personal dream is to educate her children up to university level. Muyinga is requesting for a loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 47 years old. She is a widow and has five children.

Her business is farming mangoes and cow peas. She has been in the business for 30 years. She earns a monthly income of 5,000 Kenya shillings.

This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase a water tank. She will use the profits from her expanded business to open a grocery shop. Her hopes and dreams are to have a successful business and a happy family.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 44 years old. She is married and has three children. Her business is selling home products like stoves, flasks, pans and clothes.

She has been in the business for seven years. She earns a monthly income of 13,000 Kenya shillings.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase clothes, pans and stoves for sale. She will use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, pans and stoves for sale.

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
Remy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish nets and materials for boat repair for her fishing business.

Remy has been in this business for 10 years. Remy earns additional income from buying and selling crabs.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish nets and materials for boat repair.

loans.name: Alicia Ann

texts.en:
Alicia Ann works hard to support her family. Alicia Ann is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now.

She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net.

In the future, Alicia Ann would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 40 years old, married, and has six children who are all attending school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Nenita has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Nenita requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is 55 years old and married with six children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Ma. Luisa has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

Ma. Luisa has been in this business for thirty years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 43 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices and other ingredients for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Rosalie has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices and other ingredients for her business

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a permanent resident of Nabweru, Nansana – Wakiso district. He is a married man with one child. He is very innovative and hard working. He runs various productive projects and businesses, for example: a piggery project, cattle keeping, and Boda-Boda riding. These are his major sources of income, and he uses the earnings to meet all his personal and family needs.

He is a fourth-time borrower with Ugafode Micro Finance. His character around his neighborhood and places of work always gives us courage and an interest in serving him without any doubt.

Mr. John intends to boost his piggery project by buying more piglets, hence the need for a loan.

Pictured: John and the Ugafode credit officer (right to left) at one of his projects.

loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Khadeja

texts.en:
Khadeja is a married women and a mother of four children.

She started to sew some clothes in her house manually 15 years ago. Then, after the demand increased, she bought a tailoring machine to produce more clothes. Now she sew uniforms for some schools in Jenin City, so she needs to buy another tailoring machine. She will hire a new employee to meet the demands.

loans.use: to buy an extra tailoring machine.

loans.name: Edson-

texts.en:
Edson is married and has one child and two dependents living in Bundibugyo Uganda. The responsibility of looking after these three children solely rests on him.

He operates a barber shop in town and gets additional income from cocoa growing. He started the businesses in 2013 and the number of customers has since increased as he is among the few who can provide the service despite challenges of high cost of haircutting machines and electricity.

He dreams of expanding the business to other trading centers and being able to reap bigger profits. He used part of the profits from cocoa growing to buy the first two machines and for renting the premises, and he is now a proud owner of this prestigious investment.

Edson is seeking a loan to buy new haircutting machines and deodorants to use in his salon.

loans.use: to buy new haircutting machines and deodorants for his salon.

loans.name: Marian Joy

texts.en:
The previous loan that was granted to Marian Joy by CCT became a way to increase her business revenue as she was able to buy fresh vegetables. She was able to maintain a revolving fund to run the business. Marian Joy extends her warmest thanks to all the people who helped her with the loan.

Even though she cannot control the price hikes that often affect her business, she is grateful that there are still loyal customers patronizing her business.

Marian Joy wants to have added capital so she again applied for the loan of PHP 10,000. She will buy bulk quantities of fresh vegetables to expand her inventory. This will make her business earn more than previously.

She gives her best effort to make the business grow for she wants to have another branch in Libertad. She’s confident that God will lead her towards success.

Marian Joy regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to religious teachings. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social relationships with other partners, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables.

loans.name: Yllson

texts.en:
Yllson is 48 and has been operating a little bar-restaurant in his village for the past five years. The earnings of approximately $1,600 a year have been the only ones for the family of four, including 19- and 16-year-old children.

The family owns some agricultural land as well, yet every year the land gets flooded and the local government has never looked into this issue that some of the villagers have been dealing with for years. Until the government takes care of this matter, the lands will be useless to villagers. In some cases, all the plantations of villagers are flooded and the villagers loose all their money. There is no compensation for the damage.

Yllson must pay the tuition fees of his daughter, who goes to public university.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's university tuition fees.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is 31 years old and has two children, age 9 and 7. She is a hardworking entrepreneur.

She and her husband operate their jewelry shop. Her husband used to work in a shop as a jeweler or jewelry repair man with a minimum salary that was barely enough to support their needs. They decided to repair, buy and sell silver jewelry in their community as a sideline. Mylene did the selling in their neighborhood -- at first just a few silver bracelets and rings -- and rolled up their capital until they saved enough to rent a stall where they could put their jewelry.

Today, Mylene has a stall with two glass panes where she displays her jewelry. The shop is a big help in supporting their two children's educations and also helps in their everyday expenses. That is why Mylene and her husband work hard to continuously improve their business.

Mylene is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 25,000 to buy silver jewelry like bracelets, rings, earrings, chains and necklaces to increase her inventory now that the holidays are fast approaching, Mylene wants to take the opportunity to increase her sales since jewelry is a popular gift for holidays.

With the loan, she can increase her income as she increases her stocks to supply her customers' demands.

Mylene wants to maintain her business to help provide a better life for her family and especially for her children's educations.

loans.use: to buy silver jewelry like bracelets, rings, earrings, chains and necklaces and resell them in her store.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: Humberto es un comerciante de carne de res y cerdo muy conocido en un sector de Cartagena, él inició esta actividad para ofrecer el sustento a su familia conformada por su cónyuge y cinco hijos de los cuales dos son menores de edad. Al encontrarse desempleado consideró que desde la terraza de su vivienda tendría una oportunidad de negocio y que con un producto como la carne que hace parte de la canasta familiar conseguiría el éxito, desde entonces lleva en esta labor comercial ocho años, todos los días de la semana proveyendo carne a sus vecinos y transeúntes del sector.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en carne de res y cerdo para continuar sin contratiempos en su negocio.  Su meta a futuro es tener más clientes y un local donde pueda expender sus productos cárnicos.
texts.en: Humberto is a beef and pork salesman, well-known in a sector of Cartagena. He began this work to offer sustenance to his family, made up of his spouse and five children, of whom two are minors. Finding himself unemployed, he thought that from the patio of his house, he would have a business opportunity and that a product such as meat, which is a family pantry item, would bring him success. Since then, he has worked in this business for eight years. Every day of the week, he provides meat to his neighbors and passers-by in the area. Currently he is applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which he will invest in beef and pork to continue without breaks in his business. His goal for the future is to have more customers and a retail space where he can sell his meat products.

loans.use: to invest in beef and pork.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
A loan of 50,000 (ALL) that Fred is requesting from you will be used to install doors to the poorly built home as seen in the photograph. He is married and has three young children, including the 8-yr-old who is in the photo with his father.

Fred is 41 and for the past twenty years he's been doing agriculture/livestock and this has been the only source of income for the family in addition to a disability of Fred in an amount of $111/month.
Fred, at the moment, has a dairy cow and a male calf, 1 saw and some chickens in the agricultural land that his family owns. They rent it to others for a very little earning of $30 a year, mostly because Fred cannot do all the physical labour and in the rest they plant mostly oats and beans.

loans.use: to install doors to the poorly built home where his three young children live.

loans.name: Marta Elizabeth

texts.es:
Marta, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañada y su pareja es agricultor, tienen 4 hijos en edad escolar y son las únicas persona que depende económicamente de ellos, en su casa solo vive ella con su esposo y sus hijos.

Marta, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos maíz desde hace 18 años, está actividad la aprendió con su esposo, ella decidió dedicarse a este tipo de trabajo para ayudarle a su pareja a asegurar la alimentación de sus hijos, pero además de trabajar sus propios cultivos, también lava ropa ajena; para ir a sus cultivos y trabajarlos ella tiene que caminar 2.5 kilómetros desde su vivienda y sus hijos y su pareja le ayudan en esta labor.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar abono y pesticidas para su cultivo de maíz y frijol, esto le ayudara ha mantener sus cultivos sanos y robustos, ya que este año ha sido difícil cosechar debido a la sequía que afecto el país.

Marta, desea poder seguir cultivando la tierra que ha arrendado, ya que con esto podrá asegurar la alimentación y los ingresos para su familia, mejorando su calidad de vida y ayudando a que sus hijos sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
Marta went to school up to the sixth grade. She is partnered and her partner is a farmer. They have 4 school-aged children and they are the only people who depend economically on them. In her house only her partner and their children live with her.

Marta has worked growing basic grains and corn for 18 years. She learned this work with her partner, she decided to work in this type of job to help her partner assure the food for their children, but in addition to working their own crops, she also washes clothing for others. To go to her crops and work them, she has to walk 2.5 kilometers from her house and her children and partner help her with this work.

The loan will be used to purchase manure and pesticides for her corn and bean crops, this will help her to keep her crops healthy and robust, since this year it has been difficult to harvest due to the drought that has affected the country.

Marta wants to be able to continue cultivating the land she has rented, since with this she will be able to assure the food and income for her family, improving her quality of life and helping her children stay in school.

loans.use: to purchase manure and pesticides for her corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Juana De Dios

texts.es: Juana, tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y reside en una comunidad del municipio de Gracias, Lempira con sus hijos.  Anteriormente se dedicaba a trabajar en corte de café y hace año y medio estableció su propio negocio de venta de verduras, tajaditas de plátano, jabón, azúcar, arroz, y otros. Esta actividad la realiza en su casa y de manera ambulante. Está motivada por crecer con su negocio y ha decidido solicitar un prestamo por 5,000 Lempiras para invertirlo en la compra de ristras de tajaditas de plátano, un quintal de papas, tomates y habichuelas. Considera que tendrá más productos que ofrecer a sus clientes. Su plan es ver a sus hijos graduados, mejorar su casa y crecer con el negocio.
texts.en: Juana is 36 years old, a single mother who has 3 children and lives in a community in the municipality of Gracias, Lempira with her children. Previously, she worked harvesting coffee and a year and a half ago, she established her own business selling vegetables, plantain slices, ham, sugar, rice, and more. She does this work in her house and as a street vendor. She is motivated to grow her business and has decided to ask for a loan of 5,000 lempiras to invest in the purchase of strings of plantain slices, a quintal of potatoes, tomatoes and green beans. She thinks that she will have more products to offer her customers. Her plan is to see her children graduate, improve her house, and grow with her business.

loans.use: to purchase strings of plantain slices, a quintal of potatoes, tomatoes and green beans to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda continúa con su negocio de confección de tejidos artesanales hechos a mano. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de una máquina de tejer. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque pudo vender su mercadería. Actualmente su producción mejoró y ahora cuenta con nuevos diseños para ofertar, “con mi máquina de tejer aumenté el volumen de producción…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la producción mejoró y aumentó, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para la refacción de su taller de tejidos. Su sueño es construir su casa, ella desea refaccionar su taller de costura, arreglando el techo para que no filtre agua y arruine el negocio. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Yolanda solicita un préstamo para la refacción de su taller de tejido para que no entre agua por el techo.
texts.en:
Yolanda has been running a business making handmade fabrics for some time. She was able to use her previous loan to buy a sewing machine. Her repayments on the previous loan were punctual, she was able to sell her merchandise without any problems. In fact, her output has grown and Yolanda now offers new designs: "With my sewing machine I have increased my production levels.

Yolanda's dream is to build her own home. For now, Yolanda would like to fix up her sewing workshop by repairing the roof so that rain doesn't leak through and ruin everything.

This is Yolanda's second loan in the three years that she has been doing this work. Yolanda is seeking the loan in order to repair the workshop roof.

loans.use: to repair the workshop roof so that it stops leaking.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Barotac Viejo in Iloilo has a bordering sea on one side that provides many benefits to the people in the community. Helen, 55 years old, obtains her livelihood from the sea. She’s been selling fish at the town’s public market for ten years now. She has experienced all sorts of circumstances that affect her business, either positively or negatively, yet she remains strong. Somehow she understands the tendencies of the sea and its effect on the price of fish and seafood, and she knows how to adjust.

This rainy season, Helen knows that there are times when fish will be scarce. But there are also favorable days when fish will be abundant and cheap. She plans to seize those favorable days to buy volume of assorted fish and seafood. She needs PHP 17,000 additional capital that will sustain her business during rainy days. The income from this will continuously supply their everyday necessities and her child’s college expenses. In a year or two, her child will graduate from college and she will be relieved of huge expenses.

Her husband Antonio, also a vendor, shares her aspiration to improve their business and save more for their retirement.

Helen regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy volume of assorted fish and seafood

loans.name: Norma Coralia

texts.es:
Norma, estudio hasta tercer grado, debido a que sus padres no poseían la capacidad económica para ayudarle a seguir estudiando, actualmente está soltera y tiene cuatro hijos que viven con ella, dos de ellos estudian, uno trabaja y el más pequeño pasa en casa.

Norma, se dedica a vender tamales desde hace 10 años, su mamá fue quien le enseño a ganarse la vida de esa manera, porque su mamá tenía un negocio similar y desde que estaba muy pequeña le ayudaba, en la actualidad ella tiene su propio negocio con el cual se gana la vida honradamente, aparte de este negocio percibe ingresos por medio de la agricultura.- La venta de tamales la realiza por la tarde y camina aproximadamente 5 kilometros todos los días.

Norma, utilizará el crédito para comprar maíz, leña y hojas de huerta, ella espera mejorar su negocio y así  obtener mayores ingresos, para mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia.

Norma, sueña con ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales y con un buen empleo.
texts.en:
Norma studied up to 3rd grade because her parents did not have the financial capacity to help her keep studying. Currently, she is single and has 4 children that live with her. Two of them are in school, one works and the youngest stays at home.

Norma has sold tamales for a living for 10 years. Her mother taught her to earn a living this way, because she had a similar business, and Norma helped her from the time she was very young. She currently has her own business, from which she makes an honest living. Besides this business, she earns income from agriculture. She sells tamales in the afternoon and walks approximately 5 kilometers every day.

Norma will use the loan to buy corn, firewood and banana leaves. She hopes to improve her business and, in that way, get more income, in order to improve her living conditions and those of her familiy.

Norma dreams of seeing her children become professionals with a good job.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and banana leaves.

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es: María es una confeccionista empírica que aprendió desde niña esta profesión con la tutoría de su madre una ama de casa que realizaba labores de modistería a sus vecinas.  Hoy en día es la modista de confianza de cientos de habitantes de un barrio en Cartagena a quienes les ofrece de sus servicios todos los días de la semana desde su residencia y les confecciona todo tipo de prenda de vestir; camisas, pantalones, vestidos.  Hoy en día cuenta con veinte años en este oficio y gracias a ello ha podido ofrecer bienestar a su familia; ella está casada y es madre de tres hijos.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá insumos de modistería con los que mejorará su inventario, puesto que se aproximan las fiestas de fin de año y su demanda se incrementa.  Su meta a futuro es producir mucho más y realizarle adecuaciones a su vivienda para que este en mejores condiciones de habitabilidad.
texts.en: María is a self-taught seamstress who learned this trade when she was a girl with the instruction of her mother, a homemaker who did sewing tasks for her neighbors. Today, she is a trusted seamstress for hundreds of people in a neighborhood of Cartagena, to whom she offers her services every day of the week from her house and she sews all sorts of clothing for them: shirts, pants, dresses. Now, she has been in this trade for twenty years and, thanks to it, she has been able to offer her family well-being. She is married and the mother of three children. Currently he is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing that she has gotten from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will invest in sewing supplies with which she will improve her inventory, given that the end-of-the-year holidays are approaching and her demand increases. Her goal for the future is to produce much more and fix up her house so that it is in more habitable condition.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for sewing clothing.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is able to run her business without getting bothered of where get funds to buy her recipes for the food she sells. Because of the previous loan amounting to PHP 20,000, she has properly run her mini food stall business for the past six months. She really appreciates all the lenders who helped her with the loan. She was able to pay for their daily expenses because of the significant improvement on her business.

Now, she aspires to establish another business for her family so that she can save money for future purposes. But for now, she said that she will focus on how to earn more by making her present business grow. She applied for another loan of PHP 20,000 which will be used to buy raw ingredients needed in her food stall.

Despite being busy managing the business, Cecilia spares time attending CCT group fellowship that consist of 10-15 individuals where she can gain strength spiritually and where she hear testimonies from other CCT partners and able to hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional raw products needed for her stall.

loans.name: Anabele

texts.en:
Anabele is 44 years old, married and has two children. One of whom is in school. Anabele is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Anabele has been raising pigs for seven years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Anabele would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 33 years old married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase a bundle of fishing net, gasoline and bamboo.

Gina has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a bundle of fishing net, gasoline and bamboo.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Graciela; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de   elaboración de  tejidos a pedido como chompas, chalinas entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar lanas de colores ,hilos entre otros.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “IMASUMAC I” village bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco, and the state of Cusco.

The member's name is Graciela. She alternates her daily activities working at her business where she knits articles to order, such as sweaters and scarves, among other things, for her customers that order from her. The member has been in this business for some time now. Her business is going well, thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day. The member hopes to be able to continue working so she can continue supporting her family.

The member is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with her loan payments.

The member is requesting the loan to buy colored yarn, thread and other items.

loans.use: to buy colored yarn, thread and other items.

loans.name: Remedios Marcela

texts.es:
Remedios es una mujer de 61 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 28 años y una hija de 26 años, y su negocio es la venta de frazadas.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la feria ’16 de julio’ zona caracterizada por el comercio informal en todas las áreas, donde –se dice- se puede encontrar desde una aguja hasta un camión.
Remedios es de vestir tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), baja estatura y cabello largo trenzado. Su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la venta de frazadas, ella viaja cada semana a la frontera del país con Perú y compra frazadas por docena para revenderlas en las ferias, “viajo todo el tiempo a traer mercadería, las ventas varían según la temporada…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que el clima frio del lugar hace que las frazadas se vendan todo el año, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para la compra de frazadas por mayor. Su sueño es tener un puesto fijo de venta, ella desea comprar frazadas por mayor para venderlas en las ferias. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Remedios solicita un préstamo para la compra de frazadas por mayor para venderlas en las ferias.
texts.en:
Remedios is 61 years old and lives with her partner. She has one 28-year-old son and a 26-year-old daughter. Rememdios has a business selling blankets.

Remedios is enterprising, independent, and very hard-working. Her business is in the 16 de julio market, an area known for informal trade of all products. It is said that there you can find everything from a needle to a lorry.

Remedios dresses in traditional clothes (hat, poncho and skirt). She is short, and has long, plaited hair. Her native language is Aymara but she also speaks Spanish. Remedios shares her life with her husband. The couple lives in a house that they own made of bricks. The house has all basic services.

Remedios has a business selling blankets. Every week she travels to the Bolivian border with Peru where she buys blankets by the dozen to re-sell them at the market.

She says, "I travel all the time to bring merchandise. Sales vary according to the season."

One advantage for Remedios' business is the cold climate, which means that blankets can be sold all year round. The disadvantage is that Remedios lacks the capital to buy blankets in bulk.

Remedios' dream is to have a fixed shop. She wants to buy blankets in bulk to re-sell them at the markets.

This is Remedios' first loan with Emprender in the three years that she has had her business.

For the reasons described above, Remedios is applying for a loan in order to buy blankets in bulk to re-sell at the markets.

loans.use: to buy blankets to sell at markets.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris es una comerciante reconocida en un sector de Cartagena, ella cuenta con una amplia experiencia de diez años, ofreciendo un variado surtido en prendas de vestir y calzado.  Desde muy niña sintió inclinación por las ventas y en cuanto tuvo la oportunidad de acceder a un crédito para iniciar su propio negocio, no lo dudó, desde entonces su labor se ha traducido en beneficio para su familia, conformada por su cónyuge y sus tres hijos de los cuales aún uno es menor de edad.  Doris es muy comprometida con su trabajo, diariamente promueve ventas ente sus amigos, conocidos y familiares a quienes les exhibe sus productos en sus domicilios, y como estamos próximos a la temporada más alta en ventas del año, ella está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en nuevo surtido de prendas de vestir y calzado a menor precio.  Con esta inversión podrá comprar nuevas colecciones que activaran sus ventas.  Su meta a futuro es tener un almacén y continuar ayudándole en los estudios profesionales de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Doris is a recognized merchant in one sector of Cartagena. She has ample experience, of ten years, offering a varied assortment of clothing and footwear. As a child she felt drawn to sales and when she had the opportunity to access credit to start her own business, she did not hesitate.

Since then her work has brought benefits to her family, which consists of her spouse and three children, not one of whom is a minor. Doris is very committed to her work, every day she promotes her sales among her friends, acquaintances and relatives, to whom she exhibits her products in their homes.

As we near the peak of the yearly sales season, she is applying for her first Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to invest in a new assortment of clothing and shoes at lower prices. With this investment, she can buy from new collections to bolster her sales. Her goal for the future is to have a store and to continue to help her children in their professional studies.

loans.use: to invest in a new assortment of clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita has always an enthusiasm for farming. She has cultivated her land in Alegria, Lopez Jaena and has had good earnings doing this type of work.

Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the field is ready for planting. Anita knows that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 65 years old and is married with seven children. For the past 20 years, she has been a farmer who keeps poultry. Regina earns a monthly income of 8,000 KES.

Regina is requesting a loan through VisionFund Kenya to purchase goats and chickens. She will use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Regina hopes and dreams of having a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase goats and chickens

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. As a farmer in Alegria, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, she tried her luck and borrowed a loan to jump start her rice production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Evangeline feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business.

Recently, she requested a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Evangeline wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply rice in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer.

loans.name: Arayik

texts.en:
Arayik is from the Ararat region. He is not married and lives with his parents who are elderly and retired. Arayik provides the income for his family. For the past two years, he has been driving a taxi and he has been able to gather a loyal client base. Besides taxi driving, Arayik also runs his family farm where he grows tomatoes and watermelon. 

Arayik is requesting a loan to renovate his car, repair his transmission and battery, as well as purchase fertilizer for his farm. His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international that provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to renovate his car, repair his transmission and battery, and purchase fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 41 years old with 4 children and a hardworking entrepreneur.

Jocelyn operates her sari-sari store (small grocery store) in order to help her husband, a carpenter, to provide for their everyday expenses. They still have 2 children in school and her husband's salary is not enough to support their education. Jocelyn's store has been a big help in helping with their expenses. Because of that, Jocelyn strives to make her store grow and continuously gain an income.

Jocelyn is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to buy 10 boxes of laundry soap, detergent powder, fabric conditioner, 5 cases of soft drinks, canned goods and other items she can sell in her store.

Jocelyn wanted to buy laundry soap in bulk to sell in her store since laundry soap are a frequently bought item in her store. She wanted to take the opportunity to sell more soap while there are more customers asking for it.

Jocelyn is working hard managing her store to help with her everyday needs and most of all to help support her children in their education.

loans.use: to buy 10 boxes of laundry soap, detergent powder, fabric conditioner, 5 cases of soft drinks,  canned goods and other items she can sell in her store.
